original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa yin la de mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa nas rgyas par mi mthun pa'i bar ma yin pa yang yod de /üîΩsdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis bsdus pa'i 'du byed rnams ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa yin la de mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa nas rgyas par mi mthun pa'i bar ma yin pa yang yod de / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis bsdus pa'i 'du byed rnams ma gtogs pa /
translated: There are also formations that are not unpleasant, up to and not incompatible with the truth of suffering.üîΩThey are formations that are not included in the truth of suffering,

original: de las gzhan pa 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis bsdus pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis bsdus pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
translated: but are included in the truth of the origin,

original: bcom @233a * //
analyzed: bcom @233a * //
translated: the truth of the origin is explained in eight aspects:

original: ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the suffering of birth, the suffering of aging, and so on, up to the suffering of not obtaining what one desires.üîΩIn brief, the five appropriated aggregates are suffering.

original: rgyas par mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyi rnam pa brgyad kyis rnam par dbye ba mdzad pa de la rnam pa du dag gis sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan la /
analyzed: rgyas par mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyi rnam pa brgyad kyis rnam par dbye ba mdzad pa de la rnam pa du dag gis sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan la /
translated: How many of these aspects are taught by the suffering of suffering?

original: du dag gis ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan /
analyzed: du dag gis ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan /
translated: How many of these are the suffering of suffering?üîΩHow many are the suffering of change?

original: du dag gis ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan ce na /
analyzed: du dag gis ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan ce na /
translated: How many are the suffering of the formative forces?

original: dang po lngas ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: dang po lngas ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
translated: The first five are the suffering of suffering.

original: bar ma gnyis kyis ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: bar ma gnyis kyis ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan te /
translated: The middle two are the suffering of change.

original: sdug pa dang bral bas ni mi sdug pa dang phrad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral bas ni mi sdug pa dang phrad par 'gyur la /
translated: Separation from what is pleasant is the suffering of encountering what is unpleasant.

original: 'dod pas phongs pa ni ma thob pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs pa ni ma thob pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The suffering of not obtaining what one longs for is the suffering of change due to the non-acquisition of what is not already acquired.

original: tha ma mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba gcig pus ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //üîΩgang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal yang yin la /üîΩgang sdug bsngal ba de yang mi rtag pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: tha ma mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba gcig pus ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to // gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal yang yin la / gang sdug bsngal ba de yang mi rtag pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: The last one is the suffering of the formative forces, in brief, because it is said that the five aggregates of clinging are suffering.üîΩIs everything impermanent suffering?üîΩOr is everything suffering that is impermanent?

original: re zhig sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de mi rtag pa'ang yin mod kyi /
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de mi rtag pa'ang yin mod kyi /
translated: Everything that is suffering is also impermanent.üîΩBut there are also impermanent things that are not suffering.

original: mi rtag pa yin la sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin la sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is that which is impermanent but not suffering.

original: 'di lta ste lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: It is like the truth of the path.

original: 'di ltar lam ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas bsdus pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar lam ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas bsdus pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The path is not included in the feeling of suffering.

original: lam ni 'gyur ba yang ma yin na /
analyzed: lam ni 'gyur ba yang ma yin na /
translated: If the path is not subject to change,üîΩhow could it generate suffering through change?

original: 'gyur bas sdug bsngal bskyed par lta ga la 'gyur ba dang / lam ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad las rnam par grol ba dang / skye ba'i rgyun thams cad dang mi mthun pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'gyur bas sdug bsngal bskyed par lta ga la 'gyur ba dang / lam ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad las rnam par grol ba dang / skye ba'i rgyun thams cad dang mi mthun pa yin pas /
translated: The path is completely liberated from all the negative tendencies that are in accord with the side of affliction, and it is incompatible with the entire continuum of birth.

original: des na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not suffering due to the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: gang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba de thams cad stong pa dang bdag med pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba de thams cad stong pa dang bdag med pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is everything that is impermanent and suffering also empty and selfless?

original: de lta yin no zhes brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: de lta yin no zhes brjod par bya'o ;
translated: You should say that is so.

original: / stong pa dang / bdag med pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: / stong pa dang / bdag med pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are all that is empty and without self the same as impermanent and suffering?

original: de la kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni rnam pa bzhi char ro //
analyzed: de la kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni rnam pa bzhi char ro //
translated: The truth of origination is all four aspects.

original: lam gyi bden pa yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The truth of the path is also three aspects.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: The truth of cessation is only two aspects.

original: mi @233b rtag pa yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi @233b rtag pa yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is neither impermanent nor suffering.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are all that is impermanent and suffering the same as impermanent?

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal ba yang yod /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal ba yang yod /
translated: There is that which is suffering because of impermanence.

original: rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba yang yod de //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba yang yod de //
translated: There is that which is suffering by nature.

original: 'du byed gang dag 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba de dag ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed gang dag 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba de dag ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: Those formations that are suffering because of the suffering of change are suffering because of impermanence.

original: gang dag sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba de dag ni rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dag sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba de dag ni rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba yin te /
translated: Those that are suffering due to the suffering of suffering and the suffering of contaminated formations are naturally suffering.

original: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro /üîΩsdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang yin pa de kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang yin pa de kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yang yin la /
translated: Because they are by nature harmful and they abide in suffering.üîΩIs that which is the truth of suffering also the truth of origin?

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gang yin pa de yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin nam zhe na /üîΩre zhig kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang yin mod kyi /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gang yin pa de yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin nam zhe na / re zhig kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang yin mod kyi /
translated: That which is the truth of origin is indeed the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin la de kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin la de kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: But there is also the truth of suffering that is not the truth of origin.

original: dgra bcom pa'i rgyud rnam par dag pa las byung ba 'jig rten pa'i chos dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa thams cad dang / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'bras bur gyur pa rnam par smin par bsdus pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rgyud rnam par dag pa las byung ba 'jig rten pa'i chos dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa thams cad dang / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'bras bur gyur pa rnam par smin par bsdus pa thams cad dang /
translated: All mundane virtues and all neutral states that arise from the pure continuum of an arhat,

original: da ltar byung ba skyes bu'i byed pa las skyes pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed lung du ma bstan pa thams cad de /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba skyes bu'i byed pa las skyes pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed lung du ma bstan pa thams cad de /
translated: all neutral states that are results of ordinary beings, and all neutral formations that occur in the present life and arise from the actions of a person, whether they are pleasant, painful, or neither pleasant nor painful,

original: de ltar 'du byed de dag thams cad ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kho nas bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'du byed de dag thams cad ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kho nas bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: all of these formations should be seen as included in the truth of suffering alone.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos gang dag yang 'byung ba'i srid pa sun 'byin cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos gang dag yang 'byung ba'i srid pa sun 'byin cing /
translated: Those mundane phenomena that counteract the existence of rebirth,

original: de la mi phyogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam skyed par byed pa de dag ci'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pas bsdus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi phyogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam skyed par byed pa de dag ci'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pas bsdus pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they subsumed by the truth of origin?

original: de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis yang 'byung ba'i srid pa las mi phyogs pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis yang 'byung ba'i srid pa las mi phyogs pa yin mod kyi /
translated: They are not by nature averse to the existence of origin.

original: 'on kyang yang 'byung ba pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa dang / rjes su mthun pa yin pas de'i phyir de dag kyang kun 'byung ba'i bden pas @234a * //üîΩbsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang yang 'byung ba pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa dang / rjes su mthun pa yin pas de'i phyir de dag kyang kun 'byung ba'i bden pas @234a * // bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: However, they are compatible with the good conduct of body, speech, and mind that is conducive to origin, and therefore they are subsumed by the truth of origin.

original: gang gi tshe yang 'byung ba pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad mtshan nyid las kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin pa'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir sred pa kho na gdags pa mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang 'byung ba pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad mtshan nyid las kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin pa'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir sred pa kho na gdags pa mdzad ce na /
translated: When all karma and affliction that is conducive to origin is the truth of origin by nature, why did the BhagavƒÅn designate craving alone as the truth of origin?

original: sred pa de ni nye bar len pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / las kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / dngos po la khyab par byed pa yang yin la /
analyzed: sred pa de ni nye bar len pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / las kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / dngos po la khyab par byed pa yang yin la /
translated: This craving is the instigator of the clingings, the instigator of the actions, and the pervader of the entities.

original: de skye ba na gnod pa rnam pa bco lnga rgyas par byed pa la yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba na gnod pa rnam pa bco lnga rgyas par byed pa la yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And when it arises, it causes the increase of the fifteen kinds of harm.

original: de la ji ltar yang 'byung ba pa yin pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang de dang der mngon par dga' ba yang yin pa de ltar dngos po la khyab par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar yang 'byung ba pa yin pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang de dang der mngon par dga' ba yang yin pa de ltar dngos po la khyab par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‚Äúpervader of the entities‚Äù because it is the craving for the future, because it is associated with the attachment to pleasure, and because it delights in this and that.

original: de la yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The craving for the future is twofold:

original: yang 'byung ba la dmigs pa dang / yang 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba la dmigs pa dang / yang 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: that which has the future as its object and that which is the cause of the future.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa ni yul yid du 'ong ba thob pa dag la yongs su longs spyod pa'am /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa ni yul yid du 'ong ba thob pa dag la yongs su longs spyod pa'am /
translated: The craving associated with the attachment to pleasure is the enjoyment of the attainment of a desirable object.

original: mi 'bral zhing yun ring du gnas pa nyid du sred pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩde dang der mngon par dga' ba ni yul ma 'thob pa 'dod pa dag dang phrad pa'am /
analyzed: mi 'bral zhing yun ring du gnas pa nyid du sred pa gang yin pa'o // de dang der mngon par dga' ba ni yul ma 'thob pa 'dod pa dag dang phrad pa'am /
translated: craving for non-separation and for duration.üîΩCraving for union is the desire for union with the object not yet obtained.

original: phyir zhing 'byung bar sred pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir zhing 'byung bar sred pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Craving for enjoyment is the desire for the object already obtained to remain as it is, or to increase.

original: sred pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad yang 'byung ba pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad yang 'byung ba pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba yin zhe na /
translated: All these cravings are craving for existence, craving for enjoyment, and craving for union.

original: mu bzhi ste /üîΩsred pa yin la yang 'byung ba pa yang ma yin /üîΩdga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste / sred pa yin la yang 'byung ba pa yang ma yin / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: There are four alternatives:üîΩThere is craving which is not craving for existence,üîΩnot craving for enjoyment,

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba yang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba yang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: not craving for union.

original: gong ma'i rnam par thar pa la 'dod cing smon pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i rnam par thar pa la 'dod cing smon pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the desire and aspiration for the higher liberation.

original: yang 'byung ba pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba yin la /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba yin la /
translated: There is craving for existence, craving for enjoyment, craving for union,

original: sred pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: sred pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: but not craving.

original: yang 'byung ba pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa de dang / de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa de dang / de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang /
translated: It is also associated with the feeling, perception, intention, contact and attention that are associated with the other defilements.

original: ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'o //
translated: It is also associated with ignorance.

original: sred pa de nyid rnam pa gsum yin pa ni mu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa de nyid rnam pa gsum yin pa ni mu gsum pa'o //
translated: The third alternative is that craving is of three types.

original: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa yin par blta bar bya'o /üîΩ@234b yang 'byung ba pa'i srid pa gang yin pa de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa yin par blta bar bya'o / @234b yang 'byung ba pa'i srid pa gang yin pa de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang yin la /
translated: The fourth alternative is that it is not associated with any of these modes.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa gang yin pa de yang 'byung ba pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa gang yin pa de yang 'byung ba pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is existence that is associated with the craving that is accompanied by the delight and attachment of one who delights in this or that also associated with the craving that is accompanied by the delight and attachment of one who delights in this or that?üîΩOr, is that which is associated with the craving that is accompanied by the delight and attachment of one who delights in this or that also associated with existence?

original: re zhig dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni yang 'byung ba pa yang yin mod kyi yang 'byung ba pa yin la dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: re zhig dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni yang 'byung ba pa yang yin mod kyi yang 'byung ba pa yin la dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: Craving that is accompanied by joy is also craving for renewed existence, but there is craving for renewed existence that is not accompanied by joy.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa'i sred pa dang / 'bral bar sred pa dang / mi phrad par sred pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa'i sred pa dang / 'bral bar sred pa dang / mi phrad par sred pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is craving that is accompanied by affliction and mental dissatisfaction, craving for separation, and craving for non-contact.

original: yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa gang yin pa de de dang der mngon par dga' ba yang yin la de dang der mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa gang yin pa de de dang der mngon par dga' ba yang yin la de dang der mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de yang /
translated: Craving for renewed existence is also delighting in this and that, and delighting in this and that is also craving for renewed existence.

original: yang 'byung ba pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is craving for renewed existence also delighting in this and that?

original: re zhig de dang der mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de ni yang 'byung ba pa yin mod kyi yang 'byung ba pa yin la de dang der mngon par dga' ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: re zhig de dang der mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de ni yang 'byung ba pa yin mod kyi yang 'byung ba pa yin la de dang der mngon par dga' ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: Delight in this and that is also craving for renewed existence, but there is craving for renewed existence that is not delighting in this and that.

original: yang 'byung ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which focuses on the elements and the craving that is associated with the attachment of pleasure.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa gang yin pa de /üîΩde dang der mngon par dga' ba yang yin la de dang der mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa gang yin pa de / de dang der mngon par dga' ba yang yin la de dang der mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de yang /
translated: The second is the craving which is associated with the attachment to pleasure.üîΩThe craving which is associated with the attachment to pleasure is also the delight in this and that.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang yin nam zhe na ;
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang yin nam zhe na ;
translated: But is the delight in this and that also the craving which is associated with the attachment to pleasure?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: yul yid du 'ong ba thob pa dag la yongs su spyod par sred pa ni mu dang po'o //
analyzed: yul yid du 'ong ba thob pa dag la yongs su spyod par sred pa ni mu dang po'o //
translated: The first is the craving to enjoy the objects which are pleasant and which have been obtained.

original: yid du 'ong ba ma 'ongs pa thob par ma nges pa de dag nyid la sred pa ni mu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ma 'ongs pa thob par ma nges pa de dag nyid la sred pa ni mu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the craving for the pleasant objects which have not been obtained and which are not certain to be obtained.

original: de dag nyid 'thob par nges pa dag la sred pa ni mu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid 'thob par nges pa dag la sred pa ni mu gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the craving for the pleasant objects which are certain to be obtained.

original: rnam pa de dag las ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag las ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The fourth alternative is the craving which does not correspond to these three modes.üîΩThe craving which is associated with the attachment to pleasure is also the delight in this and that.üîΩBut is the delight in this and that also the craving which is associated with the attachment to pleasure?

original: gang 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa de gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa de gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa yang yin la /
translated: Those who possess a feeling associated with the desire realm also possess a feeling associated with the form realm.

original: gang gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa de yang 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa de yang 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: But do those who possess a feeling associated with the form realm also possess a feeling associated with the desire realm?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan la /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan la /
translated: There are those who possess a feeling associated with the desire realm

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang mi ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang mi ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: but do not possess a feeling associated with the form realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba de'i gnyen po gzugs na spyod pa ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba de'i gnyen po gzugs na spyod pa ma thob pa'o //
translated: This refers to those born and existing in the desire realm who have not obtained the antidote to the desire realm that is experienced in the form realm.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan la /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan la /
translated: There are those who possess a feeling associated with the form realm

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang mi ldan pa yang @235a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang mi ldan pa yang @235a * //
translated: but do not possess a feeling associated with the desire realm.

original: yod de / gang gzugs kyi khams su skyes shing 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yod de / gang gzugs kyi khams su skyes shing 'byung ba'o //
translated: This refers to those born and existing in the form realm.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang yang ldan la /
translated: There are those who possess a feeling associated with the desire realmüîΩand also possess a feeling associated with the form realm.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: There are those who possess the feeling of the form realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing 'byung ba de'i gnyen po gzugs na spyod pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing 'byung ba de'i gnyen po gzugs na spyod pa thob pa'o //
translated: They are those born in the desire realm who obtain the antidote to the form realm.

original: gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: There are those who do not possess either.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa dang / 'phags pa bya ba byas pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la gnas pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa dang / 'phags pa bya ba byas pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la gnas pa /
translated: They are those born in the formless realm, ƒÅryas who have completed their actions and abide on the supramundane path,

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dag tu skyes shing byung ba dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dag tu skyes shing byung ba dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: those born in the desire realm and form realm, and those who enter the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba ni mu bzhi ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba ni mu bzhi ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Just as there are four possibilities for possessing the feeling of the desire realm and the form realm, so too there are four possibilities for possessing the feeling of the desire realm and the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i mu bzhi yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //üîΩ'dod pa'i yon tan gang dag yin pa de dag nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa dag kyang yin la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / gzugs dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i mu bzhi yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o // 'dod pa'i yon tan gang dag yin pa de dag nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa dag kyang yin la /
translated: feeling associated with the formless realm, feeling associated with the desire realm and not associated with the desire realm, feeling associated with the form realm, feeling associated with the formless realm, and feeling associated with the formless realm and not associated with the formless realm.üîΩAre those that are sense objects of desire also desires that have the fault of being a problem?

original: nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan dag yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan dag yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are those that are desires that have the fault of being a problem also sense objects of desire?üîΩHe says,

original: smras pa / mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities:

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan yin la nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa ma yin pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan yin la nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa ma yin pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are sense objects of desire that are not desires that have the fault of being a problem.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par kun du spyod nus pa'i 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par kun du spyod nus pa'i 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
translated: The five sense objects that are not defiling and that are used for livelihood, strength, happiness, and the absence of wrongdoing.

original: bde ba la reg par gnas pa nyid kyis tshangs par spyod pa la phan pa dang / lam gyi tshogs dang / dge ba nye bar stsogs pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba dag go //
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas pa nyid kyis tshangs par spyod pa la phan pa dang / lam gyi tshogs dang / dge ba nye bar stsogs pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba dag go //
translated: They are used for the benefit of pure conduct, for the accumulation of the path, and for the accumulation of virtue.

original: nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa dag yin la /
analyzed: nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa dag yin la /
translated: They are also used for the faults of the disadvantages.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan ma yin pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan ma yin pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are also sense objects that are not sense pleasures.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang dag gcig tu mi 'dod pa nyid dang / mi sdug pa nyid dang / mi dga' ba nyid dang / yid du mi 'ong ba nyid kyi phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba rnams @235b dang ;
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang dag gcig tu mi 'dod pa nyid dang / mi sdug pa nyid dang / mi dga' ba nyid dang / yid du mi 'ong ba nyid kyi phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba rnams @235b dang ;
translated: They are the forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects that are used because they are completely undesirable, ugly, unpleasant, and disagreeable.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
translated: They are used for the afflictions that are sense pleasures.

original: nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa yang yin la 'dod pa'i yon tan yang yin pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa yang yin la 'dod pa'i yon tan yang yin pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are also those that are both faults and also objects of desire.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par kun du spyod mi nus la /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par kun du spyod mi nus la /
translated: They are forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects that cannot be enjoyed without being defiled.

original: 'dod pa nyid dang / sdug pa nyid dang / dga' ba nyid dang / yid du 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //üîΩ'dod pa'i yon tan yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa nyid dang / sdug pa nyid dang / dga' ba nyid dang / yid du 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o // 'dod pa'i yon tan yang ma yin la /
translated: They become objects of desire, of what is lovely, of what is pleasing, and of what is attractive.üîΩThere are also those that are not objects of desire,

original: nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa ma yin pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa ma yin pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: but are faults and also objects of desire.

original: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / gzhi thams cad do //
analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / gzhi thams cad do //
translated: They are the defilements associated with the form and formless realms, and all the bases.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan las dgongs nas /üîΩkun rtog 'dod chags skyes bu'i 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes dmigs kyi skyon dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan las dgongs nas / kun rtog 'dod chags skyes bu'i 'dod pa yin //
translated: The Blessed One, intending the faults and also the objects of desire,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: said, ‚ÄúThe desire of a person is a conceptual thought that is born from passion.‚Äù

original: sred pa gsum po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: sred pa gsum po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: Those three kinds of craving, in brief,

original: rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: The craving is twofold:

original: dang po ni sred pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni sred pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: the first is the craving for craving;

original: gnyis ni longs spyod kyi sred pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni longs spyod kyi sred pa'o //
translated: the second is the craving for enjoyment.

original: de la longs spyod kyi sred pa ni sred pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la longs spyod kyi sred pa ni sred pa nyid de /
translated: The craving for enjoyment is craving itself.

original: longs spyod thob pa dang / ma thob pa'i gnas kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: longs spyod thob pa dang / ma thob pa'i gnas kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: It is twofold, according as it is the craving for the acquisition of enjoyment or the craving for the enjoyment of what has been acquired.

original: sred pa de dag kyang khams kyi rab tu dbye bas ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / gzugs kyi sred pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa de dag kyang khams kyi rab tu dbye bas ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / gzugs kyi sred pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o //
translated: These two cravings are threefold according to the division of the realms of existence: craving for the realm of desire, craving for the realm of form, and craving for the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yang 'byung ba mngon par 'dod pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yang 'byung ba mngon par 'dod pa /
translated: The craving for the realm of desire is the desire of one who is born in the realm of desire for the objects of desire of the realm of desire.

original: longs spyod thob pa dag gis dga' ba ma thob pa dag la mngon par mi dga' ba'i sred pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i sred pa yin no //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'am /
analyzed: longs spyod thob pa dag gis dga' ba ma thob pa dag la mngon par mi dga' ba'i sred pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i sred pa yin no // 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'am /
translated: It is the craving of one who is not satisfied with the enjoyment of objects that he has acquired, and who is dissatisfied with the objects that he has not acquired.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: The craving for the realm of form is the desire of one who is born in the realm of desire or in the realm of form for the objects of desire of the realm of form.

original: gzugs na spyod pa yang 'byung ba mngon par 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa thob pas dga' ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par gzhan dag 'thob pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi sred pa yin no //üîΩgzugs kyi sred pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa yang 'byung ba mngon par 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa thob pas dga' ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par gzhan dag 'thob pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi sred pa yin no // gzugs kyi sred pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: The craving for the form realm is the craving for the pleasure of the desire for the manifestation of the elements in the form realm, the craving for the pleasure of the attainment of the meditative concentration of the form realm, and the craving for the pleasure of the attainment of the other special meditative concentrations of the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i sred pa yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //üîΩyang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa de nyid rtag pa dang chad par lta ba la brten nas @236a * //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i sred pa yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o // yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa de nyid rtag pa dang chad par lta ba la brten nas @236a * //
translated: The craving for the formless realm should be understood in the same way as the craving for the form realm, as appropriate.

original: 'byung bar sred pa dang / 'jig par sred par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'byung bar sred pa dang / 'jig par sred par 'gyur bas /
translated: That very craving for existence, based on the views of eternalism and annihilationism, becomes the craving for becoming and the craving for cessation.

original: de'i phyir sred pa de ni dngos po la khyab par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sred pa de ni dngos po la khyab par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that craving is called the ‚Äúpervading of things.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na sred pa skye ba na gnod pa rnam pa bco lnga rgyas par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sred pa skye ba na gnod pa rnam pa bco lnga rgyas par byed ce na /
translated: How does craving, when it arises, pervade the fifteen kinds of harm?

original: bag la nyal brtan par byed pa dang / kun nas dkris pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / sems kyi rgyud dmigs pa la phyin ci log tu 'jug par byed pa dang / nye bar len pas bsdus pa de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'dren par byed pa dang /
analyzed: bag la nyal brtan par byed pa dang / kun nas dkris pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / sems kyi rgyud dmigs pa la phyin ci log tu 'jug par byed pa dang / nye bar len pas bsdus pa de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'dren par byed pa dang /
translated: It is the basis of all afflicted states, it stabilizes latent states, it afflicts the mind and mental factors through its entwinement, it causes the mindstream to engage its focal object in a distorted manner, it induces other afflictions subsumed by the appropriated aggregates,

original: rang gi rgyun gnas par byed pa dang ; sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skye ba dang mthun par 'gyur ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang mthun par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skye ba'i bar chad byed pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi rgyun gnas par byed pa dang ; sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skye ba dang mthun par 'gyur ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang mthun par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skye ba'i bar chad byed pa dang /
translated: it causes one's continuum to endure, it accords with the generation of nonvirtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen, it accords with the increase and expansion of nonvirtuous phenomena that have already arisen, it obstructs the generation of virtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen,

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba'i bar chad byed pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod pas ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal dang / kun du sbyor bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba'i bar chad byed pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod pas ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal dang / kun du sbyor bar byed pa dang /
translated: It is the obstacle to the endurance of virtuous phenomena that have arisen, to their non-forgetting, to their arising again, to their increase and expansion.üîΩIt is the cause of the suffering of the lower realms through the performance of misdeeds.üîΩIt is the cause of the suffering of birth, aging, and sickness through the desire for rebirth and the desire for it to occur again.

original: yang 'byung bar 'dod pas skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang kun du sbyor bar byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag par byed pa dang / 'khor ba la yon tan dang phan yon du log par 'dzin pas dga' bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: yang 'byung bar 'dod pas skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang kun du sbyor bar byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag par byed pa dang / 'khor ba la yon tan dang phan yon du log par 'dzin pas dga' bar byed pa dang /
translated: It is the cause of the suffering of sorrow and lamentation through the fear of nirvana and the delight in samsara through the mistaken belief that it has good qualities and benefits.

original: 'khor ba la ji lta ba bzhin du yul rnams la yang de bzhin pa dang / bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir sems par byed pa nas rgyas par de dang 'byung ba'i sems las byung ba'i yid mi bde ba so sor myong bar byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //üîΩ'du byed nye bar zhi ba gang yin pa de 'gog pa'i bden pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba la ji lta ba bzhin du yul rnams la yang de bzhin pa dang / bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir sems par byed pa nas rgyas par de dang 'byung ba'i sems las byung ba'i yid mi bde ba so sor myong bar byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no // 'du byed nye bar zhi ba gang yin pa de 'gog pa'i bden pa yang yin la /
translated: Just as it is for cyclic existence, so it is for objects, and because it harms oneself and others, it is as explained in the sutras from ‚Äúit thinks‚Äù up to ‚Äúit experiences mental dissatisfaction that arises from that.‚ÄùüîΩThe pacification of formations is the truth of cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa gang yin pa de yang 'du byed nye bar zhi ba yin nam zhe na /üîΩre zhig 'gog pa'i bden pa gang yin pa de 'du byed nye bar zhi ba yang yin mod kyi 'du byed nye bar zhi ba yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa gang yin pa de yang 'du byed nye bar zhi ba yin nam zhe na / re zhig 'gog pa'i bden pa gang yin pa de 'du byed nye bar zhi ba yang yin mod kyi 'du byed nye bar zhi ba yin la /
translated: Is the truth of cessation also the pacification of formations?üîΩThe truth of cessation is the pacification of formations.

original: de 'gog pa'i bden pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de 'gog pa'i bden pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: But there is the pacification of formations that is not the truth of cessation.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pas 'du byed rnams nye bar @236b zhi ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pas 'du byed rnams nye bar @236b zhi ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of formations by impermanence and the cessation of formations by non-perception.

original: chos gang dag 'gog pas 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos gang dag 'gog pas 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: What dharmas are ceased by the truth of cessation?

original: mdor bsdu na gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na gnyis kyis te /
translated: In brief, two:

original: nyon mongs pa 'gog pa dang / phung po 'gog pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'gog pa dang / phung po 'gog pas so //
translated: the cessation of defilement and the cessation of the aggregates.

original: nyon mongs pa 'gog pas ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'gog pas ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan la /
translated: The truth of cessation is taught by the cessation of defilement as having a remainder of aggregates.

original: phung po 'gog pas ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: phung po 'gog pas ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan to //
translated: The truth of cessation is taught by the cessation of the aggregates as being without a remainder of aggregates.

original: gal te 'gog pa'i bden pa sngon ma byung ba las phyis 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'gog pa'i bden pa sngon ma byung ba las phyis 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If the truth of cessation were to arise later, after not having existed before,

original: ji ltar rtag pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be permanent?

original: gal te dus rtag pa kho na yod pa yin na ni ci'i phyir sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das she na ;
analyzed: gal te dus rtag pa kho na yod pa yin na ni ci'i phyir sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das she na ;
translated: If it were to exist at all times, why are not all sentient beings liberated?

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'jug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas de la ni sngon ma byung ba las phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'jug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas de la ni sngon ma byung ba las phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba ci yang med de /
translated: The truth of cessation has the characteristic of non-engagement and the characteristic of non-occurrence, so there is nothing that occurs later that did not occur earlier.

original: gang la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa med pa de ni rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa med pa de ni rtag pa yin no //
translated: That which has neither origination nor destruction is permanent.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa de rtag pa yin yang gang dag gis gnas ngan len thams cad rgyun bcad pas mngon du byas pa de dag ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa de rtag pa yin yang gang dag gis gnas ngan len thams cad rgyun bcad pas mngon du byas pa de dag ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Although the truth of cessation is permanent, those who have realized it by cutting off all negative tendencies have attained nirvana.

original: gang dag gis mngon du ma byas pa de dag ni yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gis mngon du ma byas pa de dag ni yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa yin no //
translated: Those who have not realized it have not attained nirvana.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa yod na sems can rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni de mngon du byas pas rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa yod na sems can rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni de mngon du byas pas rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
translated: If the truth of cessation exists, sentient beings‚Äô nirvana is distinguished by the realization of that.

original: bskyed pas rab tu phye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bskyed pas rab tu phye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not distinguished by the generation of that.

original: nyes pa bzhi rnam par spangs pas 'gog pa'i bden pa'i lan 'debs pa ni yang dag par lan 'debs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyes pa bzhi rnam par spangs pas 'gog pa'i bden pa'i lan 'debs pa ni yang dag par lan 'debs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The correct reply is to be known as the correct reply to the truth of cessation, since it is free from four errors.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i nyes pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid log par yongs su rtog pa'i nyes pa dang / mtshan nyid 'dres pa'i nyes pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i nyes pa rnam par spangs pas so //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i nyes pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid log par yongs su rtog pa'i nyes pa dang / mtshan nyid 'dres pa'i nyes pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i nyes pa rnam par spangs pas so //
translated: It is free from the error of superimposition, the error of misconception of intrinsic identity, the error of confused identity, and the error of denial.

original: de la 'du byed rnams zad pa las logs shig na 'gog pa yod do zhes zer ba ni sgro 'dogs pa'i nyes pa yin no /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams zad pa las logs shig na 'gog pa yod do zhes zer ba ni sgro 'dogs pa'i nyes pa yin no /
translated: To say that cessation exists separately from the cessation of conditioning formations is the error of superimposition.

original: logs shig na med do zhes zer ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid log par yongs su rtog pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: logs shig na med do zhes zer ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid log par yongs su rtog pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: To say that it does not exist separately is the error of misconception of intrinsic identity.üîΩTo say that it both exists and does not exist separately is the error of confused identity.

original: logs shig na yod kyang yod la med kyang med ces zer ba ni mtshan nyid 'dres pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: logs shig na yod kyang yod la med kyang med ces zer ba ni mtshan nyid 'dres pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: To say that it neither exists nor does not exist separately is the error of denial.

original: logs shig na yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes zer ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: logs shig na yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes zer ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: To say that it is neither existent nor nonexistent is the error of deprecation.

original: @237a * // gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po lnga po thams cad lam gyis bsdus pa yin pa'i tshe /
analyzed: @237a * // gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po lnga po thams cad lam gyis bsdus pa yin pa'i tshe /
translated: When all five supramundane aggregates are included in the path,

original: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du btang ba'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa lam gyi bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du btang ba'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa lam gyi bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: why is the eightfold noble path, preceded by right view, called the truth of the path?

original: bslab pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is governed by the three trainings.

original: slob pa ni 'di ltar dus dus su lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la yang slob par byed cing /
analyzed: slob pa ni 'di ltar dus dus su lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la yang slob par byed cing /
translated: One in training trains in the training of superior morality from time to time,

original: dus dus su lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la yang slob par byed /
analyzed: dus dus su lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la yang slob par byed /
translated: trains in the training of superior mind from time to time,

original: dus dus su lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la yang slob par byed la /
analyzed: dus dus su lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la yang slob par byed la /
translated: and trains in the training of superior wisdom from time to time.

original: phung po gsum ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yin pas /
analyzed: phung po gsum ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yin pas /
translated: The three aggregates are the eightfold noble path,

original: de'i phyir lam gyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam gyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore it is called the truth of the path.

original: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dag tshul khrims kyi phung por rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dag tshul khrims kyi phung por rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are right speech, right action, and right livelihood established as the aggregate of morality?

original: smras pa / yang dag pa'i chos kyi longs spyod dang / zang zing gi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'i rgyu gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / yang dag pa'i chos kyi longs spyod dang / zang zing gi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'i rgyu gnyis kyis te /
translated: They are established as the aggregate of morality for two reasons:

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni rtsa ba'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni rtsa ba'i tshul khrims te /
translated: Right speech and right action are the root of morality,

original: tshul khrims ni chos kyi longs spyod thams cad kyi gzhi yin pas yang dag pa'i chos kyi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni chos kyi longs spyod thams cad kyi gzhi yin pas yang dag pa'i chos kyi longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: because morality is the basis of all enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa log pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i chos rnams la mi brten par chos gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol ba'i rtsa ba yin zhing gzhi yin pas yang dag pa'i zang zing gi longs spyod kyi dbang du
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa log pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i chos rnams la mi brten par chos gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol ba'i rtsa ba yin zhing gzhi yin pas yang dag pa'i zang zing gi longs spyod kyi dbang du
translated: Right livelihood is the basis and root of seeking robes and so on without resorting to wrong means of livelihood such as hypocrisy.

original: byas pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis gang du yid kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su dag pa lhag par gsungs pa der ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la brten nas 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi phyir sems pa gang yin pa dang / tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa la brten nas chos gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol ba'i sems pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: byas pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis gang du yid kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su dag pa lhag par gsungs pa der ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la brten nas 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi phyir sems pa gang yin pa dang / tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa la brten nas chos gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol ba'i sems pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o ;
translated: When it is based on hypocrisy and so on, it is impure.

original: / ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gang yin pa de dag shes rab kyi phung po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gang yin pa de dag shes rab kyi phung po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are right view, right thought, and right effort called the aggregate of wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi las ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi las ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod la /
translated: In brief, the function of wisdom is threefold:

original: de dag ni chos gsum po 'di dag @237b gis yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos gsum po 'di dag @237b gis yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: These three are completed by these three.

original: chos kyi de kho na'i don rtogs par byed pa ni las dang po yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na'i don rtogs par byed pa ni las dang po yin no //
translated: The first action is to understand the meaning of the reality of the Dharma.

original: de kho na'i don rtogs nas de kho na'i don de nyid gzhan dag la brjod pa dang / 'dogs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par 'grel pa dang / gsal bar byed pa ni las gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na'i don rtogs nas de kho na'i don de nyid gzhan dag la brjod pa dang / 'dogs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par 'grel pa dang / gsal bar byed pa ni las gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second action is to explain to others, to indicate, to establish, to reveal, to make clear, and to make manifest that very meaning of reality which one has understood.

original: kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spang ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa ni las gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spang ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa ni las gsum pa yin te /
translated: The third action is to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma in order to abandon the remaining fetters.

original: las de dag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dag gis go rims bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las de dag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dag gis go rims bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These three actions are completed respectively by right view, right thought, and right effort, because they are the basis of the three actions.

original: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are mindfulness and concentration called heaps?

original: smras pa / rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
translated: They are called heaps for two reasons.

original: ngo bo nyid dang rten gyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang rten gyis so //
translated: They are distinguished by their nature and by their basis.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Concentration is their nature.

original: dran pa ni rgyu bzhis ting nge 'dzin gyi rten gyi bya ba byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dran pa ni rgyu bzhis ting nge 'dzin gyi rten gyi bya ba byed pa yin te /
translated: Recollection is the basis of concentration because it performs the function of supporting concentration through four causes.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag la sems dmigs pa la nye bar gtod par byed pa dang / dbang po'i sgo bsdam pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang / dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i dran pa yid la bya ba la ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su mthun pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po dag la sems dmigs pa la nye bar gtod par byed pa dang / dbang po'i sgo bsdam pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang / dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i dran pa yid la bya ba la ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su mthun pa dang /
translated: It focuses the mind on the object of concentration, it restrains the doors of the sense faculties, it abides with vigilance and it is the mindfulness that is the basis of joy and it is the attention that is compatible with concentration.

original: sgrib pa'i gnyen po mi sdug pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa dag la lam la sgrib pa spong ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rtag tu byed pa dang /
analyzed: sgrib pa'i gnyen po mi sdug pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa dag la lam la sgrib pa spong ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rtag tu byed pa dang /
translated: It abandons the obscurations that are the obstructions to the path, it always creates the signs of isolated serenity, complete discernment and equanimity and it is the attention that is the sign of frequent practice.

original: gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba dag la mtshan ma yid la byed pas lan mang du byed pa ste /
analyzed: gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba dag la mtshan ma yid la byed pas lan mang du byed pa ste /
translated: It is the application of respect.

original: de'i phyir dran pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rten yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rten yin no ;
translated: Therefore, mindfulness is the basis of concentration.

original: / de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu gcig tu blta bar bya ste /üîΩnang du lta ba dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / kun du sbyor bar byed pa dang / bral ba dang ;
analyzed: / de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu gcig tu blta bar bya ste / nang du lta ba dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / kun du sbyor bar byed pa dang / bral ba dang ;
translated: Right view is to be seen in brief as having eleven aspects:

original: 'bral bar byed par blta ba'o //
analyzed: 'bral bar byed par blta ba'o //
translated: as seeing internally, as a thorn, as a wound, as a disease, as a dart, as impermanent, as suffering, as empty, as insubstantial, as a fetter, and as a separation and as a separation-maker.

original: de la 'du byed rnam pa bzhi po nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang ldan pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang ldan pa rnams dang / ro myang ba dang ldan pa rnams dang / nyes dmigs dang ldan pa rnams la ni yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhi po @238a * //
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnam pa bzhi po nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang ldan pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang ldan pa rnams dang / ro myang ba dang ldan pa rnams dang / nyes dmigs dang ldan pa rnams la ni yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhi po @238a * //
translated: The four kinds of formative factors are those associated with the entanglements of the afflictions, those associated with the latent afflictions, those associated with enjoyment, and those associated with the disadvantages.

original: nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig par lta ba dag go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig par lta ba dag go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The view of the self as sick, as having a boil, as having a thorn, and as having a wound should be understood respectively.

original: 'du byed rnams las 'byung ba dang / 'jig par lta ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du lta ba yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams las 'byung ba dang / 'jig par lta ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du lta ba yin no //
translated: The view of the self as arising and perishing in relation to the formations is the view of impermanence.

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang rjes su 'brel bar lta ba ni sdug bsngal nyid du lta ba yin no ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang rjes su 'brel bar lta ba ni sdug bsngal nyid du lta ba yin no ;
translated: The view of the self as associated with the three kinds of suffering is the view of suffering.

original: / de las gzhan pa bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba ni stong pa nyid du lta ba yin no //
analyzed: / de las gzhan pa bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba ni stong pa nyid du lta ba yin no //
translated: The view of the self as devoid of self and what belongs to a self, apart from that, is the view of emptiness.

original: 'du byed de dag nyid la bdag dang bdag gis mtshan nyid med par lta ba ni bdag med pa nyid du lta ba yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag nyid la bdag dang bdag gis mtshan nyid med par lta ba ni bdag med pa nyid du lta ba yin te /
translated: The view of the self as devoid of the characteristics of a self and what belongs to a self in relation to those very formations is the view of non-self.

original: de ltar 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this is right view that has the truth of suffering for its object.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen du lta ba gang yin pa de ni kun du sbyor bar byed par lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen du lta ba gang yin pa de ni kun du sbyor bar byed par lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The view that the truth of origination is a cause, an origination, a source, and a condition is the view that it is a fetter.

original: 'di ltar kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun du sbyor bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun du sbyor bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the truth of origination is the cause of the truth of suffering, and it is the fetter and the bond.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung bar lta ba gang yin pa de ni bral bar lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung bar lta ba gang yin pa de ni bral bar lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The view that the truth of cessation is cessation, pacification, excellence, and definite emergence is the view that it is freedom.

original: 'di ltar 'gog pa'i bden pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / phung po thams cad dang bral bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog pa'i bden pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / phung po thams cad dang bral bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the truth of cessation is distinguished by being free from all the defilements and the aggregates.

original: lam gyi bden pa la lam dang / rig pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin par lta ba gang yin pa de ni bral bar byed par lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la lam dang / rig pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin par lta ba gang yin pa de ni bral bar byed par lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The view that the truth of the path is the path, the correct method, the means of accomplishment, and the means of definite release is the view that it is the means of separation.

original: 'di ltar lam gyi bden pa 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lam gyi bden pa 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the truth of the path is the means of separation from samsara.

original: gang gi tshe sngar mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par lta ba skye ba la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngar mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par lta ba skye ba la /
translated: When the view of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness arises first,

original: phyis nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig par lta ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i tshe ci'i phyir sngar nad la sogs pa ston ce na /
analyzed: phyis nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig par lta ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i tshe ci'i phyir sngar nad la sogs pa ston ce na /
translated: and later the view of disease, abscess, thorn, and calamity arises, why are disease and so on taught first?

original: smras pa / gang zag lam thob pa las dgongs nas nad la sogs pa sngar ston te /
analyzed: smras pa / gang zag lam thob pa las dgongs nas nad la sogs pa sngar ston te /

analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig po de dag las stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / bdag med pa nyid kyi rnam pa gnyis ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin no //

analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni smon pa med pa'i rnam pa yin no //

analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la bral ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa gcig bu ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The one aspect of separation that is related to the truth of cessation is the aspect of signlessness.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thams cad bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thams cad bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa yin du zin kyang /

analyzed: khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya ste /

original: 'di ltar slob pa gzhi mthong bas sngon chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa gnyis kyis mngon sum dang / lkog tu gyur pa'i 'du byed thams cad mngon par rtogs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar slob pa gzhi mthong bas sngon chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa gnyis kyis mngon sum dang / lkog tu gyur pa'i 'du byed thams cad mngon par rtogs nas /
translated: Thus, a learner who has seen the basic reality first realizes all manifest and hidden conditioned states through the two knowledges: the knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledge.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la 'du byed thams cad gcig tu bsdus shing cha gcig tu byas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la 'du byed thams cad gcig tu bsdus shing cha gcig tu byas /
translated: In the path of cultivation, all formations are included in one group, and one part is made.

original: tshogs gcig tu byas nas /
analyzed: tshogs gcig tu byas nas /

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis lta bar zad kyi /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis lta bar zad kyi /
translated: one sees only with the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: 'di dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: One does not conceive of them as ‚ÄúThese are of the realm of desire,
