analyzed: 'di dag ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: these are of the realm of form, these are of the formless realm,

original: 'di dag ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mngon sum mo //
translated: these are manifest,

original: 'di dag ni lkog tu gyur pa'o zhes rnam par rtog par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di dag ni lkog tu gyur pa'o zhes rnam par rtog par mi byed de /
translated: these are hidden.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa thams cad na sa 'og ma dang / sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa thams cad na sa 'og ma dang / sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in all the path of cultivation included in the supramundane path, one should see the antidote to all the defilements of the lower stage and the higher stage.

original: 'phags pa ni phal cher bsgom pa'i lam la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis rjes su 'jug pa na /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni phal cher bsgom pa'i lam la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis rjes su 'jug pa na /
translated: When the noble one, for the most part, enters the supramundane path in the path of cultivation,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa dag gis mtshan ma med pa'i dmigs pa mang du yid la byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa dag gis mtshan ma med pa'i dmigs pa mang du yid la byed do //
translated: he often brings to mind the object of signlessness with the aspects of signlessness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: yid la byed pa de ni tshe 'di la shin tu bde bar gnas par bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de ni tshe 'di la shin tu bde bar gnas par bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this attention is for the sake of abiding in great happiness in this life and for the sake of abandoning the defilements.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / @239a * //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / @239a * //
translated: The five superknowledges, the absence of defilements, the knowledge through vows, the analytical knowledges,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni lam gyi rjes las 'thob cing rnam par dag pa dang / lam la brten pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni lam gyi rjes las 'thob cing rnam par dag pa dang / lam la brten pa yin mod kyi /
translated: the powers of the TathƒÅgata, the fearlessnesses, etc., the eighteen dharmas exclusive to a Buddha, are indeed obtained subsequent to the path and are purified and based on the path.

original: de dag ni lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa ma yin no //
translated: But they are not included in the truth of the path.

original: gang gi tshe bden pa bzhi po thams cad kyang yongs su shes par bya ba dag yin pa'i tshe ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kho na yongs su shes par bya zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bden pa bzhi po thams cad kyang yongs su shes par bya ba dag yin pa'i tshe ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kho na yongs su shes par bya zhes gsungs she na /
translated: When all four noble truths are to be fully understood, why is it said that only the truth of suffering is to be fully understood?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni mtshan nyid gnyis kyis yongs su shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni mtshan nyid gnyis kyis yongs su shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: He replied: The truth of suffering is to be fully understood by means of two characteristics:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: by its own characteristic and by its general characteristic.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas te /
translated: The other truths are to be fully understood by means of their own characteristics.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba de yang de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /üîΩ'gog pa'i bden pa la /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba de yang de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin la / 'gog pa'i bden pa la /
translated: The truth of origination is to be fully understood by means of the aspects of cause, etc. Those are its own characteristics.

original: 'gog pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba de yang de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba de yang de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The truth of cessation is to be fully understood by means of the aspects of cessation, etc. Those are its own characteristics.

original: lam gyi bden pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba de yang de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis yongs su shes par bya ba de yang de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The truth of the path is to be fully understood by means of the aspects of path, etc. Those are its own characteristics.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kho na yongs su shes par bya zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa kho na yongs su shes par bya zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that only the truth of suffering is to be fully understood.

original: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang spang bar bya ba'i tshe ci'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pa kho na spang bar bya zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yang spang bar bya ba'i tshe ci'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pa kho na spang bar bya zhes gsungs she na /
translated: But when the truth of suffering is also to be abandoned, why is it said that only the truth of origin is to be abandoned?

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa spong ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa spong bas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa spong ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa spong bas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: The abandonment of the truth of suffering is distinguished by the abandonment of the truth of origin.

original: de'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pa kho na spong bar bya zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun 'byung ba'i bden pa kho na spong bar bya zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that only the truth of origin is to be abandoned.

original: bden pa rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bden pa rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of clear knowledge of the truths:

original: shes pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / spang ba mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / spang ba mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: clear knowledge of the cognition of the truths and clear knowledge of the abandonment of the truths.

original: de la shes pa mngon par rtogs pa ni bden pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag la shes pa 'byung bas go rims su rim gyis 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: de la shes pa mngon par rtogs pa ni bden pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag la shes pa 'byung bas go rims su rim gyis 'byung ngo ;
translated: Clear knowledge of the cognition of the truths occurs in order, since the cognition of the truths arises in order, since the truths have different characteristics.

original: / spong ba mngon par rtogs pa yang mthar gyis 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: / spong ba mngon par rtogs pa yang mthar gyis 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: Clear knowledge of the abandonment of the truths also occurs in order.

original: nyon mongs pa spang ba mngon du bya ba ni shes pa 'byung ba la rag las pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po nyi shu rtsa bdun pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang ba mngon du bya ba ni shes pa 'byung ba la rag las pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa bdun pa /
translated: The manifestation of the abandonment of the defilements depends on the arising of the knowledge.

original: yang dag par brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rgyu mtshan ni lnga ste /
analyzed: yang dag par brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rgyu mtshan ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five reasons for undertaking right effort:

original: dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / @239b rigs pa dang ldan pa dang 'grogs pa dang / le lo dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa la nyes dmigs su lta ba dang phan yon du lta ba'i so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa dang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / @239b rigs pa dang ldan pa dang 'grogs pa dang / le lo dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa la nyes dmigs su lta ba dang phan yon du lta ba'i so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa dang /
translated: the teaching of the true Dharma, association with the wise, the power of discernment which views laziness and the undertaking of effort as disadvantageous and advantageous, the complete maturation of the mental continuum,

original: snga phyi'i khyad par 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: snga phyi'i khyad par 'thob pa'o //
translated: and the attainment of distinction before and after.

original: spong ba mngon du bya ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: spong ba mngon du bya ba ni gnyis te /
translated: The manifestation of abandonment is twofold:

original: sa bon nyams par byed pa'i spong ba mngon du bya ba dang / sa bon gtan nas 'joms pa'i spong ba mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon nyams par byed pa'i spong ba mngon du bya ba dang / sa bon gtan nas 'joms pa'i spong ba mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: the manifestation of abandonment which weakens the seeds and the manifestation of abandonment which completely destroys the seeds.

original: dral ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dral ba ni gnyis te /
translated: Liberation is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i 'ching ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i 'ching ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: liberation from the aspects of the defilements and liberation from the bonds of the basis of the defilements.

original: dge slong g-yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa tshur shog ces gang gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: dge slong g-yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa tshur shog ces gang gsungs pa de la /
translated: The TathƒÅgata said, Come here, monks who are without deceit and without pretense!

original: de bzhin gshegs pas g-yo'i nyes dmigs du zhig yang dag par rjes su gzigs na /üîΩg-yon can la yang dag par rjes su ston par mi mdzad ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas g-yo'i nyes dmigs du zhig yang dag par rjes su gzigs na / g-yon can la yang dag par rjes su ston par mi mdzad ce na /
translated: If one were to ask, ‚ÄúHaving seen how many disadvantages of deceit did the TathƒÅgata teach the Dharma to those who are deceitful?‚ÄùüîΩit is said:

original: smras pa / bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / bcu gnyis te /
translated: There are twelve.

original: g-yon can ni g-yo'i gzhi'i rgyus de kho na'i shes pa mi 'thob pa dang / snyan pa las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dang ; gzhan yid ches pa las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dang / yon tan bstsags pa las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: g-yon can ni g-yo'i gzhi'i rgyus de kho na'i shes pa mi 'thob pa dang / snyan pa las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dang ; gzhan yid ches pa las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dang / yon tan bstsags pa las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Those who are deceitful do not obtain knowledge of reality due to the cause of the basis of deceit; they fall from fame; they fall from the trust of others; they fall from the accumulation of good qualities; they fall from the accumulation of wealth; they fall from the accumulation of relatives; they fall from the accumulation of virtue; they fall from the accumulation of wisdom; they fall from the accumulation of insight; they fall from the accumulation of the superknowledges; they fall from the accumulation of the perfections; and they fall from the accumulation of the factors of enlightenment.

original: dam pa rnams las chos mnyan pa dang / gdams ngag las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dang / sdig pa mang du byed pa dang / sems kyi rgyud dge ba las thag ring du byed pa dang / g-yo'i mi mnyam pa'i gnod pas sems sdug bsngal zhing reg par mi gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dam pa rnams las chos mnyan pa dang / gdams ngag las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dang / sdig pa mang du byed pa dang / sems kyi rgyud dge ba las thag ring du byed pa dang / g-yo'i mi mnyam pa'i gnod pas sems sdug bsngal zhing reg par mi gnas pa dang /
translated: They are: listening to the Dharma from holy persons, being deprived of the instructions, committing many sins, being far from the virtuous mental states, being tormented by the harm of deceit and not being at ease,

original: gzhan las sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams kyi dogs pa 'byung ba dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi snod du mi 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / lus zhigs te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan las sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams kyi dogs pa 'byung ba dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi snod du mi 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / lus zhigs te shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: being afraid of the arising of the factors of suffering from others, not becoming a vessel of the noble Dharma, dying with regret, and after the body breaks up, being reborn in the lower miserable destinies, the hells.

original: g-yo ni rnam pa brgyad dang / gzhi bdun dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: g-yo ni rnam pa brgyad dang / gzhi bdun dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Deceit is to be known as having eight aspects and seven bases.

original: de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: And it is in the desire realm.

original: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight aspects?

original: rmongs par bya ba g-yo byed pa dang / 'chab pa dang / sgrogs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / 'dud pa dang / 'khu ba dang / 'dor ba dang / snying rje bar ston pa la g-yo byed pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs par bya ba g-yo byed pa dang / 'chab pa dang / sgrogs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / 'dud pa dang / 'khu ba dang / 'dor ba dang / snying rje bar ston pa la g-yo byed pa'o //
translated: Deceit is to deceive others by means of a false show of what is not real, by means of a false show of what is real, by means of a false show of what is not real, and by means of a false show of what is real.

original: gzhi bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven bases?

original: tha snyad kyi gzhi dang / bskul ba'i gzhi dang / rtsod pa'i gzhi dang / mdza' bshes nyid du @240a * //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi gzhi dang / bskul ba'i gzhi dang / rtsod pa'i gzhi dang / mdza' bshes nyid du @240a * //
translated: The base of conventional usage, the base of instigation, the base of dispute, the base of showing friendship,

original: ston pa'i gzhi dang / yid gcugs par ston pa'i gzhi dang / bya ba la g-yo med pa'i gzhi dang / gnod pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i gzhi dang / yid gcugs par ston pa'i gzhi dang / bya ba la g-yo med pa'i gzhi dang / gnod pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: the base of showing confidence, the base of being without deceit in action, and the base of harm.

original: de la gzhi dang pos ni g-yon can 'jig rten pa rnams dang lhan cig tha snyad byed pa na /
analyzed: de la gzhi dang pos ni g-yon can 'jig rten pa rnams dang lhan cig tha snyad byed pa na /
translated: In regard to that, when those who are deceitful engage in conventional usage with worldly people,

original: don med pa la don du ston pa dang / don la don med par ston pa dang / don med pa la don du ston pa dang / don la don med par ston pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: don med pa la don du ston pa dang / don la don med par ston pa dang / don med pa la don du ston pa dang / don la don med par ston pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: they show what is meaningless as meaningful, they show what is meaningful as meaningless, they show what is not real as real, and they show what is real as not real.

original: don med pa las yod par ston pa dang / yod pa la med par ston pas rmongs par byed ngo //
analyzed: don med pa las yod par ston pa dang / yod pa la med par ston pas rmongs par byed ngo //
translated: He is confused by teaching existence where there is non-existence and by teaching non-existence where there is existence.

original: de la gzhi gnyis pas ni g-yon can g-yo'i spyod pas kun nas bslang ba'i nyes par spyod pa'i las dag la gzhan dag gis bskul ba na de nyes pa yang dag pa ni 'chab par byed la /üîΩyon tan yang dag pa ma yin pa ni sgrogs par byed do //
analyzed: de la gzhi gnyis pas ni g-yon can g-yo'i spyod pas kun nas bslang ba'i nyes par spyod pa'i las dag la gzhan dag gis bskul ba na de nyes pa yang dag pa ni 'chab par byed la / yon tan yang dag pa ma yin pa ni sgrogs par byed do //
translated: By the second basis, when others urge him to commit a misdeed motivated by deceit and fraud, he conceals his own faults and proclaims the good qualities of others.

original: de la gzhi gsum pas ni g-yon can phas kyi rgol ba pa dag dang lhan cig tu yon tan dang skyon yongs su brtags pa las brtsams te rtsod pa na phyogs bzang po ma yin pa yang 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de la gzhi gsum pas ni g-yon can phas kyi rgol ba pa dag dang lhan cig tu yon tan dang skyon yongs su brtags pa las brtsams te rtsod pa na phyogs bzang po ma yin pa yang 'jog par byed do //
translated: By the third basis, when he engages in debate with deceitful adversaries about the examination of good qualities and faults, he presents a bad position.

original: de la gzhi bzhi pas ni g-yon can ches stobs dang ldan zhing gtum pa gang las 'jigs pa yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de la lus dang ngag gis ches shin tu dman par byed cing 'dud pa des mdza' bshes nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: de la gzhi bzhi pas ni g-yon can ches stobs dang ldan zhing gtum pa gang las 'jigs pa yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de la lus dang ngag gis ches shin tu dman par byed cing 'dud pa des mdza' bshes nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: By the fourth ground, he shows himself to be a friend to the deceitful, the powerful, and the violent, from whom he sees danger, by his extreme humility and deference in body and speech.

original: de la gzhi lnga pas ni g-yon can gnam po g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can gang las chung zad 'khus pas rnyed pa 'thob pa yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de la yid mi gcugs shing yid mi ches pa nyid yin bzhin du /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gzhi lnga pas ni g-yon can gnam po g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can gang las chung zad 'khus pas rnyed pa 'thob pa yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de la yid mi gcugs shing yid mi ches pa nyid yin bzhin du / 'di lta ste /
translated: By the fifth ground, he shows himself to be a friend to the deceitful, the greedy, and the fickle, from whom he sees gain by the slightest favor.üîΩHe shows himself to be extremely trustworthy and reliable,

original: rnam par bsgrub pa'i rgyu ba dang / gnas pa rnam par dag pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid mchog tu yid gcugs pa nyid dang / mchog tu yid ches pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par bsgrub pa'i rgyu ba dang / gnas pa rnam par dag pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid mchog tu yid gcugs pa nyid dang / mchog tu yid ches pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: in order to demonstrate the purity of his conduct and his way of life.

original: de la gzhi drug pas ni g-yon can mdza' bshes snying du sdug pa yid gcugs pa dag gis ma 'ongs pa'i bya ba rgya chen po dag la grogs bya bar khas blangs la bya ba de'i dus la bab pa'i tshe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gzhi drug pas ni g-yon can mdza' bshes snying du sdug pa yid gcugs pa dag gis ma 'ongs pa'i bya ba rgya chen po dag la grogs bya bar khas blangs la bya ba de'i dus la bab pa'i tshe na 'di lta ste /
translated: The sixth ground shows that in the future, when the time comes to perform a great deed, one will be accompanied by deceitful friends who are dear, pleasing, and trusted.üîΩ

original: bdag nyid yongs su ngal ba rjes su bsrung ba nyid kyi phyir g-yo sna tshogs nye bar ston pas 'dor bar byed do //üîΩde la gzhi bdun pas ni g-yon can gnod pa gang yang rung ba zhig byung ba na /
analyzed: bdag nyid yongs su ngal ba rjes su bsrung ba nyid kyi phyir g-yo sna tshogs nye bar ston pas 'dor bar byed do // de la gzhi bdun pas ni g-yon can gnod pa gang yang rung ba zhig byung ba na /
translated: The sixth ground is that when a deceitful person has promised to help a friend, a dear one, or a trusted person with a great future project, but when the time comes to do the work, he avoids it by various kinds of deception.

original: gang las de'i gnod pa 'byung ba'i dgra bo de la /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang las de'i gnod pa 'byung ba'i dgra bo de la / 'di lta ste /
translated: The seventh ground is that when a deceitful person encounters any kind of harm,üîΩhe shows himself to be weak and miserable,üîΩas if he were not strong and happy,

original: mya ngan dang / sgyid @240b lug pa dang / rmongs pa'i bar dag bskyed pa'i phyir bdag nyid de ltar nyam thag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba ma yin yang ci nas kyang nyam thag pa dang / sdug bsngal lta bur ston par byed do //
analyzed: mya ngan dang / sgyid @240b lug pa dang / rmongs pa'i bar dag bskyed pa'i phyir bdag nyid de ltar nyam thag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba ma yin yang ci nas kyang nyam thag pa dang / sdug bsngal lta bur ston par byed do //
translated: in order to generate grief, dejection, and even delusion in the enemy from whom the harm comes.

original: nyan thos bka' blo mi bde ba ni re zhig bden pa rnams las brtsams nas /
analyzed: nyan thos bka' blo mi bde ba ni re zhig bden pa rnams las brtsams nas /
translated: The listeners are temporarily uncomfortable with the teachings on the four noble truths.

original: gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa nyid 'thob par 'os pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa nyid 'thob par 'os pa yang ma yin na /
translated: The Sravakas are not temporarily fit to receive the instructions and teachings that begin with the Truths.

original: bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How much less fit are they to realize the Truths and to be purified?

original: nyan thos bka' blo mi bde ba'i rtags ni dgu po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos bka' blo mi bde ba'i rtags ni dgu po 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are nine signs of the Sravakas who are not fit to receive the instructions.

original: de dag dang ldan pa'i nyan thos ni tshig mi bzod pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa'i nyan thos ni tshig mi bzod pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Sravakas who have these signs are to be known as being unfit to receive the instructions and as being impatient with the teachings.

original: dgu gang zhe na /üîΩgleng ba po'i gang zag gis glengs pa na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na / gleng ba po'i gang zag gis glengs pa na /
translated: What are the nine signs?

original: tshig mi 'jam pa nyid las brtsams nas skabs las byung bas lan 'debs pa dang / ma 'brel pa dang / ma rdzogs pa dang / gzhan du yongs su brtags nas lan 'debs pa de ni rtags dang po yin no //
analyzed: tshig mi 'jam pa nyid las brtsams nas skabs las byung bas lan 'debs pa dang / ma 'brel pa dang / ma rdzogs pa dang / gzhan du yongs su brtags nas lan 'debs pa de ni rtags dang po yin no //
translated: When a person who is a speaker begins to speak, the Sravakas answer him with words that are not gentle, that are not relevant, that are incomplete, and that are examined in another way. This is the first sign.

original: rnam par g-yengs pa'i tshig nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa'i tshig nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with the very words of distraction,

original: gtam gzhan gyis glengs pa 'dor bar byed /
analyzed: gtam gzhan gyis glengs pa 'dor bar byed /
translated: he abandons and rejects other conversations.

original: spong bar byed pa 'di ni rtags gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: spong bar byed pa 'di ni rtags gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second sign.

original: khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pas rang gi sems 'khrug par byed pa dang / slong bar byed pa dang / rnyog pa can du byed pa de ni rtags gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pas rang gi sems 'khrug par byed pa dang / slong bar byed pa dang / rnyog pa can du byed pa de ni rtags gsum pa yin no //
translated: When his mind is disturbed, agitated, and defiled by the entanglement of anger, this is the third sign.

original: khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i tshig dang / nyes rtsom gyi tshig dang / ngag rtsub po'i tshig rjod par byed pa de ni rtags bzhi ba yin no //
analyzed: khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i tshig dang / nyes rtsom gyi tshig dang / ngag rtsub po'i tshig rjod par byed pa de ni rtags bzhi ba yin no //
translated: When he utters words of discord, words of hostility, and harsh words because of the entanglement of anger, this is the fourth sign.

original: 'di bdag la smra na /
analyzed: 'di bdag la smra na /
translated: If he speaks to me,

original: bdag gis kyang 'di la ci'i phyir smra bar mi bya snyam du sems khengs pas rjod par byed pa de ni rtags lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang 'di la ci'i phyir smra bar mi bya snyam du sems khengs pas rjod par byed pa de ni rtags lnga pa yin no //
translated: why shouldn‚Äôt I speak to him? ‚Äô Speaking with a mind of pride, this is the fifth sign.

original: kha na ma tho ba 'chab par byed pa de ni rtags drug pa yin no //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba 'chab par byed pa de ni rtags drug pa yin no //
translated: When he conceals his own offenses, this is the sixth sign.

original: khon gyi bsam pa 'dzin par byed pa de ni rtags bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: khon gyi bsam pa 'dzin par byed pa de ni rtags bdun pa yin no //
translated: This is the seventh sign.

original: lan bya ba'i sems mang du byed pa de ni rtags brgyad pa yin no //
analyzed: lan bya ba'i sems mang du byed pa de ni rtags brgyad pa yin no //
translated: This is the eighth sign.

original: gzhan dag gis gleng ba po'i yang dag pa'i yon tan dag brjod pa dang / yang dag par bshad pa na mos par mi byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis gleng ba po'i yang dag pa'i yon tan dag brjod pa dang / yang dag par bshad pa na mos par mi byed cing /
translated: When others speak of the good qualities of the person who is the object of criticism, and when they speak of his or her good qualities, they do not approve of it.

original: phyir bzlog pa dang / spong ba dang / phyir gshe bar byed pa de ni rtags dgu pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir bzlog pa dang / spong ba dang / phyir gshe bar byed pa de ni rtags dgu pa yin no //
translated: They turn away from it, reject it, and speak in opposition to it. This is the ninth sign.

original: gang zag gleng ba po ni mdor bsdu na gnyis po 'di dag yin te /üîΩbla ma'i gnas lta bu yang yin la grags pa dang / bla ma'i gnas lta @241a * //
analyzed: gang zag gleng ba po ni mdor bsdu na gnyis po 'di dag yin te / bla ma'i gnas lta bu yang yin la grags pa dang / bla ma'i gnas lta @241a * //
translated: In brief, there are two kinds of people who are the objects of criticism:

original: bu yang ma yin la ma grags pa'o //
analyzed: bu yang ma yin la ma grags pa'o //
translated: those who are worthy of being teachers and those who are not worthy of being teachers.

original: de la rtags dang po gnyis ni gleng ba po'i gang zag dang po las brtsams te blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rtags dang po gnyis ni gleng ba po'i gang zag dang po las brtsams te blta bar bya'o //
translated: The first two signs should be understood as applying to the first kind of person who is the object of criticism.

original: rtags lhag ma bdun ni gleng ba po'i gang zag gnyis pa las brtsams te blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtags lhag ma bdun ni gleng ba po'i gang zag gnyis pa las brtsams te blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining seven signs should be understood as applying to the second kind of person who is the object of criticism.

original: sa'i dngos gzhir tshul khrims kyi sdom pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir tshul khrims kyi sdom pa las brtsams nas /
translated: The YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi explains the Vinaya in terms of the vows of ethical discipline.

original: 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i sdom ni /
analyzed: 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i sdom ni /
translated: The summary of the ascertainment of the Vinaya is:üîΩThe Vinaya is summarized by the seven topics of collection, ethics,üîΩheedfulness, obscurations, training,üîΩexamination, reliance, taking,üîΩenjoyment, profundity,

original: bsdu dang bcas dang tshul khrims dang // bag yod sgrib dang slob gzhug dang // brtag dang brten dang blang ba dang // longs spyod dang ni zab pa dang // mos dang dpe yi dngos po'o //
analyzed: bsdu dang bcas dang tshul khrims dang // bag yod sgrib dang slob gzhug dang // brtag dang brten dang blang ba dang // longs spyod dang ni zab pa dang // mos dang dpe yi dngos po'o //
translated: interest, and examples.

original: de la 'dul ba dang bcas pa'i so sor thar pa ni gnas bdun gyis bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dul ba dang bcas pa'i so sor thar pa ni gnas bdun gyis bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The Vinaya with its individual liberation is summarized by seven topics.

original: gnas bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven topics?

original: smras pa / bka' dang rjes su gnang ba dang / dgag pa dang / ltung ba'i gzhi dang / ltung ba dang / ltung ba med pa dang / ltung ba las bslang ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bka' dang rjes su gnang ba dang / dgag pa dang / ltung ba'i gzhi dang / ltung ba dang / ltung ba med pa dang / ltung ba las bslang ba'o //
translated: They are the words of the Buddha, what is permitted, prohibitions, the basis of downfalls, downfalls, non-downfalls, and rising from downfalls.

original: de la bka' ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mi dge ba'i chos yongs su nyams pa dang / dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la 'dul bar bka' stsol pa ste /
analyzed: de la bka' ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mi dge ba'i chos yongs su nyams pa dang / dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la 'dul bar bka' stsol pa ste /
translated: The Buddha's words are the Buddha's statements that a certain thing is a training rule, in order to eliminate nonvirtuous phenomena and increase virtuous phenomena.

original: de ni bka'i mtshan nyid mdor bsdus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni bka'i mtshan nyid mdor bsdus pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the definition of the Buddha's words in brief.

original: rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni dpag tu med do //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni dpag tu med do //
translated: The detailed analysis is immeasurable.

original: de la rjes su gnang ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar ston pa'i rgyu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par kun du spyod nus pa gang yin pa de 'dul bar rjes su gnang bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su gnang ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar ston pa'i rgyu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par kun du spyod nus pa gang yin pa de 'dul bar rjes su gnang bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: Regarding this topic, the Buddha's permissions are the Buddha's statements that a certain thing is a training rule, in order to enable one to engage in conduct that is not afflicted and that is a cause for the attainment of the teachings that he has revealed.

original: de la dgag pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ; mi mthun pa gang yin pa de 'dul ba la dgag pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de la dgag pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang ; mi mthun pa gang yin pa de 'dul ba la dgag pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: Regarding this topic, the Buddha's prohibitions are the Buddha's statements that a certain thing is not a training rule, in order to prevent one from engaging in conduct that is naturally objectionable or objectionable by his pronouncement and that is incompatible with the path of training.

original: de la ltung ba'i gzhi ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba'i gzhi ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: Regarding this topic, the bases of offense are, in brief:

original: rnam pa bco brgyad de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bco brgyad de 'di lta ste /
translated: There are eighteen types:

original: mi dge ba dang / dge ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las dang / tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / dge ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las dang / tshul khrims nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa dang / cho ga nyams pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa dang /
translated: unwholesome, wholesome, contrary, bodily action, verbal action, mental action, transgression of morality, transgression of view, transgression of conduct, transgression of livelihood,

original: gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa rjes su bsrung ba dang / yid mi ches pa'i gnas rjes su bsrung ba dang / 'khrig pa dang / lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / @241b bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa rjes su bsrung ba dang / yid mi ches pa'i gnas rjes su bsrung ba dang / 'khrig pa dang / lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / @241b bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang /
translated: guarding the mind of another, guarding harm to another, guarding the basis of lack of confidence, sexual misconduct, bowl, robes, alms, bed and seat,

original: stan dang / na ba'i gso sman dang yo byad do //üîΩde la mi dge ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang ci yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: stan dang / na ba'i gso sman dang yo byad do // de la mi dge ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang ci yang rung ba'o //
translated: medicine and other necessities.üîΩAmong them, the unwholesome is any unwholesome by nature.

original: de la dge ba dang mi mthun pa ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang ci yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba dang mi mthun pa ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang ci yang rung ba'o //
translated: Among them, the contrary is any unwholesome by prohibition.

original: de la lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las la brten nas ni /
analyzed: de la lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las la brten nas ni /
translated: The first is based on the actions of body, speech, and mind.üîΩ

original: ltung ba sde lnga po thams cad ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba sde lnga po thams cad ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The five classes of downfalls are to be understood as appropriate in relation to the actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: de bzhin du ltung ba'i gzhi de las gzhan pa dag kyang ltung ba sde lnga po dag la ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ltung ba'i gzhi de las gzhan pa dag kyang ltung ba sde lnga po dag la ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the other bases of downfalls are to be understood as appropriate in the five classes of downfalls.

original: de la ltung ba ni mdor bsdu na ltung ba sde lnga po dag go //
analyzed: de la ltung ba ni mdor bsdu na ltung ba sde lnga po dag go //
translated: In brief, a downfall is a downfall in the five classes.

original: ltung ba sde lnga po de dag la ltung ba ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba sde lnga po de dag la ltung ba ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: How does a downfall arise in the five classes of downfalls?

original: smras pa / rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is said: in five ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: gzhi dang / kun nas slong ba dang / dngos po dang / sbyor ba dang / mthas te /
analyzed: gzhi dang / kun nas slong ba dang / dngos po dang / sbyor ba dang / mthas te /
translated: basis, motivation, substance, performance, and conclusion.

original: de dag gi rab tu byed pa ni gzhi bsdu ba'i 'dul ba'i ma mo las rgya cher bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu byed pa ni gzhi bsdu ba'i 'dul ba'i ma mo las rgya cher bshad par bya'o //
translated: Their analysis should be understood in detail in the Vinaya Verses on the Bases of Downfalls.

original: yang ltung ba ni rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: yang ltung ba ni rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Moreover, a downfall is of nine types:

original: dge bsnyen gyi ltung ba dang ; dge bsnyen ma'i ltung ba dang / dge tshul gyi ltung ba dang / dge tshul ma'i ltung ba dang / dge slob ma'i ltung ba dang / dge slong ma'i ltung ba dang / dge slong gi ltung ba dang /
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi ltung ba dang ; dge bsnyen ma'i ltung ba dang / dge tshul gyi ltung ba dang / dge tshul ma'i ltung ba dang / dge slob ma'i ltung ba dang / dge slong ma'i ltung ba dang / dge slong gi ltung ba dang /
translated: the downfalls of the male and female lay practitioners, the downfalls of the male and female novices, the downfalls of the female probationers, the downfalls of the female novices, the downfalls of the fully ordained nuns, and the downfalls of the fully ordained monks.

original: so so'i skye bo'i ltung ba dang / slob pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i ltung ba dang / slob pa'i ltung ba'o //
translated: The downfalls of ordinary people and the downfalls of those in training.

original: mi slob pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mi slob pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There are no downfalls for those beyond training.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar de la ni bya ba med pa'i phyir chos nyid kyis thob pa kho nas bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba thams cad rgyun bcad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la ni bya ba med pa'i phyir chos nyid kyis thob pa kho nas bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba thams cad rgyun bcad pa yin la /
translated: Because they have no duties. They have cut off all the minor bases of training by simply attaining the Dharma nature.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung ba 'byin mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung ba 'byin mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible for them to commit a downfall that is a downfall due to affliction.

original: de la ltung ba med pa ni rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ltung ba med pa ni rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
translated: There are four kinds of non-downfalls that should be understood.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa'o //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa'o //
translated: the beginner, the insane, the deranged, and those whose minds are overwhelmed by pain.

analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las bye brag tu gyur pa'o //

original: nyes pa'i bye brag gis lci ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyes pa'i bye brag gis lci ba ni 'di lta ste /

original: la la yang dang yang du ltung ba 'byin pa'o //

original: nyon mongs pa'i bye brag gis lci ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bye brag gis lci ba ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: la la 'dod chags dang ; zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa shin tu drag pos ltung ba 'byin pa'o //

original: mi shes pa'i bye brag gis lci ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i bye brag gis lci ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The heavy transgression due to ignorance is as follows.

original: la la dge pa'i phyogs chung ba dang / shes rab zhen pa de la ni ltung bas ches shin tu sgrib par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: la la dge pa'i phyogs chung ba dang / shes rab zhen pa de la ni ltung bas ches shin tu sgrib par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Some have a small amount of virtue and are weak in wisdom. For them, a transgression becomes a very heavy obscuration.

original: de las bzlog pa gzhan la ni bcas pa 'dra ba dang / dngos po 'dra ba dang / nyes pa 'dra ba dang / nyon mongs pa 'dra ba la yang ltung bas sgrib par mi byed do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa gzhan la ni bcas pa 'dra ba dang / dngos po 'dra ba dang / nyes pa 'dra ba dang / nyon mongs pa 'dra ba la yang ltung bas sgrib par mi byed do //
translated: The opposite of that is not an obscuration due to transgression, even though the rule, the object, the fault, and the affliction are the same.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

analyzed: dper na chu 'bab pa chung ngu ni rtsva tsam gyis kyang dgag par nus la /

analyzed: rtsva tsam yang ded par mi nus kyi /

analyzed: chu 'bab pa chen po ni rtsva khur dang shing khur gyis kyang dgag par mi nus la /

original: rtsva dang shing mang po yang ded par nus pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rtsva dang shing mang po yang ded par nus pa bzhin du /

original: 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //

original: dus kyi bye brag gis lci ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus kyi bye brag gis lci ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Heavy in terms of time is as follows.

analyzed: la la ltung ba byung nas myur ba myur ba kho nar chos bzhin du phyir gso bar mi byed par dus gzhan du yongs su gnas nas gso bar byed pa'o //
translated: Some, after committing a downfall, do not quickly and properly restore it, but remain for a long time before restoring it.

original: ltung ba yang ba ni de dag las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba yang ba ni de dag las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Light downfalls should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pas ltung ba byung ba la rnam pa lngas brtags nas /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pas ltung ba byung ba la rnam pa lngas brtags nas /
translated: The Vinaya holders should examine downfalls in five ways and

original: ltung ba sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: ltung ba sbyin par bya ste /
translated: then grant the confession.

original: gcig tu kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gcig tu lhag par ma spyad pa dang / gzhi las bca' ba dang / de la nyes pa byung ba dang ma byung ba bstan pa dang / gcig tu kun du spyod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gcig tu kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gcig tu lhag par ma spyad pa dang / gzhi las bca' ba dang / de la nyes pa byung ba dang ma byung ba bstan pa dang / gcig tu kun du spyod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: They are: (1) completely afflicted, (2) not engaged in excess, (3) based on the foundation, (4) taught as a downfall whether there is a fault or not, and (5) not engaged in completely.

analyzed: de la gcig tu kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Completely afflicted downfalls are as follows.

original: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They are naturally reprehensible.

original: de la gcig tu ltung ba lhag par ma spyad pa la ni bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gcig tu ltung ba lhag par ma spyad pa la ni bstan par bya'o //

analyzed: ltung ba byung ba la ni ltung ba phyir gso ba'i las ci rigs par yongs su bstan par bya'o //

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag gang la brten pa dang / yul gang dang dus gang la brten nas /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag gang la brten pa dang / yul gang dang dus gang la brten nas /
translated: In this regard, the Blessed One, in dependence upon a person, a place, and a time,

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang @246a * //
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang @246a * //
translated: has laid down proscribed offenses

original: bcas pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa las /
analyzed: bcas pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa las /

original: gal te gang zag gzhan zhig yul gzhan dang / dus gzhan du nyes pa de nyid la rten par byed na /
analyzed: gal te gang zag gzhan zhig yul gzhan dang / dus gzhan du nyes pa de nyid la rten par byed na /
translated: If another person in another place and time were to rely on that very offense,

analyzed: des de la yang bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes pa gang gzigs nas bcas pa de kho na bzhin du ltung pa phyir gso ba'i las yongs su bstan par bya'o //

original: gal te nyes pa de la rten par mi byed na ni de la ltung ba sbyin par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gal te nyes pa de la rten par mi byed na ni de la ltung ba sbyin par mi bya ste /

analyzed: phyir gso ba'i las kyang yongs su bstan par mi bya'o //

original: de ltar de ni ltung ba yongs su brtag pa mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de ni ltung ba yongs su brtag pa mdor bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas gnas bdun la brten nas /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas gnas bdun la brten nas /
translated: A monk who is striving in the training of the Vinaya should rely on seven bases

analyzed: gnas drug la brtson par bya ste /

original: gnas bdun po gang dag la brten nas /
analyzed: gnas bdun po gang dag la brten nas /

original: gnas drug po gang dag la brtson par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gnas drug po gang dag la brtson par bya zhe na /
translated: What are the six bases in which he should strive?

original: smras pa / ston pa la brten pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / chos gos dang ; bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman yo byad la brten nas /
analyzed: smras pa / ston pa la brten pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / chos gos dang ; bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman yo byad la brten nas /
translated: He should rely on the Teacher, the preceptor, the master, the Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicine for curing the ill,

analyzed: chos la brtson par bya ba dang / bslab pa dang / gdams shing rjes su bstan pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / bgo bsha' dang / bag yod pa la brtson par bya'o //
translated: and he should strive in the Dharma, in the training, in instruction and guidance, in concentration, in sharing, and in heedfulness.

original: de la chos ni so sor thar pa'i mdo dang / de rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos ni so sor thar pa'i mdo dang / de rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is the Sutra of the Code of Discipline and its commentary.

original: de la bslab pa ni blag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: de la bslab pa ni blag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: The training is the training in the higher morality, the training in the higher thought, and the training in the higher wisdom.

original: de la gdams shing rjes su bstan pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la gdams shing rjes su bstan pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: The instruction and the teaching are the instruction and the teaching in the training in the higher morality, the instruction and the teaching in the training in the higher thought, and the instruction and the teaching in the training in the higher wisdom.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
translated: Concentration is the nine step-by-step meditative concentrations.

original: de la bgo bsha' ni zang zing gi bgo bsha' dang / chos kyi bgo bsha'o //
analyzed: de la bgo bsha' ni zang zing gi bgo bsha' dang / chos kyi bgo bsha'o //

analyzed: de la zang zing gi bgo bsha' ni yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i chos drug las gcig gis so //

original: chos kyi bgo bsha' ni lhag ma lngas so //
analyzed: chos kyi bgo bsha' ni lhag ma lngas so //

original: de la bag yod pa ni mkhas pa lnga po phung po la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i bar dag la rtag tu byed pa dang / bsgom @246b pa'i rjes su brtson pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bag yod pa ni mkhas pa lnga po phung po la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i bar dag la rtag tu byed pa dang / bsgom @246b pa'i rjes su brtson pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among these, conscientiousness is the five kinds of expertise: expertise in the aggregates, expertise in the constituents, expertise in the seats of the senses, expertise in dependent origination, and expertise in what is correct and incorrect.

original: 'dul ba la blang ba ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: 'dul ba la blang ba ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /
translated: The five ways of receiving in the Vinaya are:

original: bdag gir bya ba blang ba dang / byin len blang ba dang / gtams pa blang ba dang dbul ba blang ba dang / gzhan gyi phyir blang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gir bya ba blang ba dang / byin len blang ba dang / gtams pa blang ba dang dbul ba blang ba dang / gzhan gyi phyir blang ba'o //
translated: receiving what is one's own, receiving what is given, receiving what is entrusted, receiving what is offered, and receiving for the sake of others.

analyzed: de la bdag gir bya ba blang ba ni rgyu gnyis kyis yongs su ma dag pa yin te /

analyzed: lhag par chags pa dang / sog 'jog byed pa la gdu ba'o //
translated: because of excessive attachment, and because of hoarding.

original: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su dag pa yin no //üîΩbyin len blang ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis yongs su ma dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su dag pa yin no // byin len blang ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis yongs su ma dag pa yin te /

analyzed: gnas ma yin pa las len pa dang / tshod ma zin pa dang / chos bzhin ma yin par len pas so //
translated: because of receiving from improper places, and because of receiving without moderation or in an unrighteous manner.

original: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of these is pure.

original: gtams pa blang ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis yongs su ma dag pa yin te /
analyzed: gtams pa blang ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis yongs su ma dag pa yin te /
translated: Taking what is not given is also impure for two reasons:

original: gang zag ma brtags pa la gtams pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po dang / 'brel pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: gang zag ma brtags pa la gtams pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po dang / 'brel pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: taking what is not given to an untested person, and taking it with a mind attached to improper things.

original: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of these is pure.

original: dbul ba blang ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis yongs su ma dag pa yin te /
analyzed: dbul ba blang ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis yongs su ma dag pa yin te /
translated: Giving is also impure for two reasons:

original: zhing ngan pa la dbul ba blang ba dang / mi ltos pa ma yin par dbul ba blang bas so //
analyzed: zhing ngan pa la dbul ba blang ba dang / mi ltos pa ma yin par dbul ba blang bas so //
translated: giving to a bad field, and giving without regard.

original: de la zhing gsum po yon tan gyi zhing dang / snying brtse ba'i zhing dang / phan 'dogs pa'i zhing ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i zhing dag ni zhing ngan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la zhing gsum po yon tan gyi zhing dang / snying brtse ba'i zhing dang / phan 'dogs pa'i zhing ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i zhing dag ni zhing ngan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, a bad field should be understood as any field other than the three fields: the field of virtues, the field of compassion, and the field of benefits.

original: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of these is pure.

analyzed: gzhan gyi phyir blang ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis yongs su ma dag pa yin te /

original: ma 'dris pa'am ma bcol ba'am /
analyzed: ma 'dris pa'am ma bcol ba'am /
translated: taking from those who are not related, who have not asked, or who are strangers;

original: ngo mi shes pa'i phyir len pa dang ; zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis len pas so //
analyzed: ngo mi shes pa'i phyir len pa dang ; zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis len pas so //
translated: and taking with a mind that is not free of desire for material things.

original: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of these is pure.

original: 'dul ba la dngos po'i longs spyod ni rgyu lngas rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dul ba la dngos po'i longs spyod ni rgyu lngas rung ba ma yin te /
translated: In the Vinaya, the enjoyment of things is not suitable for five reasons:

original: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / rkyen du 'bab pa ma yin pa dang / longs spyod par 'os pa ma yin pa dang / gtogs pa ma yin pa dang / rung ba ma byas pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / rkyen du 'bab pa ma yin pa dang / longs spyod par 'os pa ma yin pa dang / gtogs pa ma yin pa dang / rung ba ma byas pas so //
translated: it is naturally reprehensible, it is not a proper occasion, it is not suitable to be enjoyed, it is not one‚Äôs turn, and it is not prepared.

analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among these, that which is naturally reprehensible is as follows:

original: blugs gzhal la sgyu byed pa dang / srang la sgyu byed pa dang / gzhal ba la sgyu byed pa dang / bsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / bcad pa @247a * //
analyzed: blugs gzhal la sgyu byed pa dang / srang la sgyu byed pa dang / gzhal ba la sgyu byed pa dang / bsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / bcad pa @247a * //

analyzed: dang ; brdeg pa dang / nan gyis gnod pa mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa la brten nas dngos po'i longs spyod thob pa gang yin pa de ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: The enjoyment of wealth that is obtained by means of violence, oppression, and the like, and by means of the most extreme forms of greed, is not proper.

original: de la rkyen du 'bab pa ma yin pa ni zhing gi dngos po dang / khang khyim gyi dngos po dang / tshong khang gi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa'i longs spyod dang / rta dang / glang po che dang / ba lang dang / lug dang /
analyzed: de la rkyen du 'bab pa ma yin pa ni zhing gi dngos po dang / khang khyim gyi dngos po dang / tshong khang gi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa'i longs spyod dang / rta dang / glang po che dang / ba lang dang / lug dang /
translated: In this regard, not suitable refers to the enjoyment of wealth that consists of fields, houses, and shops; the enjoyment of wealth that consists of horses, elephants, cows, sheep,

analyzed: bya dgag dang / phag yongs su 'dzin pa'i longs spyod dang / bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khe'u dang / bu mo yongs su 'dzin pa'i longs spyod dang / bran dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i longs spyod dang /
translated: chickens, and pigs; the enjoyment of wealth that consists of wives, husbands, male and female servants, and sons and daughters; and the enjoyment of wealth that consists of male and female slaves, workers, and employees.

analyzed: gser dang dngul yongs su 'dzin pa'i longs spyod dang / 'bru brtsam pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i longs spyod la sogs pa'o //
translated: the enjoyment of wealth that is held in common, such as gold and silver, and the enjoyment of wealth that is held in common, such as grain.

original: de la longs spyod par 'os pa ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩbshang ba las byas pa'am /
analyzed: de la longs spyod par 'os pa ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste / bshang ba las byas pa'am /
translated: Here, that which is not fit to be enjoyed is as follows:üîΩthat which is made from feces,

analyzed: gci ba las byas pa'am / mchil ma las byas pa'am /
translated: that which is made from urine,üîΩthat which is made from saliva,

original: snabs las byas pa'am /
analyzed: snabs las byas pa'am /
