original: khrag gis gos pa'am /üîΩrnag gis gos pa'am /
analyzed: khrag gis gos pa'am / rnag gis gos pa'am /
translated: that which is stained with blood,üîΩthat which is stained with pus,

original: rnag khrag gis gos pa'am /
analyzed: rnag khrag gis gos pa'am /
translated: that which is stained with blood and pus,

original: zhag dang chu ser la sogs pas gos pa'am /
analyzed: zhag dang chu ser la sogs pas gos pa'am /
translated: that which is stained with fat, lymph, etc.,üîΩand anything similar to that.

original: gzhan yang gang de lta bu dang mthun pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bshang gci la sogs pa'i bum pa ni longs spyod par rung ba ma yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa dag go //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang de lta bu dang mthun pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bshang gci la sogs pa'i bum pa ni longs spyod par rung ba ma yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa dag go //
translated: The Blessed One has said, ‚ÄúA vessel made from feces, urine, etc. is not fit to be enjoyed.‚Äù

original: de la gtogs pa ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gtogs pa ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, that which is not included is as follows:

original: dge 'dun gyi longs spyod mi bsgo ba dang / lhung bzed du ma chud cing /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi longs spyod mi bsgo ba dang / lhung bzed du ma chud cing /
translated: that which is not permitted for the enjoyment of the Sa·πÖgha, and that which does not fit in a begging bowl.

original: ltung bzed du ma gtogs pa dang / gang zag gi longs spyod ma byin pa dang / ma btang ba dang / lhug par ma byas pa dang / yid gcugs pa'i gnas ma yin pa dang / chod ma zin pas so //
analyzed: ltung bzed du ma gtogs pa dang / gang zag gi longs spyod ma byin pa dang / ma btang ba dang / lhug par ma byas pa dang / yid gcugs pa'i gnas ma yin pa dang / chod ma zin pas so //
translated: that which is not given, that which is not relinquished, that which is not let go, that which is not a place of trust, and that which is not a place of agreement.

original: de la rung bar ma byas pa ni rung ba rnam pa lngas rung bar ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: de la rung bar ma byas pa ni rung ba rnam pa lngas rung bar ma byas pa ste /
translated: Among those, that which is not suitable is that which is not suitable due to five types of unsuitability.

original: rung ba lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rung ba lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five types of suitability?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: byin len gyis rung ba dang ; nyams par byas pas rung ba dang / gzhag pas rung ba dang / dus kyi cho gas rung ba dang / rnam par rtog pa gtan spang bas rung ba'o //
analyzed: byin len gyis rung ba dang ; nyams par byas pas rung ba dang / gzhag pas rung ba dang / dus kyi cho gas rung ba dang / rnam par rtog pa gtan spang bas rung ba'o //
translated: that which is suitable through the ritual of giving and receiving, that which is suitable through being spoiled, that which is suitable through being set aside, that which is suitable through the ritual of time, and that which is suitable through completely abandoning conceptual thoughts.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rung ba ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rung ba ma yin no / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa /
translated: The opposite of that is not suitable.

original: 'dul ba ni bca' ba lngas zab par @247b rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba ni bca' ba lngas zab par @247b rig par bya ste /
translated: The Vinaya should be known as profound due to five kinds of composition.

original: bca' ba lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bca' ba lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five kinds of composition?

original: bslab pa bca' ba dang / ltung ba bca' ba dang / nges par 'byung ba bca' ba dang / bag yangs bca' ba dang / las bca' bas so //
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba dang / ltung ba bca' ba dang / nges par 'byung ba bca' ba dang / bag yangs bca' ba dang / las bca' bas so //
translated: The formulation of training, the formulation of downfalls, the formulation of renunciation, the formulation of relaxation, and the formulation of actions.

original: de la bslab pa bca' ba ni gnas lngas zab par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bslab pa bca' ba ni gnas lngas zab par rig par bya ste /
translated: The formulation of training should be known as profound through five points:

original: rang dbang yod pa dang / rang dbang med pa dang / tshul khrims nyams pa'i nyes pa yang dag par bstan pa dang / las ngan pa la mngon par dga' ba'i nyes pa yang dag par bstan pa dang / de gnyis ka'i nyes pa lhag par spyad pa dang lhag par ma spyad pas so //
analyzed: rang dbang yod pa dang / rang dbang med pa dang / tshul khrims nyams pa'i nyes pa yang dag par bstan pa dang / las ngan pa la mngon par dga' ba'i nyes pa yang dag par bstan pa dang / de gnyis ka'i nyes pa lhag par spyad pa dang lhag par ma spyad pas so //
translated: through the presence of independence, the absence of independence, the demonstration of the fault of impaired morality, the demonstration of the fault of delighting in bad actions, and the excess of fault in both of those, whether or not they are engaged in.

original: de la rang dbang yod pa ni 'di yin te /üîΩgang gi tshe 'dul ba rnams nyon mongs pa'i dbang du ma song zhing /
analyzed: de la rang dbang yod pa ni 'di yin te / gang gi tshe 'dul ba rnams nyon mongs pa'i dbang du ma song zhing /
translated: The presence of independence is this:üîΩWhen those who are disciplined are not under the influence of afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rang dbang med par ma byas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rang dbang med par ma byas pa de'i tshe /
translated: and the afflictions do not make them independent,

original: 'dul ba rang dbang can de lta bu dag bslab pa lhag par spyad pa la rang dbang yod pa kho nar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba rang dbang can de lta bu dag bslab pa lhag par spyad pa la rang dbang yod pa kho nar mdzad pa'o //
translated: Such self-controlled disciples are made to have complete independence in the practice of the higher training.

original: de la rang dbang med pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rang dbang med pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the lack of independence:

original: gang gi tshe 'dul ba rnams nyon mongs pa'i dbang du song zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dul ba rnams nyon mongs pa'i dbang du song zhing /
translated: When disciples are dominated by the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rang dbang med par byas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rang dbang med par byas pa de'i tshe /
translated: they are made to be without independence by the afflictions.

original: 'dul ba rang dbang med pa de lta bu dag bslab pa lhag par spyad pa la rang dbang med par mdzad cing bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba rang dbang med pa de lta bu dag bslab pa lhag par spyad pa la rang dbang med par mdzad cing bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: Such disciples, who lack independence, are made to have independence in the practice of the higher training and the bases of training are established.

original: de la tshul khrims nyams pa'i nyes pa yang dag par ston pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims nyams pa'i nyes pa yang dag par ston pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the teaching on the faults of impaired morality:

original: dge ba'i rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang yin pa de gcig tu lhag par spyad par mi bya'o zhes yang dag par gzigs nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang yin pa de gcig tu lhag par spyad par mi bya'o zhes yang dag par gzigs nas /
translated: Having seen that what is by nature virtuous and has a fault should not be practiced at all,

original: tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: the bases of training are established for the sake of protecting morality.

original: de la las ngan pa la mngon par dga' ba'i nyes pa yang dag par ston pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la las ngan pa la mngon par dga' ba'i nyes pa yang dag par ston pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the correct teaching of the fault of delighting in evil actions.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa'i gags su yang dag par gzigs pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa'i gags su yang dag par gzigs pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Buddha established the precepts with proscribed offenses as the antidote to that which obstructs the practice of virtue.

original: de la de gnyi ga'i nyes pa lhag par spyad pa dang / ma spyad pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la de gnyi ga'i nyes pa lhag par spyad pa dang / ma spyad pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The excess of the fault of both of these, whether practiced or not, is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rang dbang yod pa dag la ni nyes pa de lhag par mi spyod par gzigs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rang dbang yod pa dag la ni nyes pa de lhag par mi spyod par gzigs nas /
translated: The TathƒÅgata saw that those who are independent do not excessively practice that fault.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mi mdzad la /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mi mdzad la /
translated: Therefore, he did not establish the precepts.

original: rang dbang @248a * //
analyzed: rang dbang @248a * //
translated: Those who are not independent

original: med pa dag la ni nyes pa de lhag par spyod par gzigs nas bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mdzad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: med pa dag la ni nyes pa de lhag par spyod par gzigs nas bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mdzad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: excessively practice that fault. The TathƒÅgata saw this and established the precepts.

original: de la ltung ba bca' ba yang gnas lngas zab par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ltung ba bca' ba yang gnas lngas zab par rig par bya ste /
translated: The establishment of the downfalls should be known as profound in five ways.

original: de la ltung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is a downfall?

original: dge ba'i chos rnams skye ba la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams skye ba la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: It is that which obstructs the arising of virtuous dharmas.

original: / sgrib pa de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: / sgrib pa de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: That obscuration is of five kinds:

original: lhod pa'i sgrib pa dang / kha na ma tho ba'i sgrib pa dang / khyad du gsod pa'i sgrib pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: lhod pa'i sgrib pa dang / kha na ma tho ba'i sgrib pa dang / khyad du gsod pa'i sgrib pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: the obscuration of laziness, the obscuration of shamelessness and absence of abashment, the obscuration of regret, and the obscuration of knowledge.

original: de la lhod pa'i sgrib pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams la le lo byed cing mngon par mi brtson pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: de la lhod pa'i sgrib pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams la le lo byed cing mngon par mi brtson pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: The obscuration of laziness is the laziness that occurs in relation to virtuous dharmas and the lack of striving for them.

original: / de la kha na ma tho ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa'am /
analyzed: / de la kha na ma tho ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa'am /
translated: The obscuration of shamelessness and absence of abashment is as follows: In this case, someone is afflicted by the affliction of desire,

original: zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa'am /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa'am /
translated: or the affliction of hatred,

original: gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa'am /
analyzed: gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa'am /
translated: or the affliction of delusion,

original: sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa na ;
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa na ;
translated: or by any of the secondary afflictions that arise in the mind.

original: de nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa skyed pa de dang du len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa skyed pa de dang du len par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the acceptance of the arising of the entanglements of the major and minor defilements.

original: de la khyad du gsod pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la las bslab pa la mi 'du zhing bslab pa la gus pa drag po med pa dang / ltung ba la 'jigs par mi lta zhing lhag par 'byin pa dang / lhag par byung na yang phyir chags par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: de la khyad du gsod pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la las bslab pa la mi 'du zhing bslab pa la gus pa drag po med pa dang / ltung ba la 'jigs par mi lta zhing lhag par 'byin pa dang / lhag par byung na yang phyir chags par mi byed pa dang /
translated: Here, the obstruction of contempt is as follows: One does not gather the precepts, does not have a strong respect for the precepts, does not see the danger in a downfall, does not extract it, and does not, when it has arisen, restore it.

original: ston pa dang bslab pa la mi gus pa'i rang bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: ston pa dang bslab pa la mi gus pa'i rang bzhin can yin no //
translated: One has a nature of disrespect for the teacher and the precepts.

original: de la 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la nyon mongs pa can gyi 'gyod pa'i rgyun gyis reg cing /
analyzed: de la 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la nyon mongs pa can gyi 'gyod pa'i rgyun gyis reg cing /
translated: Here, the obstruction of regret is as follows: One is touched by a continuous, defiled regret.

original: 'gyod pa de yang legs par rab tu sel bar mi nus la /üîΩkun du 'gyod pa dang bcas /üîΩrnam par 'gyod pa dang bcas /
analyzed: 'gyod pa de yang legs par rab tu sel bar mi nus la / kun du 'gyod pa dang bcas / rnam par 'gyod pa dang bcas /
translated: One is not able to dispel that regret well.üîΩOne has regret.üîΩOne has remorse.

original: yid la gcags pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yid la gcags pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: One has anxiety.

original: de la shes bya'i sgrib pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la shes bya'i sgrib pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the obstruction of the knowable is as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'di ni yid la bcags pa dang bcas pa la la bslab pa rnam par ma dag pa'i gzhi'i rgyus mchog tu dga' ba mi skye la ;üîΩrab tu dga' ba mi skye /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni yid la bcags pa dang bcas pa la la bslab pa rnam par ma dag pa'i gzhi'i rgyus mchog tu dga' ba mi skye la ; rab tu dga' ba mi skye /
translated: Thus, for those who are not completely pure in their training, supreme joy does not arise due to the cause of the basis.üîΩFor those who are not joyful, joy does not arise.

original: rab tu mi dga' ba la ni dga' ba mi skye ba nas /
analyzed: rab tu mi dga' ba la ni dga' ba mi skye ba nas /
translated: For those who are not delighted, delight does not arise.

original: sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i bar du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i bar du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Up to: for those who are not concentrated, the mind does not become concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par ma bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mi shes shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthong bas /
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mi shes shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthong bas /
translated: For those whose minds are not concentrated, they do not know and see things as they really are.

original: de'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib @248b pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib @248b pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the obscuration of the knowable.

original: de la lhod pa'i sgrib pas reg pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang du len pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la lhod pa'i sgrib pas reg pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang du len pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur la /
translated: Among them, those touched by the obscuration of laxity become inclined towards afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: dang du len pa'i rang bzhin can ni kha na ma tho ba'i sgrib pas reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang du len pa'i rang bzhin can ni kha na ma tho ba'i sgrib pas reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are inclined become touched by the obscuration of wrongdoing.

original: kha na ma tho ba'i sgrib pas reg na /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba'i sgrib pas reg na /
translated: When touched by the obscuration of wrongdoing,

original: bslab pa dag la gus pa drag po med cing ltung ba 'byin 'dod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bslab pa dag la gus pa drag po med cing ltung ba 'byin 'dod par 'gyur la /
translated: He has no intense respect for the precepts and he wishes to commit transgressions.

original: de ltar ltung ba 'byin 'dod pa ni khyad du gsod pa'i sgrib pas reg par 'gyur ro //üîΩkhyad du gsod pa'i sgrib pas reg na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la gcags pa skyed cing /
analyzed: de ltar ltung ba 'byin 'dod pa ni khyad du gsod pa'i sgrib pas reg par 'gyur ro // khyad du gsod pa'i sgrib pas reg na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la gcags pa skyed cing /
translated: Thus, he who wishes to commit transgressions is touched by the obscuration of contempt.üîΩWhen he is touched by the obscuration of contempt, he generates remorse.

original: yid la gcags pa skyes pa sel bar yang mi nus par 'gyur bas de ni 'gyod pa'i sgrib pas reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid la gcags pa skyes pa sel bar yang mi nus par 'gyur bas de ni 'gyod pa'i sgrib pas reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he is unable to remove the remorse, he is touched by the obscuration of regret.

original: 'gyod pa'i sgrib pas reg pa ni yid la gcags pa dang bcas pa yin pas des na de'i sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i bar du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i sgrib pas reg pa ni yid la gcags pa dang bcas pa yin pas des na de'i sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i bar du mi 'gyur la /
translated: Since he is touched by the obscuration of regret, he is remorseful. Therefore, he is unable to settle his mind in meditative equipoise.

original: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa shes bya'i sgrib pas reg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa shes bya'i sgrib pas reg par 'gyur te /
translated: Since his mind is not settled in meditative equipoise, he is touched by the obscuration of the knowable.

original: de ni sgrib pa de dag gi go rims yin no //
analyzed: de ni sgrib pa de dag gi go rims yin no //
translated: This is the order of the obscurations.

original: de dag las bzlog pa sgrib pa med pa lngas ni lhod pa'i sgrib pa med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba'i sgrib pa med pa dang / khyad du gsod pa'i sgrib pa med pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa med pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa sgrib pa med pa lngas ni lhod pa'i sgrib pa med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba'i sgrib pa med pa dang / khyad du gsod pa'i sgrib pa med pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa med pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The five kinds of absence of obscuration that are the opposite of those are the absence of obscuration of relaxation, the absence of obscuration of offense, the absence of obscuration of contempt, the absence of obscuration of regret, and the absence of obscuration of the knowable.

original: de la lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams pas ni re zhig ltung ba la slong bar yang mi 'gyur na /üîΩltung ba med par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams pas ni re zhig ltung ba la slong bar yang mi 'gyur na / ltung ba med par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: Among those, due to the degeneration of superior intention, one does not even rise from a downfall, let alone be without a downfall.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa nyams pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the degeneration of superior intention?

original: de yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: That should be viewed as fivefold:

original: brtson 'grus rtsom mi 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom mi 'dod pa yin /
translated: not wanting to make effort,

original: nyon mongs pa dang du len 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang du len 'dod pa yin /
translated: wanting to accept the afflictions,

original: ltung ba lhag par 'byin 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: ltung ba lhag par 'byin 'dod pa yin /
translated: wanting to commit a downfall,

original: 'gyod pa sel bar mi 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: 'gyod pa sel bar mi 'dod pa yin /
translated: not wanting to clear away regret,

original: ting nge 'dzin sgrub par mi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sgrub par mi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: and not wanting to accomplish concentration.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni ltung ba yang med na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni ltung ba yang med na /
translated: If one has perfect superior intention, one does not have downfalls,üîΩlet alone the absence of obscuration.

original: ltung ba las bslang ba lta smod kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: ltung ba las bslang ba lta smod kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention falling into a downfall?

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the perfection of superior intention?

original: de yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as fivefold:

original: brtson 'grus rtsom 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom 'dod pa yin /
translated: the wish to undertake perseverance,

original: nyon mongs pa dang du len mi 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang du len mi 'dod pa yin /
translated: the wish not to acquiesce in the afflictions,

original: ltung ba 'byin mi 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin mi 'dod pa yin /
translated: the wish not to commit a downfall,

original: 'gyod pa sel 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: 'gyod pa sel 'dod pa yin /
translated: the wish to eliminate regret,

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgrub par 'dod pa yin no //üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis nga ni bsam pa thag @249a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgrub par 'dod pa yin no // bcom ldan 'das kyis nga ni bsam pa thag @249a * //
translated: and the wish to accomplish meditative concentration.üîΩThe Blessed One has said, ‚ÄúI teach the recovery from downfalls through the power of resolve, not through the rite of demotion.‚Äù

original: pas ltung ba las ldang bar smra ba'i chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa de la ltung ba ni gnas bcu las yongs su btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: pas ltung ba las ldang bar smra ba'i chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa de la ltung ba ni gnas bcu las yongs su btsal bar bya ste /
translated: In this regard, a downfall should be investigated in terms of ten points:

original: so sor thar pa'i chos dang / de rnam par 'byed pa'i 'dul ba dang / ltung ba sde lnga po dag gi ltung ba yang ba'i mtshan nyid dang / lci ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag drug po bca' ba'i bye brag dang / dngos po'i bye brag dang /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i chos dang / de rnam par 'byed pa'i 'dul ba dang / ltung ba sde lnga po dag gi ltung ba yang ba'i mtshan nyid dang / lci ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag drug po bca' ba'i bye brag dang / dngos po'i bye brag dang /
translated: the subject matter of the Pratimoksa, the Vinaya that analyzes it, the characteristics of the light and heavy downfalls of the five classes of downfalls, the six specific categories of downfalls, the specific categories of the actual basis,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bye brag dang / nyes pa'i bye brag dang / gang zag gi bye brag dang / dus kyi bye brag dang / 'dzem pa med pa'i phan pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bye brag dang / nyes pa'i bye brag dang / gang zag gi bye brag dang / dus kyi bye brag dang / 'dzem pa med pa'i phan pa ma gtogs par /
translated: the specific categories of affliction, the specific categories of faults, the specific categories of persons, the specific categories of time, and the characteristics of the remaining downfalls other than the beneficial downfalls that are not to be feared,

original: de las gzhan pa lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / las dang bo pa dang las dang po pa ma yin pa lhag par spyod pa dang / lhag par spyod pa de dge slong rnams kyis ston pa la bsnyad pa dang / bsnyad nas ston par ltung ba bca' ba'i phyir dge 'dun bsdu ba dang /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / las dang bo pa dang las dang po pa ma yin pa lhag par spyod pa dang / lhag par spyod pa de dge slong rnams kyis ston pa la bsnyad pa dang / bsnyad nas ston par ltung ba bca' ba'i phyir dge 'dun bsdu ba dang /
translated: the practice of the beginners and the non-beginners, the teaching of the monks to the Teacher of the specific practice, and the gathering of the Sangha by the Teacher for the purpose of establishing the downfalls after they have been reported.

original: bsdus nas dge 'dun la ltung ba byas pa dang / ltung ba bcas ba la phyis rjes su gnang ba dang / bkag pa las so //
analyzed: bsdus nas dge 'dun la ltung ba byas pa dang / ltung ba bcas ba la phyis rjes su gnang ba dang / bkag pa las so //
translated: and the subsequent permission, and the prohibition.

original: de la nges par 'byung ba bcas pa yang gnas lngas zab par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la nges par 'byung ba bcas pa yang gnas lngas zab par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the prohibition should be known as profound through five points:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas nges par 'byung ba dang / gnod pas nges par 'byung ba dang / bar chad kyis nges par 'byung ba dang / gnyen po med pas nges par 'byung ba dang / bshags pas nges par 'byung bas so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas nges par 'byung ba dang / gnod pas nges par 'byung ba dang / bar chad kyis nges par 'byung ba dang / gnyen po med pas nges par 'byung ba dang / bshags pas nges par 'byung bas so //
translated: prohibition through non-affliction, prohibition through harm, prohibition through obstacles, prohibition through lack of antidote, and prohibition through confession.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas nges par 'byung ba ni 'di ltar 'di na ltung ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos phran tshegs phra ba gang yang rung ba lhag par spyad pa la la zhig la gal te dge ba'i chos rnams ni mngon par 'phel
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas nges par 'byung ba ni 'di ltar 'di na ltung ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos phran tshegs phra ba gang yang rung ba lhag par spyad pa la la zhig la gal te dge ba'i chos rnams ni mngon par 'phel
translated: Among them, prohibition through non-affliction is as follows: If, in this case, for someone who has engaged in any minor or subtle phenomenon that is conducive to the basis of an offense, the virtuous dharmas increase

original: la / mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur na /
analyzed: la / mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur na /
translated: and the non-virtuous dharmas decrease,

original: des de kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur te /üîΩde la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid nges par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des de kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur te / de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid nges par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: He does not become defiled by that,üîΩbecause the absence of defilement is itself the escape from that.

original: de ni de'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas nges par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas nges par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: That is the escape from defilement for him.

original: de la gnod pas nges par 'byung ba ni gal te gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / nad tsha bas che bas /
analyzed: de la gnod pas nges par 'byung ba ni gal te gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / nad tsha bas che bas /
translated: The escape from harm is as follows: If he commits a transgression,üîΩexcept for naturally reprehensible actions, and if he is overwhelmed by harm,

original: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ma gtogs pa'i ltung ba'i gnas dang mi mthun pa'i chos gzhan dag lhar par spyod na /üîΩde la gnod pa kho nas @249b nges par 'byung ba'i phyir de ni de'i gnod pas nges par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ma gtogs pa'i ltung ba'i gnas dang mi mthun pa'i chos gzhan dag lhar par spyod na / de la gnod pa kho nas @249b nges par 'byung ba'i phyir de ni de'i gnod pas nges par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: suffering, or illness,üîΩthen the escape from harm is the escape for him.

original: de la bar chad kyis nges par 'byung ba ni gal te srog gi bar chad dam /
analyzed: de la bar chad kyis nges par 'byung ba ni gal te srog gi bar chad dam /
translated: The escape from obstacles is as follows: If he is obstructed by obstacles to life,

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad mthong nas ltung ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos phran tshegs phra ba gang yang rung ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na ;
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad mthong nas ltung ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos phran tshegs phra ba gang yang rung ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na ;
translated: If, having seen an obstacle to pure conduct, he commits a minor offense that is a basis for downfall,

original: de la bar chad kho nas nges par 'byung ba'i phyir de ni de'i bar chad kyis nges par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la bar chad kho nas nges par 'byung ba'i phyir de ni de'i bar chad kyis nges par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: then, because of that obstacle alone, he is definitely liberated.

original: de la gnyen po med pas nges par 'byung ba ni gal te gus pa'i rang bzhin can yul gzhan na 'dug gam /
analyzed: de la gnyen po med pas nges par 'byung ba ni gal te gus pa'i rang bzhin can yul gzhan na 'dug gam /
translated: ‚ÄúLiberation through the absence of an antidote‚Äù means that if someone who is naturally respectful is staying in another country

original: 'brog dgon pa na 'dug pa zhig gis yongs su longs spyod par bya ba'i dngos po gang yang rung ba zhi la yongs su longs spyod pa'i cho ga ma rnyed dam /
analyzed: 'brog dgon pa na 'dug pa zhig gis yongs su longs spyod par bya ba'i dngos po gang yang rung ba zhi la yongs su longs spyod pa'i cho ga ma rnyed dam /
translated: or in a remote wilderness, he may not find the proper means to enjoy the things that are to be enjoyed.

original: bar chad kyi gnas lta bu'i chos gang yang rung bas /
analyzed: bar chad kyi gnas lta bu'i chos gang yang rung bas /
translated: Or, because of some obstacle,

original: dngos po de yongs su longs spyod de /
analyzed: dngos po de yongs su longs spyod de /
translated: he may enjoy those things.

original: ltung ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos phran tshegs phra ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na /
analyzed: ltung ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos phran tshegs phra ba'i ltung ba byung bar gyur na /
translated: If he commits a minor offense that is a basis for downfall,

original: de la gnyen po med pa kho nas nges par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gnyen po med pa kho nas nges par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no antidote to the latter, it is definitely released.

original: de ni de'i gnyen po med pas nges par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i gnyen po med pas nges par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is definitely released because there is no antidote to it.

original: de la bshags pas nges par 'byung ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la ltung ba ste lnga po dag las lhag ma dang bcas pa'i ltung ba byung ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyi mdun du 'dul ba'i gsang bas 'chags par byed /üîΩmthol bar byed /
analyzed: de la bshags pas nges par 'byung ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la ltung ba ste lnga po dag las lhag ma dang bcas pa'i ltung ba byung ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyi mdun du 'dul ba'i gsang bas 'chags par byed / mthol bar byed /
translated: Confession is the definite release of the former, since one who has committed a downfall with remainder among the five downfalls confesses it in the presence of learned companions in virtue, by the secret of the Vinaya.

original: chos bzhin du phyir gso bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos bzhin du phyir gso bar byed pa'o //
translated: One confesses and reveals it, and restores it in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de la ltung ba phran tshogs phra ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ltung ba phran tshogs phra ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The subtle minor infractions are those that are naturally reprehensible.

original: de la bag yangs bca' ba yang gnas lngas zab par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bag yangs bca' ba yang gnas lngas zab par rig par bya ste /
translated: The proclamation of indulgence should be known as profound in five ways.

original: rnam par dag pa dang / dbyen spang ba dang / gang zag rlabs po che don chen po dang ldan pa gzhug pa dang / bstan pa 'phel bar bya ba dang / dka' bas 'tsho ba spang bas so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dang / dbyen spang ba dang / gang zag rlabs po che don chen po dang ldan pa gzhug pa dang / bstan pa 'phel bar bya ba dang / dka' bas 'tsho ba spang bas so //
translated: 1. purity, 2. avoidance of schism, 3. admission of the individual of great importance, 4. increase of the teaching, 5. avoidance of difficult livelihood.

original: de la rnam par dag pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here purity is as follows:

original: dgra bcom pa dag bya ba byas pa rnams kyi dge 'dun du gyur na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag bya ba byas pa rnams kyi dge 'dun du gyur na /
translated: When the Arhats, who have done what had to be done, become the Sangha,

analyzed: de dag gi bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba thams cad ni rnam par dag pa des ba yangs su gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be known that all the minor bases of training are pure, purified, and cleansed by that purity.

original: de la dbyen spangs ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dbyen spangs ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here avoidance of schism is as follows:

original: dge 'dun gyi nang na dge slong kha cig ni ltung ba byung ba la ma byung bar 'du shes pa @250a * //üîΩdang ; ltung ba ma byung ba la byung bar 'du shes la /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang na dge slong kha cig ni ltung ba byung ba la ma byung bar 'du shes pa @250a * // dang ; ltung ba ma byung ba la byung bar 'du shes la /
translated: In the Sangha, some monks perceive a downfall as not a downfall,üîΩand some perceive a non-downfall as a downfall.

original: kha cig ni ltung ba byung ba la byung bar 'du shes pa dang / ltung ba ma byung lam byung bar 'du shes pas /
analyzed: kha cig ni ltung ba byung ba la byung bar 'du shes pa dang / ltung ba ma byung lam byung bar 'du shes pas /
translated: Some perceive a downfall as a downfall, and some perceive a non-downfall as a non-downfall.

original: gzhi des 'thab mo dang mtshang 'dru ba dang / 'gyed pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing des dge 'dun mi bde bar 'gyur ba dang / de'i phyir rtsod pa de nyid zhi bar byed pa'i phyir dge 'dun mthun pas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshogs phra ba bag yangs su byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi des 'thab mo dang mtshang 'dru ba dang / 'gyed pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing des dge 'dun mi bde bar 'gyur ba dang / de'i phyir rtsod pa de nyid zhi bar byed pa'i phyir dge 'dun mthun pas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshogs phra ba bag yangs su byed pa'o //
translated: In order to pacify that dispute, the Sa·πÖgha, in agreement, by means of a proposal and a four-part formal procedure, relaxes the minor training rules.

original: de la gang zag rlabs po che don chen po dang ldan pa gzhug pa ni 'di yin te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gang zag rlabs po che don chen po dang ldan pa gzhug pa ni 'di yin te 'di lta ste /
translated: The introduction of a person of great importance and great purpose is as follows.

original: dge 'dun gyis gang zag rigs mthon po bstan pa la gces spras byed pa zhig rnyed la /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gang zag rigs mthon po bstan pa la gces spras byed pa zhig rnyed la /
translated: The Sa·πÖgha finds a person of high caste who cherishes the teachings.

original: de yang de ltar ma byas na 'jug par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de yang de ltar ma byas na 'jug par mi 'gyur na /
translated: But if he does not enter the order, he will not be able to practice.

original: de gzhug pa'i don du dge 'dun mthun pas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba bag yangs su byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gzhug pa'i don du dge 'dun mthun pas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba bag yangs su byed pa'o //
translated: In order to introduce him, the Sa·πÖgha, in agreement, by means of a proposal and a four-part formal procedure, relaxes the minor training rules.

original: de la bstan pa 'phel bar bya ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bstan pa 'phel bar bya ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The flourishing of the teachings is as follows.

original: dus kyi mtha' rtsod pa'i dus kyi dus ngan pa byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' rtsod pa'i dus kyi dus ngan pa byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When the final period of the doctrine, the bad period of conflict, arises,

original: sems can dag bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba mang po dag la slob par mi 'dod cing /
analyzed: sems can dag bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba mang po dag la slob par mi 'dod cing /
translated: sentient beings do not wish to train in the many minor bases of training.

original: ma zhugs pa ni mi 'jug la /
analyzed: ma zhugs pa ni mi 'jug la /
translated: Those who have not entered the training do not enter it.

original: zhugs pa ni sgyid lug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhugs pa ni sgyid lug par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who have entered it become lazy.

original: des bstan pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing 'phel bar mi 'gyur bas ;
analyzed: des bstan pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing 'phel bar mi 'gyur bas ;
translated: Thus the doctrine declines and does not increase.

original: gzhi de'i phyir dge 'dun pas bstan pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba bag yangs su byed pa po /
analyzed: gzhi de'i phyir dge 'dun pas bstan pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba bag yangs su byed pa po /
translated: Therefore, in order to increase the doctrine, the sa·πÖgha makes a relaxation of the minor bases of training through the rite of proposal and the four requests.

original: de la dka' bas 'tsho ba spang ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dka' bas 'tsho ba spang ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The avoidance of difficult livelihood is as follows.

original: dus kyi mtha' rtsod pa'i dus kyi dus ngan pa 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: dus kyi mtha' rtsod pa'i dus kyi dus ngan pa 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When the final period of the doctrine, the bad period of conflict, arises,

original: dge slong dag bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba'i rgyus dka' bas 'tsho bar byed pas de'i phyir dka' bas 'tsho ba de nyid bag yangs su bya ba'i phyir dge 'dun mthun pas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshogs phra ba bag yangs su
analyzed: dge slong dag bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra ba'i rgyus dka' bas 'tsho bar byed pas de'i phyir dka' bas 'tsho ba de nyid bag yangs su bya ba'i phyir dge 'dun mthun pas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshogs phra ba bag yangs su
translated: Monks, since you live a life of difficulty due to the cause of the minute details of the bases of training, in order to relax the difficulty of that life, the Sa·πÖgha in harmony relaxes the minute details of the bases of training through a proposal and a formal procedure of asking three times.

original: byed pa'o // las bca' ba ni las bcu la gang zag lngas zab par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa'o // las bca' ba ni las bcu la gang zag lngas zab par rig par bya ste /
translated: The five persons should know the composition of the ten actions.

original: las bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: las bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten actions?

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las dang / sa tshigs kyi las dang / gso sbyong gi las dang / gnang ba'i las dang / gnas par khas blang ba dang / dgag dbye'i las dang / chad pa'i las dang / phan gdags pa'i las @250b dang ; gsod ba dang /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las dang / sa tshigs kyi las dang / gso sbyong gi las dang / gnang ba'i las dang / gnas par khas blang ba dang / dgag dbye'i las dang / chad pa'i las dang / phan gdags pa'i las @250b dang ; gsod ba dang /
translated: The action of full ordination, the action of the boundary, the action of the purification day, the action of permission, the action of accepting a place of residence, the action of the invitation ceremony, the action of punishment, the action of benefit, the action of killing,

original: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las so //
analyzed: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las so //
translated: the action of proposal and the action of proposal and asking three times.

original: gang zag lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five persons?

original: gang zag cang shes lta bu dang / gang zag ni tso lta bu dang / gang zag skar mda' lta bu dang / gang zag glog lta bu dang / gang zag ri mo bri ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang zag cang shes lta bu dang / gang zag ni tso lta bu dang / gang zag skar mda' lta bu dang / gang zag glog lta bu dang / gang zag ri mo bri ba lta bu'o //
translated: and the person who is like a drawing.

original: gang zag cang shes lta bu gang zhe na /üîΩlas bcu po de dag la don la rton pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag cang shes lta bu gang zhe na / las bcu po de dag la don la rton pa yin gyi /
translated: What is the person who is like a clever horse?

original: tshig 'bru la rton pa ma yin gyi dang / don la rton nas 'jug par byed kyi /
analyzed: tshig 'bru la rton pa ma yin gyi dang / don la rton nas 'jug par byed kyi /
translated: He is one who relies on the meaning and not on the letter,üîΩwho penetrates the meaning and not the letter,üîΩand who practices the meaning and not the letter.

original: sgra la ma yin pa dang / tshig gi las de ma byas kyang don gang la tshig de 'jug pa'i don de kun du spyod pa gang yin pa'o gang zag ni tso lta bu gang zhe na /üîΩtshig 'bru la rton pa yin gyi /üîΩdon la rton pa ma yin pa dang / tshig 'bru la brten nas 'jug par byed kyi /
analyzed: sgra la ma yin pa dang / tshig gi las de ma byas kyang don gang la tshig de 'jug pa'i don de kun du spyod pa gang yin pa'o gang zag ni tso lta bu gang zhe na / tshig 'bru la rton pa yin gyi / don la rton pa ma yin pa dang / tshig 'bru la brten nas 'jug par byed kyi /
translated: What is the person who is like a parrot?üîΩHe is one who relies on the letter and not on the meaning,üîΩwho penetrates the letter and not the meaning,

original: don gang la tshig de 'jug pa la mi 'jug pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: don gang la tshig de 'jug pa la mi 'jug pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: and who practices the letter and not the meaning.

original: gang zag skar mda' lta bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag skar mda' lta bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the person who is like a shooting star?

original: 'di ltar 'di na gang zag la la las kyi gzhi chung ngu zhig dang phrad na yang sgro 'dogs pa mang du byas nas kun du spyod bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na gang zag la la las kyi gzhi chung ngu zhig dang phrad na yang sgro 'dogs pa mang du byas nas kun du spyod bar byed pa ste /
translated: Thus, in this world, some people, when they encounter a small basis for action, engage in conduct by exaggerating it a great deal.

original: dper na skar mda' lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skar mda' lta bu'o //
translated: They are like a shooting star.

original: gang zag glog lta bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag glog lta bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is a person who is like lightning?

original: 'di ltar 'di na gang zag la la res 'ga' ni las legs par bslab par kun du snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na gang zag la la res 'ga' ni las legs par bslab par kun du snang la /
translated: Thus, in this world, some people are sometimes seen to be well trained in their actions,

original: res 'ga' ni kun du mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni kun du mi snang ba ste /
translated: and sometimes they are not seen to be so.

original: dper na glog lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na glog lta bu'o //
translated: They are like lightning.

original: gang zag ri mo bri ba lta bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag ri mo bri ba lta bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is a person who is like a drawing?

original: 'di ltar 'di na gang zag la la ji skad smras pa'i las la de kho na bzhin du 'jug par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na gang zag la la ji skad smras pa'i las la de kho na bzhin du 'jug par byed cing /
translated: Thus, in this world, some people engage in actions just as they are described,

original: lhag chad med par byed pa ste /
analyzed: lhag chad med par byed pa ste /
translated: and they do not do anything in excess or less than what is required.

original: dper na ri mo bri ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ri mo bri ba lta bu'o //
translated: They are like a drawing.

original: 'dul ba lhad can gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dul ba lhad can gang zhe na /
translated: What is a corrupt monastic discipline?

original: lhad can ni lnga ste /
analyzed: lhad can ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of corruption:

original: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba lhad can dang / ltung ba bca' ba lhad can dang / des par 'byung ba bca' ba lhan can dang / bag yangs bca' ba lhad can dang / las bca' ba lhan can no //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba lhad can dang / ltung ba bca' ba lhad can dang / des par 'byung ba bca' ba lhan can dang / bag yangs bca' ba lhad can dang / las bca' ba lhan can no //
translated: 1. the rule of training with a flaw, 2. the rule of downfall with a flaw, 3. the rule of renunciation with a flaw, 4. the rule of relaxation with a flaw, and 5. the rule of action with a flaw.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba lhad can gang zhe na /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba lhad can gang zhe na /
translated: What is the rule of training with a flaw?

original: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdo sde la yang mi 'jug //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdo sde la yang mi 'jug //
translated: The rule of training is not included in the sutras,

original: 'dul ba la yang mi snang chos nyid dang yang mi mthun pa'o //

analyzed: don dam pa rab tu shes nas kyang /
translated: And having understood the ultimate,

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyi spong ba mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyi spong ba mngon sum du byed do //
translated: one realizes the abandonment of the phenomena to be abandoned by seeing and cultivation.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa gnyis kyis ni bya ba'i mtha' rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa gnyis kyis ni bya ba'i mtha' rab tu shes so //
translated: By means of the two knowledges of elimination and non-arising, one understands the limit of what is to be done.

original: bya ba'i mtha' rab tu shes nas kyang nges pa dang / the tshom @252b med pa dang / rang gi spangs pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med do //
analyzed: bya ba'i mtha' rab tu shes nas kyang nges pa dang / the tshom @252b med pa dang / rang gi spangs pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med do //
translated: And having understood the limit of what is to be done, one has certainty, no doubt, and no pride in one's own abandonment.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pas ni gzhan dag gis sems kyi rgyu ba dge ba dang mi dge ba rab tu shes so //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pas ni gzhan dag gis sems kyi rgyu ba dge ba dang mi dge ba rab tu shes so //
translated: By means of the knowledge of others' minds, one understands the virtuous and non-virtuous mental activities of others.

original: de rab tu shes nas kyang gzhan dag gi bsam pa dang khams dang bag la nyal shes so //
analyzed: de rab tu shes nas kyang gzhan dag gi bsam pa dang khams dang bag la nyal shes so //
translated: Having understood that, he understands the thoughts, characters, and dispositions of others.

original: stobs bcu'i shes pas ni shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad rab tu shes so //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i shes pas ni shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad rab tu shes so //
translated: With the knowledge of the ten powers, he understands all aspects of the knowable.

original: de rab tu shes nas kyang gzhan dag la yang dag par gdams shing rjes su bstan pa rnam pa thams cad 'jug par byed cing sems can thams cad kyi som nyi thams cad kyi som nyi mthas cad kyis gcod par byed /
analyzed: de rab tu shes nas kyang gzhan dag la yang dag par gdams shing rjes su bstan pa rnam pa thams cad 'jug par byed cing sems can thams cad kyi som nyi thams cad kyi som nyi mthas cad kyis gcod par byed /
translated: Having understood that, he gives instructions and teachings to others in all their aspects, and he cuts through all the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams mtho ris dang bde ba'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams mtho ris dang bde ba'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed cing /
translated: He establishes sentient beings in the result of heaven and happiness.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad la mthu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad la mthu yod pa yin te /
translated: He has the power to do all that needs to be done for all sentient beings.

original: de ni shes bya rnam pa lnga po de'i las rnam pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: de ni shes bya rnam pa lnga po de'i las rnam pa lnga yin no //
translated: This is the fivefold activity of the five kinds of knowable things.

original: de la shes pa'i rten ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la shes pa'i rten ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The basis of knowledge is twofold:

original: rang la phan pa bsgrub pa dang / gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rang la phan pa bsgrub pa dang / gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa'o //
translated: accomplishing one‚Äôs own goal and accomplishing the goals of others.

original: de la spong ba dang rjes su mthun pa kun rdzob shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba la don dam pa shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba la bya ba'i mtha' shes pa gang yin pa de dag ni rang la phan pa'i rten dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la spong ba dang rjes su mthun pa kun rdzob shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba la don dam pa shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba la bya ba'i mtha' shes pa gang yin pa de dag ni rang la phan pa'i rten dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The conventional knowledge that is favorable to abandonment, the ultimate knowledge that is the object of abandonment, and the knowledge of the limit of what is to be done that is the object of abandonment should be understood as the basis for one's own benefit.

original: de la gzhan dag gi bsam pa dang / khams dang / bag la nyal dag la pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang yin pa dang / shes bya rnam pa thams cad la stobs bcu'i shes pa gang yin pa'i shes pa de gnyis ni gzhan la phan pa'i rten dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag gi bsam pa dang / khams dang / bag la nyal dag la pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang yin pa dang / shes bya rnam pa thams cad la stobs bcu'i shes pa gang yin pa'i shes pa de gnyis ni gzhan la phan pa'i rten dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The knowledge that is the knowledge of others' minds regarding the thoughts, elements, and latent tendencies of others, and the knowledge that is the ten powers' knowledge of all objects of knowledge, should be understood as the basis for benefiting others.

original: de ni shes pa'i rten gyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'di yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni shes pa'i rten gyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'di yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the classification of the basis of knowledge that should be understood.

original: shes pa'i rab tu dbye bas kun rdzob shes pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bsten pa dang / zag pa dang / bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rab tu dbye bas kun rdzob shes pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bsten pa dang / zag pa dang / bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Conventional knowledge is to be understood as virtuous, nonvirtuous, indeterminate, contaminated, uncontaminated, mundane, and supramundane.

original: de la zag pa med pa ni spangs pa mi slob pa'i rgyud la dmigs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa ni spangs pa mi slob pa'i rgyud la dmigs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Among them, uncontaminated knowledge is that which focuses on the elimination of nonlearners.

original: de dang gzhan de dag thams cad ni kun rdzob shes pa 'jig rten pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang gzhan de dag thams cad ni kun rdzob shes pa 'jig rten pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: All other conventional knowledge is mundane.

original: lhag ma chos dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa la sogs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma chos dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa la sogs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining knowledge of phenomena, subsequent, and so on are to be understood as supramundane and uncontaminated.

original: zad pa shes pa dang mis skye ba shes pa yang zag pa zad pa dag la skye zhing /üîΩbdag @253a * //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang mis skye ba shes pa yang zag pa zad pa dag la skye zhing / bdag @253a * //
translated: Knowledge of elimination and knowledge of nonarising arise in relation to the elimination of contaminants.üîΩThey think:

original: gi zag pa rnams ni zad do //
analyzed: gi zag pa rnams ni zad do //
translated: My contaminants are eliminated.

original: bdag la ni tshe phyi mar sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: bdag la ni tshe phyi mar sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: I will not actualize suffering in a future life.

original: snyam du zad pa dang mi skye ba de la longs su gcod par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: snyam du zad pa dang mi skye ba de la longs su gcod par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of elimination and nonproduction that does not eliminate the knowledge of elimination and nonproduction is uncontaminated and transcendent.

original: yongs su gcod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yongs su gcod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa kho na yin te /
translated: The knowledge of elimination and nonproduction that does eliminate the knowledge of elimination and nonproduction is uncontaminated alone.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa ste /
translated: It is not mundane.

original: pa ste / kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ste / kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: It is included in conventional knowledge.

original: ma 'dres pa yin zhing dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la yod pa yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa yin zhing dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la yod pa yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is unmixed and it should be seen as existing in the mindstream of an arhat.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni 'jig rten pa kho na ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni 'jig rten pa kho na ste /
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is mundane alone.

original: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa'i rgyud la yod pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa'i rgyud la yod pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That existing in the mindstreams of ordinary beings and learners is contaminated.

original: mi slob pa'i rgyud la yod pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i rgyud la yod pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa yin no //
translated: That existing in the mindstream of a nonlearner is uncontaminated.

original: ci'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa dag pa'i rgyud la yod pa gang yin pa de zag pa med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa dag pa'i rgyud la yod pa gang yin pa de zag pa med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it that conventional knowledge existing in pure mindstreams is called uncontaminated?

original: 'di ltar de dag gis zag pa'i bag la nyal gang yin pa de yang dag par bcom pa dang / shes pa de yang pha rol gyi sems shes pa kho na'i mngon sum gyi spyod yul yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gis zag pa'i bag la nyal gang yin pa de yang dag par bcom pa dang / shes pa de yang pha rol gyi sems shes pa kho na'i mngon sum gyi spyod yul yin la /
translated: Thus, the latent states of the contaminants that are destroyed by that knowledge and that knowledge itself are the domain of direct intuition that is knowledge of the minds of others.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa de yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa de yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that knowledge of the minds of others is not defiled.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa can gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa dang / de ni rang bzhin gyis kyang nyon mongs pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa can gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa dang / de ni rang bzhin gyis kyang nyon mongs pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not the domain of other defiled states and it is not naturally associated with the defilements.

original: de lta bas na de ni bag la nyal dang / dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa las kyang zag pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni bag la nyal dang / dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa las kyang zag pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that it is uncontaminated because it is not associated with latent states, objective supports, or the defilements.

original: stobs bcu'i shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i mkhyen pa ma 'dres pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i mkhyen pa ma 'dres pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The knowledge of the ten powers should be regarded as the uncontaminated and unshared intuition that exists in the mental continuum of a tathagata.

original: 'di ltar shes pa de dag thams cad ni spros pa dang bcas par rgyu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa de dag thams cad ni spros pa dang bcas par rgyu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all of these consciousnesses operate with conceptual proliferation.

original: de la de las gzhan pa'i shes pa bsdus pa'i rab tu dbye ba gang yin na /
analyzed: de la de las gzhan pa'i shes pa bsdus pa'i rab tu dbye ba gang yin na /
translated: What is the classification of consciousness that is not included in those?

original: mngon par shes pa'i shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa dang / nyon mongs par med pa'i shes pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa dang / nyon mongs par med pa'i shes pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang /
translated: It is the consciousness of the superknowledges, the consciousness of the doors of liberation, the consciousness of the correct and discerning awarenesses, the consciousness of the absence of afflictions, the consciousness of aspiration, the consciousness of the unique qualities of the Buddha,

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dag ste /
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dag ste /
translated: the consciousness of the powers, the consciousness of the fearlessnesses, the consciousness of the establishments of mindfulness, and the consciousness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: @253b shes pa de dag kyang sngar bstan pa'i shes pa rnams kyis ci rigs par bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @253b shes pa de dag kyang sngar bstan pa'i shes pa rnams kyis ci rigs par bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: These consciousnesses should be understood as included in the previously mentioned consciousnesses, as appropriate.

original: de la mngon par shes pa lnga ni kun rdzob shes pas bsdus te /
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa lnga ni kun rdzob shes pas bsdus te /
translated: Among them, the five superknowledges are included in conventional knowledge.

original: so so'i skye bo'i rgyud la yod pa dang / slob pa'i rgyud la yod pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pas bsdus so //üîΩmi slob pa'i rgyud la yod pa dag ni zag pa med pas bsdus so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i rgyud la yod pa dang / slob pa'i rgyud la yod pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pas bsdus so // mi slob pa'i rgyud la yod pa dag ni zag pa med pas bsdus so //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are included in the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising.

original: mngon par shes pa drug pa ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa gnyis kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug pa ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa gnyis kyis bsdus te /
translated: The sixth superknowledge is included in the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising.

original: zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa de gnyis ni snga ma kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa de gnyis ni snga ma kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are included in the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid kyi shes pa ni shes pa brgyad kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid kyi shes pa ni shes pa brgyad kyis bsdus te /
translated: The cognition of emptiness, which is the gate of liberation, is included in eight cognitions.

original: chos dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gis bsdus so //
translated: The cognition of the doctrine, the subsequent cognition, the cognition of suffering, the cognition of the origin of suffering, the cognition of the cessation of suffering, the cognition of the path, the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'i shes pa ni shes pa drug gis bsdus te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'i shes pa ni shes pa drug gis bsdus te /
translated: The cognition of signlessness, which is the gate of liberation, is included in six cognitions.

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The cognition of the factors, subsequent cognition, cognition of suffering, cognition of origin, cognition of exhaustion, and cognition of non-arising.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa ni shes pa lngas bsdus te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa ni shes pa lngas bsdus te /
translated: The cognition of the signless gate of liberation is included in five cognitions:

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyis so //
translated: the cognition of the factors, subsequent cognition, cognition of cessation, cognition of exhaustion, and cognition of non-arising.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang stobs bcu la sogs pa'i shes pa thams cad ni kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang stobs bcu la sogs pa'i shes pa thams cad ni kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa /
translated: The cognition of the analytical knowledges, the cognition of the absence of conflict, the cognition of aspiration, and the cognition of the ten powers, etc., are all included in conventional cognition.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dang ; de bzhin gshegs pas thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba dag ni zag pa med pa yin par rig par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dang ; de bzhin gshegs pas thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba dag ni zag pa med pa yin par rig par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the cognition of arhatship and that possessed by the TathƒÅgatas in their mental continuum are uncontaminated.

original: de la rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams ni sa'i dngos gzhir mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa las bstan zin to //
analyzed: de la rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams ni sa'i dngos gzhir mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa las bstan zin to //
translated: The doors of liberation have been explained in the chapter on the stages of the grounds.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i sar bstan zin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i sar bstan zin to //
translated: The unshared qualities of the Buddha and the correct and discerning awarenesses have been explained in the chapter on the bodhisattva grounds.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi yul ni gang rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa ni gang rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon sum du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi yul ni gang rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa ni gang rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon sum du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the domain of miracles? What is the knowledge of the domain of miracles? What is the clear knowledge of the domain of miracles?

original: gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /üîΩrgyas par tshangs pa'i @254a * //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas / rgyas par tshangs pa'i @254a * //
translated: It is the transformation of one into many and so on, up toüîΩthe detailed explanation of the mastery of the body up to the Brahma world.

original: 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang sgyur bar byed do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang sgyur bar byed do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the domain of miracles.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa des yul de nyams su myong ba dang / nye bar ston par byed pas na de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa des yul de nyams su myong ba dang / nye bar ston par byed pas na de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the object of supernatural power is so called because it experiences and manifests that object.

original: mthu de dang ldan pa'i shes pa bsgoms pa las byung ba bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa shes bya ste /
analyzed: mthu de dang ldan pa'i shes pa bsgoms pa las byung ba bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa shes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge of the object of supernatural power is the result of the cultivation of the knowledge that possesses that power.

original: shes pa de ni yul de nyams su myong ba dang / nye bar ston par 'gyur ba na de'i phyir de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa de ni yul de nyams su myong ba dang / nye bar ston par 'gyur ba na de'i phyir de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That knowledge is called the knowledge of the object of supernatural power because it experiences and manifests that object.

original: shes pa de nyid kyis sa bon skye ba'i rkyen gyis yongs su zin cing /
analyzed: shes pa de nyid kyis sa bon skye ba'i rkyen gyis yongs su zin cing /
translated: That knowledge itself is the cause of the seed's being fully grasped by the condition of arising.

original: yongs su brtas pa de'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su brtas pa de'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba zhes bya ste /
translated: What follows from that continuum is called the manifestation of the knowledge of the object of supernatural power.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The combination of all of these is called the superknowledge that is the realization of the knowledge of the domain of supernatural power.

original: de la lha'i rna ba ni gang /üîΩlha'i rna ba'i shes pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la lha'i rna ba ni gang / lha'i rna ba'i shes pa ni gang /
translated: What is the divine ear?üîΩWhat is the knowledge of the divine ear?

original: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon du bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the realization of the knowledge of the divine ear?

original: de la bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu rnams bsdus pa'i gzugs dang ba gang yin pa de ni lha'i rna ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu rnams bsdus pa'i gzugs dang ba gang yin pa de ni lha'i rna ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The divine ear is the clarity of form that is included in the result of meditation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang snyoms par mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang snyoms par mi 'jug ste /

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la nyon mongs pa skye ba dang bcas pas sems can gyi don du 'gyur ba yang yod pas de ni de bzhin gshegs pas btang snyoms su bzhag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la nyon mongs pa skye ba dang bcas pas sems can gyi don du 'gyur ba yang yod pas de ni de bzhin gshegs pas btang snyoms su bzhag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is not reasonable for the TathƒÅgatas to remain indifferent to the fact that sentient beings are benefited by the arising of the afflictions in the TathƒÅgatas.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dag bsam gtan bzhi ba'i mtha' yongs su bsgoms pa la brten nas mngon par bsgrub dgos pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dag bsam gtan bzhi ba'i mtha' yongs su bsgoms pa la brten nas mngon par bsgrub dgos pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the absence of conflict and the knowledge through vows must be accomplished on the basis of the thorough cultivation of the end of the fourth meditation,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mkhyen pa ma 'dres pa rnams kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o // mngon par shes pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni bsam gtan thams cad la brten nas kyang /
translated: so too should the unmixed awarenesses of the TathƒÅgata be viewed.üîΩIt should be understood that the remaining superknowledges, etc.,

original: mngon par bsgrub tu rung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub tu rung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: can be accomplished on the basis of all meditations.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni bsam gtan rnams kho na dang / bsam gtan dang po'i nyer bsdogs mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni bsam gtan rnams kho na dang / bsam gtan dang po'i nyer bsdogs mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: One realizes the truths on the basis of the absorptions alone, but one also realizes the truths on the basis of unrestricted anagamya access concentration to the first absorption.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams las ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not realize the truths on the basis of formless realm meditative attainment.

analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i lam ni zhi gnas shas che ba yin la /
translated: The formless realm path is dominated by serenity and

analyzed: lhag mthong chung ba yin pas /
translated: has little insight.

original: lhag mthong chung ba'i lam gyis ni bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag mthong chung ba'i lam gyis ni bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One cannot realize the truths on the basis of a path that has little insight.

original: gzugs kyi khams sam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: One who is born in the form realm or

original: gzugs med pa'i khams gong mar skyes pas kyang dang por bden pa rnams mngon par mi rtogs te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams gong mar skyes pas kyang dang por bden pa rnams mngon par mi rtogs te /

analyzed: 'di ltar gnas de dag ni skyo bar 'gyur dka' ba yin pas /
translated: Because it is difficult for those born in those realms to generate the small level of the faculty of sorrow that is the antidote to the afflictions of the desire realm.

original: re zhig skyo ba chung ngus kyang bden pa rnams mngon par mi rtogs na /
analyzed: re zhig skyo ba chung ngus kyang bden pa rnams mngon par mi rtogs na /
translated: If one cannot realize the truths on the basis of the small level of the faculty of sorrow, what need is there to mention the great and medium levels of the faculty of sorrow?

original: gang na skyo ba chung ngu yang thams cad kyi thams cad du med pas lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gang na skyo ba chung ngu yang thams cad kyi thams cad du med pas lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'i phyir ro /
