original: // / bam po nyi shu rtsa dgu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po nyi shu rtsa dgu pa /
translated: Since there is not even a small amount of disenchantment anywhere, what need is there to mention any other?

original: 'di man chad ni kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang po dang / bar ma dang / tha ma dag tu ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di man chad ni kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang po dang / bar ma dang / tha ma dag tu ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar brjod par bya'o //
translated: From here on, it should be stated how conventional knowledge, the first supramundane uncontaminated knowledge, and the middle and final knowledge are.

original: dang por so so'i skye bor gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba lnga po ji skad bstan pa dag @256b dang ; 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i log pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob shes pa nyon mongs pa can yin te /
analyzed: dang por so so'i skye bor gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba lnga po ji skad bstan pa dag @256b dang ; 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i log pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob shes pa nyon mongs pa can yin te /
translated: First, the five afflicted views of ordinary beings, as they have been explained, and any wrong knowledge concomitant with attachment and so on are afflicted conventional knowledge.

original: spang bar bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: They are to be abandoned and are to be fully understood.

original: de'i gnyen po bsed pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dad pa la sogs pas yongs su zin pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po bsed pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dad pa la sogs pas yongs su zin pa skyed par byed de /
translated: In order to eliminate that, he generates mundane correct view, which is accompanied by faith, etc.

original: de ni kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That is contaminated, virtuous conventional knowledge.

original: de yang dag pa'i lta ba de la brten nas thos pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la brtson par byed de /
analyzed: de yang dag pa'i lta ba de la brten nas thos pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la brtson par byed de /
translated: Then, based on that correct view, he strives in the applications of mindfulness through the wisdom that arises from hearing and reflection.

original: de yang kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That is contaminated, virtuous conventional knowledge.

original: de de la brten nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i sbyor ba bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la brtson par byed de /
analyzed: de de la brten nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i sbyor ba bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la brtson par byed de /
translated: Then, based on that, he strives in the applications of mindfulness that arise from meditation and are associated with the stage of the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de yang kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That is contaminated, virtuous conventional knowledge.

original: de de la brten nas mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la brtson par byed de /
analyzed: de de la brten nas mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la brtson par byed de /
translated: On the basis of that, he cultivates the four foundations of mindfulness that are associated with the heat stage of the path of preparation that leads to the path of seeing.

original: de yang kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That is a conventional form of knowledge that is virtuous and possesses the outflows.

original: de de la brten nas mthong ba'i lam gyi bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog skyed par byed de de yang kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de de la brten nas mthong ba'i lam gyi bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog skyed par byed de de yang kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: On the basis of that, he generates the supreme phenomena of the mundane sphere that are included in the uninterrupted path of the path of seeing. That is also a conventional form of knowledge that is virtuous and possesses the outflows.

original: de ni re zhig dang por so so'i skye bo'i sa la kun rdzob shes pa'i go rims yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni re zhig dang por so so'i skye bo'i sa la kun rdzob shes pa'i go rims yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the order in which the conventional form of knowledge is acquired by an ordinary person on the stage of an ordinary person.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gis bsdus pa'i kun rdzob shes pa de nyid la brten nas mthong ba'i lam la 'jug par byed cing /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gis bsdus pa'i kun rdzob shes pa de nyid la brten nas mthong ba'i lam la 'jug par byed cing /
translated: On the basis of that very conventional form of knowledge that is included in the supreme phenomena of the mundane sphere, he enters the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam la yang dag par zhugs pa de sa bon rnam par dag pas kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa sngar yongs su bsgoms pa de nyid sgom par byed do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la yang dag par zhugs pa de sa bon rnam par dag pas kun rdzob shes pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa sngar yongs su bsgoms pa de nyid sgom par byed do //
translated: When he has entered the path of insight, he cultivates the conventional cognition which is wholesome and impure, which he has previously cultivated, by means of the pure seed.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' la mthong ba'i lam las langs pa de'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos gang dag las sngon rnam par grol bar ma gyur pa de dag las rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' la mthong ba'i lam las langs pa de'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos gang dag las sngon rnam par grol bar ma gyur pa de dag las rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the end of the clear understanding, i.e., at the end of the path of insight, there arises in him who has risen from the path of insight, the possession of the disconnection from those factors to be abandoned by insight which he had not previously obtained.

original: de skyes pas 'phags pa'i gang zag de mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa la yongs su gcod par byed do //
analyzed: de skyes pas 'phags pa'i gang zag de mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa la yongs su gcod par byed do //
translated: By the arising of this possession, the noble one is determined as having abandoned the defilements to be abandoned by insight.

original: bdag @257a * //
analyzed: bdag @257a * //
translated: He knows:

original: gi sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / ngan song gi bar dag ni zad de /
analyzed: gi sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / ngan song gi bar dag ni zad de /
translated: My hells are exhausted, and so on up to: my bad destinies are exhausted.

original: bdag ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin no snyam du yang yang dag par rig par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin no snyam du yang yang dag par rig par byed do //
translated: I am a stream-enterer.

original: bdag gi nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'di lta 'di ltar spangs so snyam du yang yang dag par rig par byed do //
analyzed: bdag gi nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'di lta 'di ltar spangs so snyam du yang yang dag par rig par byed do //
translated: He also knows, ‚ÄúMy defilements have been abandoned in such and such a way.‚Äù

analyzed: 'dod na gzhan dag la yang ji ltar lan gdab par bya ba de ltar 'dogs par byed cing legs par brtags nas lan 'debs par yang byed do //
translated: If he wishes, he can also explain to others how to answer questions, after having examined them well.

original: bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa de yang shes rab kyis rnam par 'jog par byed do //üîΩde 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis de'i gong du gang dang gang las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de dang de las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed cing /
analyzed: bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa de yang shes rab kyis rnam par 'jog par byed do // de 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis de'i gong du gang dang gang las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de dang de las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed cing /
translated: He also establishes the realization of the truths by means of wisdom.üîΩBy means of the mundane path, he strives to become free from attachment to the stage above the first,

analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mngon du byed do //

analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag gis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i rjes las thob pa kun rdzob shes pa'i tshul des 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa gang yin pa de dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar byas pa gang yin pa de ni mtshungs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The non-noble one‚Äôs path that is free from attachment is similar to that.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa bon nyams par ni byed la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa bon nyams par ni byed la /
translated: The seeds of the afflictions are damaged,

original: yang dag par 'joms par ni mi byed pa yang de kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag par 'joms par ni mi byed pa yang de kho na bzhin no //
translated: but they are not completely destroyed.

original: kun rdzob shes pa de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i rjes las thob pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin par brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i rjes las thob pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin par brjod par bya'i /
translated: That conventional knowledge is the supramundane path‚Äôs subsequent knowledge. It is said to be both mundane and supramundane.

analyzed: gcig tu 'jig rten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not solely mundane.

analyzed: de la brtson pa de'i lam ni bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The path of one who is diligent in that has four aspects.

analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam dang / bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / khyad par gyi lam rnams so //
translated: the path of application, the uninterrupted path, the path of liberation, and the distinctive path.

original: de las thams cad du gtogs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag rnam pa dgu po dag las rnam pa gang yang rung ba spong ba dang rjes su mthun pa ni lam dang po yin no //
analyzed: de las thams cad du gtogs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag rnam pa dgu po dag las rnam pa gang yang rung ba spong ba dang rjes su mthun pa ni lam dang po yin no //
translated: The first path is the one that is suitable for the abandonment of any of the nine categories of defilements to be abandoned by cultivation, which are included in the summit of existence.

original: de ma thag tu spong ba ni lam gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag tu spong ba ni lam gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second path is the one that abandons immediately.

original: spangs ma thag pa ni lam gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: spangs ma thag pa ni lam gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third path is the one that is immediately subsequent to the abandonment.

original: de'i 'og tu spangs pa ni lam bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu spangs pa ni lam bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The fourth path is the one that is subsequent to that.

original: khyad par gyi lam de yang rnam pa gnyis @257b te ;
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam de yang rnam pa gnyis @257b te ;
translated: This distinctive path is also twofold:

original: res 'ga' gal te de ma thag tu rnam pa gzhan spang ba'i phyir brtson par byed na ni rnam pa gzhan gyi sbyor ba'i lam gang yin pa de snga ma'i khyad par gyi lam yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' gal te de ma thag tu rnam pa gzhan spang ba'i phyir brtson par byed na ni rnam pa gzhan gyi sbyor ba'i lam gang yin pa de snga ma'i khyad par gyi lam yin no //
translated: If one strives immediately for the abandonment of another category, then the path of application for another category is the distinctive path of the former.

original: lan 'ga' gal te de ma thag tu de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing gong du rtsol bar mi byed dam /
analyzed: lan 'ga' gal te de ma thag tu de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing gong du rtsol bar mi byed dam /
translated: If one sometimes immediately accepts that much and does not strive for more,

original: bag med par gnas sam /üîΩspong ba de nyid la so sor rtogs pa'i shes pas /
analyzed: bag med par gnas sam / spong ba de nyid la so sor rtogs pa'i shes pas /
translated: or if one remains heedless,

original: so sor rtog par byed dam /
analyzed: so sor rtog par byed dam /
translated: or if one analyzes that abandonment with the knowledge of discernment,

original: dpyod pa'i yid la byed pas dpyod par byed na ni khyad par gyi lam kho na yin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i yid la byed pas dpyod par byed na ni khyad par gyi lam kho na yin no //
translated: or if one analyzes it with the mental contemplation of investigation, then it is only the special path.

original: de'i mi lcogs pa med pa ma gtogs pa nyer bsdogs thams cad la ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i mi lcogs pa med pa ma gtogs pa nyer bsdogs thams cad la ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Conventional knowledge alone is cultivated in all access concentrations except for unrestricted access concentration.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not supramundane.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar mi lcogs pa med pa ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa dang po yin la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar mi lcogs pa med pa ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa dang po yin la /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause unrestricted access concentration is the first mental state of equipoise.

original: bsam gtan dang po yan chad kyi bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin de ni ting nge 'dzin sngon du btang ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po yan chad kyi bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin de ni ting nge 'dzin sngon du btang ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The concentration of the first absorption and higher is concentration preceded by concentration.

original: de lta bas na 'phags pa nyan thos ni de yan chad dngos gzhi las byung ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa kho nas brtson par byed kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'phags pa nyan thos ni de yan chad dngos gzhi las byung ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa kho nas brtson par byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, the noble listener strives by means of supramundane knowledge that arises from the actual basis.üîΩ

original: nyer bsdogs las byung bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs las byung bas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the noble disciple strives by means of the supramundane knowledge that arises from the actual basis, and not by means of that which arises from access concentration.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ba'i shes pa yang gcig tu kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ba'i shes pa yang gcig tu kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the summit of existence is included in conventional knowledge alone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnas de la yid la byed pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rnam pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gnas de la yid la byed pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rnam pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Because the attention on that stage is of the form of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid la byed pa dang cha mi mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid la byed pa dang cha mi mthun pa yin la /
translated: it is incompatible with supramundane attention.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid la byed pa ni 'du shes la snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid la byed pa ni 'du shes la snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: And because supramundane attention is included in the meditative attainment of the cessation of perception,

original: de ni slob pa'i sa las brtsams nas kun rdzob shes pa bar gyi mtha' dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni slob pa'i sa las brtsams nas kun rdzob shes pa bar gyi mtha' dang ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: it should be seen that the learner possesses conventional knowledge up to the end of the summit of existence, beginning from the stage of learning.

original: dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la yod pa zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa nas bzung ste /üîΩkun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la yod pa zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa nas bzung ste / kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa /
translated: The conventional knowledge subsumed by the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising that exist in the mindstreams of arhats

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi bar ni dus phyi ma'i mthas shin tu rnam par dag pa zag pa med pa kun du sbyor ba thams cad las rnam par grol ba 'jig rten pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi bar ni dus phyi ma'i mthas shin tu rnam par dag pa zag pa med pa kun du sbyor ba thams cad las rnam par grol ba 'jig rten pa yin no //
translated: is mundane, extremely pure, uncontaminated, and completely liberated from all bonds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung ste /üîΩmthar thug pa'i 'gro ba'i sa'i bar du dang po dang / bar ma dang / @258a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung ste / mthar thug pa'i 'gro ba'i sa'i bar du dang po dang / bar ma dang / @258a * //
translated: From the stage of action out of faith of the bodhisattvasüîΩup to the stage of ultimate arrival,

original: tha ma dag la ni thams cad du yang kun rdzob shes pa kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma dag la ni thams cad du yang kun rdzob shes pa kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that conventional knowledge is present in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: de la dang pos ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
translated: The first is the stage of action out of faith.

original: bar ma ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bar ma ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa nas bzung ste /
translated: The middle is from the stage of pure superior intention

original: spyod pa nges pa'i sa'i bar ro //
analyzed: spyod pa nges pa'i sa'i bar ro //
translated: up to the stage of certain conduct.

original: tha ma ni mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa'o //
translated: The last is the stage of ultimate arrival.

original: sa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa rnam pa gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: sa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa rnam pa gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: On these stages, the knowledge of the bodhisattvas is twofold:

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis spyod pa'i rnam pa dang / spros pa med pa'i 'du shes kyis spyod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis spyod pa'i rnam pa dang / spros pa med pa'i 'du shes kyis spyod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: the aspect of practice with conceptualization and the aspect of practice without conceptualization.

original: de shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs par gyur nas ni de'i rjes la 'jig rten las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i mkhyen pa kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa brnyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs par gyur nas ni de'i rjes la 'jig rten las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i mkhyen pa kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa brnyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they have become Tathagatas through the cultivation of these two aspects, they attain the knowledge that is like the supramundane, the knowledge that is unobscured, and that is included in conventional knowledge.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang smon nas shes pa dang 'dra ba'i shes pa yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang smon nas shes pa dang 'dra ba'i shes pa yod de /
translated: The bodhisattvas also have a knowledge that is like knowledge through prayer.

original: de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon nas shes pa las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon nas shes pa las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: And that is superior to the knowledge through prayer of all the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i shes pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i shes pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The same should be understood for the knowledge of the superknowledges and so on, and for the knowledge of emptiness and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni stobs bcu'i rigs dag la 'jug gi / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni stobs bcu'i rigs dag la 'jug gi / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas enter into the ten powers, but the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not.

original: de ni re zhig kun rdzob shes pa dang po dang / bar ma dang / tha ma dag tu 'byung ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni re zhig kun rdzob shes pa dang po dang / bar ma dang / tha ma dag tu 'byung ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That is the arising of the conventional knowledge, the first, middle, and last.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i dang po dang / bar ma dang / tha ma dag ni mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang ; slob pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i dang po dang / bar ma dang / tha ma dag ni mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang ; slob pa'i lam mo //
translated: The first, middle, and last of the supramundane knowledges are the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of learning.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam gyi chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam gyi chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: Therein, the Dharma knowledge of the path of seeing is the antidote to the objects to be abandoned by seeing in the desire realm.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: The class of subsequent cognition is the antidote to the form and formless realms that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gang la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa mngon du byed pa de thams cad shes pa des gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag la rtogs par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: gang la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa mngon du byed pa de thams cad shes pa des gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag la rtogs par byed dam zhe na /
translated: Does one who manifests subsequent cognition understand all that is to be understood by that cognition in the form and formless realms?

original: smras pa / des gal te sngon gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dag thos pa dang / @258b bsam pa dang / gzung bar 'gyur na ni rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / des gal te sngon gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dag thos pa dang / @258b bsam pa dang / gzung bar 'gyur na ni rtogs par byed do //
translated: He says: If he has previously heard, contemplated and grasped the form and formless realms, he understands them.

original: de lta ma yin na rtogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rtogs par mi byed do //
translated: If not, he does not understand them.

original: shes pa lhag ma rnams ni lhag mthong gi phyogs dang zhi gnas kyi phyogs la chos shes pa dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa lhag ma rnams ni lhag mthong gi phyogs dang zhi gnas kyi phyogs la chos shes pa dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining cognitions should be understood as the class of insight and the class of serenity, and as the class of Dharma cognition and subsequent cognition.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam gyi shes pa dang po skyes na de las gzhan pa'i shes pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rkyen yongs su zin pa dang / rgyu yongs su brtas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam gyi shes pa dang po skyes na de las gzhan pa'i shes pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rkyen yongs su zin pa dang / rgyu yongs su brtas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the first cognition of the path of insight has arisen, the conditions for the arising of the other cognitions are fulfilled, and their causes are developed.

original: skad cig de nyid la mthong ba'i lam thams cad kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la mthong ba'i lam thams cad kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that very moment, all the path of insight is attained.

original: thob nas de'i rim gyis mngon du 'gyur bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: thob nas de'i rim gyis mngon du 'gyur bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Having attained it, it should be seen as being realized in due order.

original: mthong ba'i lam de ni myur du 'gro ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam de ni myur du 'gro ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This path of insight should be known as being of rapid progress.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni gal te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed na ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni gal te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed na ste /
translated: The path of cultivation is when one strives for the sake of detachment through the supramundane path.

original: de'i 'jig rten las 'das pa dag ni sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o//
analyzed: de'i 'jig rten las 'das pa dag ni sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o//
translated: The supramundane path should be understood as the path of preparation, etc., as before.

original: de la sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dag la spros pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis spyod na ni kun rdzob shes pa 'byung la /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dag la spros pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis spyod na ni kun rdzob shes pa 'byung la /
translated: When one practices with conceptualization in regard to the truths of suffering, etc., conventional cognition arises.

original: spros pa med pa'i 'du shes kyis spyod na ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i 'du shes kyis spyod na ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If one practices with the notion of non-elaboration, then supramundane cognition arises.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis ni bden pa ji ltar mthong ba dang ; ji ltar rtogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma legs par zin par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis ni bden pa ji ltar mthong ba dang ; ji ltar rtogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma legs par zin par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If one practices with the notion of elaboration, then one will well grasp the signs of the truths as they have been seen and as they have been understood.

original: shes pa sna tshogs la goms shing mkhas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa sna tshogs la goms shing mkhas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One will also become skilled in the practice of various cognitions.

original: 'jig rten pa'i skyo ba'i rnam pa dag gis sems skyo bar yang 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i skyo ba'i rnam pa dag gis sems skyo bar yang 'gyur zhing /
translated: One will also become weary of the mind through the mundane aspects of weariness.

original: chos kyi longs spyod sna tshogs byas par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod sna tshogs byas par yang 'gyur te /
translated: One will also enjoy the various enjoyments of the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the noble person also strives for freedom from attachment through the mundane path.

original: mi slob pa'i sa la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa de nyid bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi gnas dang gzhir gyur pa dang /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sa la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa de nyid bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi gnas dang gzhir gyur pa dang /
translated: On the stage of no-more-learning, that supramundane cognition is extremely pure because it is liberated from the defilements that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.üîΩIt is the basis and foundation of all mundane qualities.

original: sa 'og ma dang / sa gong ma pa'i yon tan thams cad la dbang sgyur bar byed pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: sa 'og ma dang / sa gong ma pa'i yon tan thams cad la dbang sgyur bar byed pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: It is supramundane cognition because it controls all the qualities of the lower and higher stages.

original: de ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa dang po dang / bar dang / tha ma dag tu @259a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa dang po dang / bar dang / tha ma dag tu @259a * //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the first, middle and last supramundane cognitions

original: 'byung ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: occur in this way.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba yang yod /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba yang yod /
translated: Among them, the cognition of the object of supernatural power is either derived from practice or

original: skyes nas thos pa yang yod do //
analyzed: skyes nas thos pa yang yod do //
translated: is innate.

original: de la sbyor ba las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, that derived from practice is as follows:

original: 'dir skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams dang / slob pa rnams dang / mi slob pa rnams dang ; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'dir skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams dang / slob pa rnams dang / mi slob pa rnams dang ; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: It is the effect of the practice of ordinary worldlings, of those in training, of those beyond training, and of the bodhisattvas.

original: skyes nas thob pa ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa rnams kyi sngon bsgoms pa la brten nas phyis skyes nas thob pa gang yin pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams dang / mi kha cig gis bsod nams kyi stobs kyis thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa rnams kyi sngon bsgoms pa la brten nas phyis skyes nas thob pa gang yin pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams dang / mi kha cig gis bsod nams kyi stobs kyis thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The supernormal knowledge acquired through birth is the supernormal knowledge that beings born in the realm of fine-materiality possess through the mere fact of their birth, by the efficacy of their former cultivation; the supernormal knowledge that certain gods of the realm of desire and certain humans possess through the efficacy of actions.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩdper na rgyal po nga las nu'i lta bu'o //üîΩrdzu 'phrul ni ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i bya rnams dang / yi dags kha cig gi yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na rgyal po nga las nu'i lta bu'o // rdzu 'phrul ni ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i bya rnams dang / yi dags kha cig gi yang yin no //
translated: For example,üîΩthe supernormal knowledge of MƒÅndhƒÅta.üîΩThe supernormal knowledge of the gods of the realm of fine-materiality is included in the class to which these gods belong.

original: nor bu dang / gsang sngags dang / sman ngag gi mthu yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nor bu dang / gsang sngags dang / sman ngag gi mthu yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The supernormal knowledge of certain pretas and birds, etc., is also included in the class to which they belong.üîΩThe supernormal knowledge of certain humans is also included in the class to which they belong.

original: gshed byed dang byad stems dang / ro langs dang ro langs phyed pa la sogs pa la rdzu 'phrul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gshed byed dang byad stems dang / ro langs dang ro langs phyed pa la sogs pa la rdzu 'phrul zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of the supernormal knowledge of the destruction of the impurities is the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities, which is the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities of the three realms.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i tshul de nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i mngon par shes pa bzhi po 'di dag gi mthu yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams ni chos thams cad yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i tshul de nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i mngon par shes pa bzhi po 'di dag gi mthu yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o // de la rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams ni chos thams cad yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The power of the supernormal knowledge of the cognition of the recollection of former abodes and the power of the supernormal knowledge of the cognition of death and rebirth are the knowledge of the cognition of the recollection of former abodes and the knowledge of the cognition of death and rebirth.

original: de dag kyang rnam par shes pas ci rigs par rnam par shes par bya ba dag yin no //üîΩrnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams rnam par shes par bya ba'i phyir /

original: rnam par shes pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /üîΩlnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /üîΩlnga gang zhe na /
translated: The power of the supernormal knowledge of the cognition of the destruction of the impurities is the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.üîΩThe power of the supernormal

original: gnas dang dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / yongs su nyams pa dang yongs su ma nyams pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / sems las byung ba'i chos kyi rab tu dbye ba dang /
analyzed: gnas dang dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / yongs su nyams pa dang yongs su ma nyams pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / sems las byung ba'i chos kyi rab tu dbye ba dang /
translated: The analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of faith, diligence, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, lack of desire for material things, lack of desire for sensual things, and lack of desire for sensual things, and the faculty of complete knowledge, the faculty of final and perfect knowledge, and the faculty of final and perfect knowledge.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / skye ba'i rab tu dbye bas so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / skye ba'i rab tu dbye bas so //
translated: The analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the learner and the faculty of the one beyond learning.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the three realms.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the three vehicles.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the five spiritual faculties.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the five powers.

original: de la gnas dang dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug po dag yin te /
analyzed: de la gnas dang dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug po dag yin te /
translated: The analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the seven factors of awakening.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the eightfold noble path.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pas ni gzugs dag rnam par shes par byed do //üîΩlhag ma rnams kyis kyang rang rang gi yul so sor @259b rnam par shes par byed do //üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pas ni mig dang gzugs rnams nas /
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pas ni gzugs dag rnam par shes par byed do // lhag ma rnams kyis kyang rang rang gi yul so sor @259b rnam par shes par byed do // yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni mig dang gzugs rnams nas /
translated: The analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the four noble truths.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the four concentrations.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the four immeasurables.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the four formless absorptions.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the five eyes.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the six supernormal knowledges.

original: rgyas bar yid dang chos rnams kyi bar yang rnam par shes par byed do //
analyzed: rgyas bar yid dang chos rnams kyi bar yang rnam par shes par byed do //
translated: The analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the four analytical knowledges.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is to be understood as the analysis of the faculties of the faculties of the four means of gathering disciples.üîΩThe analysis of the faculties is

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ste ;
translated: The consciousness that is concomitant with the feeling of pain is called ‚Äúdegenerated.‚Äù

original: des na sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos yid du mi 'ong ba rnams rnam par shes par byed do //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos yid du mi 'ong ba rnams rnam par shes par byed do //
translated: It cognizes unpleasant things that are the basis for pain and mental dissatisfaction.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su ma nyams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su ma nyams pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousness that is concomitant with the feeling of pleasure is called ‚Äúnot degenerated.‚Äù

original: des ni bde ba dang yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos yid du 'ong ba rnams rnam par shes par byed do //üîΩsdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: des ni bde ba dang yid bde ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos yid du 'ong ba rnams rnam par shes par byed do // sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: It cognizes pleasant things that are the basis for pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su nyams pa yang ma yin yongs su ma nyams pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su nyams pa yang ma yin yongs su ma nyams pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousness that is concomitant with the feeling that is neither pain nor pleasure is called ‚Äúneither degenerated nor not degenerated.‚Äù

original: des ni btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu'i chos rnams rnam par shes par byed de /
analyzed: des ni btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu'i chos rnams rnam par shes par byed de /
translated: It is the consciousness of the phenomena that are like the basis of equanimity.

original: de ltar de ni yongs su nyams pa dang / yongs su ma nyams pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //üîΩde la mi dge ba'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: de ltar de ni yongs su nyams pa dang / yongs su ma nyams pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no // de la mi dge ba'i chos rnams sam /
translated: This is the classification of the degeneration and non-degeneration of consciousness.üîΩAmong them, the consciousness that is associated with unwholesome phenomena

original: bsgribs pa'i chos rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i chos rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa zhes bya ste /
translated: or with obscured phenomena is called inferior.

original: des ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul gyi chos rnams rnam par shes par byed do //
analyzed: des ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul gyi chos rnams rnam par shes par byed do //
translated: It is the consciousness of the phenomena that are the domain of defiled consciousness.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni gya nom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni gya nom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousness that is associated with wholesome phenomena is called excellent.

original: des ni dge ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul gyi chos rnams rnam par shes par byed do //
analyzed: des ni dge ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul gyi chos rnams rnam par shes par byed do //
translated: It is the consciousness of the phenomena that are the domain of wholesome consciousness.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa yang ma yin /üîΩgya nom pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa yang ma yin / gya nom pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousness that is associated with neutral dharmas is neither inferior nor excellent.

original: des kyang de'i spyod yul gyi chos rnams rnam par shes par byed de /
analyzed: des kyang de'i spyod yul gyi chos rnams rnam par shes par byed de /
translated: It cognizes the dharmas that are its objects.

original: de ltar de ni rnam par shes pa'i dman pa dang / gya nom pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de ni rnam par shes pa'i dman pa dang / gya nom pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the classification of consciousness as inferior and excellent.

original: sems thams cad dang 'byung ba'i sems las byung ba rnams dang / dge ba'i sems thams cad dang 'byung ba rnams ni sems las byung ba'i chos kyi rab tu dbye ba zhes bya'o //üîΩlhag ma ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems thams cad dang 'byung ba'i sems las byung ba rnams dang / dge ba'i sems thams cad dang 'byung ba rnams ni sems las byung ba'i chos kyi rab tu dbye ba zhes bya'o // lhag ma ni 'di lta ste /
translated: All the mental activities that arise with all the minds and all the wholesome mental activities that arise are called the classification of mental activities.

original: @260a * // zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi skabs su sngar bstan pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: @260a * // zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi skabs su sngar bstan pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as explained in the chapter on dharmas with outflows.

original: de la sems thams cad dang 'byung ba ni lnga ste /
analyzed: de la sems thams cad dang 'byung ba ni lnga ste /
translated: All the mental activities that arise with all the minds are five in number.

original: yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'o //
translated: mental attention, contact, feeling, conceptualization, and volition.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni yid kyi sar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni yid kyi sar bstan zin to //
translated: Their characteristics have already been explained in the chapter on the levels of consciousness.

original: dge ba'i sems thams cad dang / 'byung ba ni bcu ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems thams cad dang / 'byung ba ni bcu ste /
translated: The ten wholesome factors are present in all wholesome minds.

original: 'di lta ste ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang /üîΩbtang snyoms so //üîΩde dag ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems la yang 'byung /
analyzed: 'di lta ste ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / btang snyoms so // de dag ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems la yang 'byung /
translated: They are shame, embarrassment, non-greed, non-hatred, non-delusion, faith, diligence, tranquility, non-violence, and equanimity.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems la yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems la yang 'byung ste /
translated: These are present in both concentrated and unconcentrated minds.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems la ni shin tu sbyangs par lhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sems la ni shin tu sbyangs par lhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: However, in concentrated minds, pliancy should be understood as predominant.

original: de la bag yod pa ni btags pa'i chos yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la bag yod pa ni btags pa'i chos yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Among these, non-violence should be understood as a nominally existent phenomenon.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pas ni chos thams cad rnam par shes par byed de /
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pas ni chos thams cad rnam par shes par byed de /
translated: The consciousness that is associated with them cognizes all dharmas.

original: de ltar de ni sems las byung ba'i chos las gyur pa'i rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de ni sems las byung ba'i chos las gyur pa'i rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the classification of dharmas to be cognized that is based on mental factors.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ni sems bco lnga ste /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ni sems bco lnga ste /
translated: Among them, the fifteen minds that are adverse are:

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba lnga dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba lnga dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: the five that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origination, cessation, and path, and by cultivation, in the realm of desire;

original: gzugs dang ldan pa lnga dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa lnga dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa lnga'o //
translated: five in the realm of form; and five in the formless realm.

original: gnyen por gyur pa ni sems bcu drug pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen por gyur pa ni sems bcu drug pa ste /
translated: The one mind that is a counteragent is the sixteenth mind,

original: zag pa med pa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i'o //
translated: which is the uncontaminated mind, the learner‚Äôs mind, and the nonlearner‚Äôs mind.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen por gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag gis kyang spyod yul ji lta ba'i chos rnams rnam par shes par byed do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen por gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag gis kyang spyod yul ji lta ba'i chos rnams rnam par shes par byed do //
translated: The consciousnesses that are adverse elements and antidotes to those consciousnesses that are favorable elements also cognize the phenomena that are their objects.

original: skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The classification of arising is fivefold in brief:

original: 'dod par skye ba'i rgyu ba dang / gzugs su skye ba'i rgyu ba dang / gzugs med par skye ba'i rgyu ba dang / gang du 'gro ba dang / 'og tu phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod par skye ba'i rgyu ba dang / gzugs su skye ba'i rgyu ba dang / gzugs med par skye ba'i rgyu ba dang / gang du 'gro ba dang / 'og tu phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: the movement that is the cause of arising in the desire realm, the movement that is the cause of arising in the form realm, the movement that is the cause of arising in the formless realm, going to a destination, and returning to a lower level.

original: de la 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sems dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi @260b mjug thogs su 'dod pa dang ldan pa thams cad 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sems dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi @260b mjug thogs su 'dod pa dang ldan pa thams cad 'byung ste /
translated: Immediately after desire-realm virtuous minds and afflicted minds and unobscured neutral minds, all desire-realm minds arise.

original: de ltar de ni 'dod par skye ba'i rgyu ba las rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de ni 'dod par skye ba'i rgyu ba las rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: Thus this is the classification of the arising of consciousnesses from the movement that is the cause of arising in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang ldan pa dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i rang rang gi sa pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum po dag gi mjug thogs su yang rang rang gi sa pa'i sems gsum po thams cad 'byung ngo
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang ldan pa dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i rang rang gi sa pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum po dag gi mjug thogs su yang rang rang gi sa pa'i sems gsum po thams cad 'byung ngo
translated: Just as desire realm beings do, form realm beings and formless realm beings generate all three minds of their own level immediately after any of the three consciousnesses of their own level.üîΩThe generation of previously unarisen meditative attainment and formless realm states is as follows:

original: // sngon bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dag ma skyes pa skyed par byed pa la ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dge ba'i sems 'byung zhing /
analyzed: // sngon bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dag ma skyes pa skyed par byed pa la ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dge ba'i sems 'byung zhing /
translated: Immediately after a desire realm virtuous mind, a virtuous mind of the first absorption arises.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su yang bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dge ba'i sems 'byung la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su yang bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dge ba'i sems 'byung la /
translated: Immediately after a virtuous mind of the first absorption, a virtuous mind of the second absorption arises.

original: de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, immediately after a virtuous mind of the base of nothingness, a virtuous mind of the summit of existence arises.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su mi slob pa'i sems kyang 'byung la /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su mi slob pa'i sems kyang 'byung la /
translated: Also, immediately after a virtuous mind of the form realm, a mind of no more learning arises.

original: slob pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su mi slob pa'i sems kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su mi slob pa'i sems kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: Immediately after a mind of training, a mind of no more learning also arises.

original: gal te des sngon bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dag skyed na ni de dag las yongs su nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te des sngon bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dag skyed na ni de dag las yongs su nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: If one previously generated the absorptions and formless meditative attainments, then one does not retrogress from them.

original: de 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su sa gong ma pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i gzhi sems gang dang gang mngon du byed par 'dod pa de la /
analyzed: de 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su sa gong ma pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i gzhi sems gang dang gang mngon du byed par 'dod pa de la /
translated: If one generates a virtuous mind of the desire realm, then immediately after that, one generates whichever of the higher realm minds of training and no more learning one wishes.

original: rnam pa dang mtshan ma dag legs par gzung ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa de dang de nyid skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa dang mtshan ma dag legs par gzung ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa de dang de nyid skyed par byed do //
translated: One generates that consciousness by properly apprehending its aspects and signs.

original: de bzhin du sa gong ma sa lhag ma rnams kyi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su sa gong ma pa'i sems dag kyang skye bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gong ma sa lhag ma rnams kyi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su sa gong ma pa'i sems dag kyang skye bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, immediately after a virtuous mind of the higher realms, minds of the higher realms arise.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su yang gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su yang gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems 'byung ste /
translated: Also, immediately after a desire realm neutral mind, a form realm virtuous mind arises.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems gzugs na spyod pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i mjug thogs lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems gzugs na spyod pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i mjug thogs lta bu'o //
translated: immediately after a desire realm emanating mind that possesses the form realm result.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems de'i mjug thogs su yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i sems 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems de'i mjug thogs su yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i sems 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Also, immediately after that form realm virtuous mind, a desire realm neutral mind arises.

original: de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /üîΩde'i @261a * //üîΩgzugs brnyan gyi rigs 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste / de'i @261a * // gzugs brnyan gyi rigs 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir yin gyi /
translated: It should be understood that it is a desire realm mind.üîΩIt is a desire realm mind because it is similar to the type of its reflection.

original: ngo bo nyid la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a form realm mind because it is not the same entity.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa 'di nas shi 'phos pa'i mjug thogs su gong du bsam gtan dang por skye ba nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye ba la ni gong ma'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa 'di nas shi 'phos pa'i mjug thogs su gong du bsam gtan dang por skye ba nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye ba la ni gong ma'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems 'byung ste /
translated: When one dies from the wholesome or neutral minds of the desire realm, the afflicted mind of a higher level arises immediately after death, from the first absorption up to the summit of existence.

original: 'di ltar thams cad du yang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad du yang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is always conceived by an afflicted mind.

original: de ltar de ni gang du 'gro ba las rnam par shes pa rang gi sbyong yul nges pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de ni gang du 'gro ba las rnam par shes pa rang gi sbyong yul nges pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, this is the classification of birth for those who go to any of the realms, where the consciousnesses are definitely born in their own objects.

original: so so'i skye bo 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dag las yongs su nyams pa na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dag las yongs su nyams pa na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: When ordinary beings fall from the worldly meditative stabilizations and formless states, they fall by means of an afflicted mind.

original: sa gong ma pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems de'i mjug thogs su sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems de'i mjug thogs su sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems de 'byung ngo //
translated: Immediately after a virtuous or afflicted thought of a higher stage, an afflicted thought of a lower stage can arise.

original: sa gong ma pa dag nas shi 'phos nas sa 'og ma dag tu skye ba la ni sa gong ma pa'i dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems thams cad kyi mjug thogs su sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kho na 'byung ste ;
analyzed: sa gong ma pa dag nas shi 'phos nas sa 'og ma dag tu skye ba la ni sa gong ma pa'i dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems thams cad kyi mjug thogs su sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kho na 'byung ste ;
translated: When one dies in a higher stage and is reborn in a lower stage, immediately after all virtuous, afflicted, and neutral thoughts of the higher stage, an afflicted thought of the lower stage arises.

original: de ltar de ni 'og tu phyir 'ong ba las rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de ni 'og tu phyir 'ong ba las rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this is the classification of the arising of the consciousnesses in the descending order.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba las rnam par shes pas rang gi spyod yul du nges pa'i chos rnam par shes par bya ba rnams rnam par shes par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba las rnam par shes pas rang gi spyod yul du nges pa'i chos rnam par shes par bya ba rnams rnam par shes par byed do //
translated: In this way, consciousness cognizes the objects that are its domain, through the classification of opposing factors, antidotes, and arising.

original: shes pa'i snang ba la phan yon lnga yod de /
analyzed: shes pa'i snang ba la phan yon lnga yod de /
translated: The appearance of consciousness has five benefits:

original: shes bya la las mun pa thams cad sel bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dag gis lus la phan 'dogs shing tshim par byed pa dang / don ma mthong ba ston par byed pa dang /
analyzed: shes bya la las mun pa thams cad sel bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dag gis lus la phan 'dogs shing tshim par byed pa dang / don ma mthong ba ston par byed pa dang /
translated: it eliminates all the darkness of karma and objects to be known, it benefits and satisfies the body with mundane and transcendent qualities, it reveals what has not been seen,

original: tshe 'di la dga' ba mchog sbyin par byed pa dang / lus zhig nas go 'phang mchog sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: tshe 'di la dga' ba mchog sbyin par byed pa dang / lus zhig nas go 'phang mchog sbyin par byed do //
translated: it bestows the highest joy in this life, and it bestows the highest state after the body has disintegrated.

original: shes pa'i snang ba'i yon tan ni rnam pa bco lngas phyi rol gyi snang ba las khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i snang ba'i yon tan ni rnam pa bco lngas phyi rol gyi snang ba las khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
translated: The qualities of the appearance of consciousness should be understood as superior to external appearances in fifteen ways.

original: bco lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bco lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the fifteen?

original: phyi rol ba'i @261b snang ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol ba'i @261b snang ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: External appearances are of the nature of form,üîΩbut the appearance of consciousness is of the nature of wisdom.

original: shes pa'i snang ba ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa dang / phyi rol pa'i snang ba ni phyi rol gyi rab rib 'joms pa yin la /
analyzed: shes pa'i snang ba ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa dang / phyi rol pa'i snang ba ni phyi rol gyi rab rib 'joms pa yin la /
translated: External appearances destroy external cataracts,üîΩbut the appearance of consciousness destroys internal cataracts.

original: shes pa'i snang ba ni nang gi rab rib 'joms pa dang / de bzhin du rtag tu dga' ba ma yin pa dang / rtag tu dga' ba dang ; sems can rnams la yang dag par rab tu mi 'byed pa dang / sems can rnams la yang dag par rab tu 'byed pa dang /
analyzed: shes pa'i snang ba ni nang gi rab rib 'joms pa dang / de bzhin du rtag tu dga' ba ma yin pa dang / rtag tu dga' ba dang ; sems can rnams la yang dag par rab tu mi 'byed pa dang / sems can rnams la yang dag par rab tu 'byed pa dang /
translated: The appearances of consciousness are the inner cataracts, and likewise, they are not always pleasant, they are always pleasant, they do not perfectly discern sentient beings, and they perfectly discern sentient beings.

original: shar nas nub par 'gyur ba dang / shar nas nub par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dang / rags pa dang / cha phra ba dang ; dgra bo mun pa yod pa dang / dgra bo med pa dang /
analyzed: shar nas nub par 'gyur ba dang / shar nas nub par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dang / rags pa dang / cha phra ba dang ; dgra bo mun pa yod pa dang / dgra bo med pa dang /
translated: They are the rising and setting, the not rising and setting, the form and the formless, the coarse and the subtle, the presence and absence of the enemy darkness,üîΩthe moving and the unmoving, the nonaccomplishment of the purpose of all sentient beings, the accomplishment of the purpose of all sentient beings, the guidance to a familiar place, the guidance to an unfamiliar place, and the nonremoval of all obscurations,

original: g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi don mi byed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa dang / 'dris pa'i gnas su khrid pa dang / ma 'dris pa'i gnas su khrid pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad sel bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi don mi byed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa dang / 'dris pa'i gnas su khrid pa dang / ma 'dris pa'i gnas su khrid pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad sel bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: and the removal of all obscurations.

original: sgrib pa thams cad sel bar byed pa dang / chod pa sel bar mi byed pa dang / chod pa sel bar byed pa dang / tshad med pa snang bar mi byed pa dang / tshad med pa snang bar byed pa dang / mthong ba dang mi mthun pa dang /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad sel bar byed pa dang / chod pa sel bar mi byed pa dang / chod pa sel bar byed pa dang / tshad med pa snang bar mi byed pa dang / tshad med pa snang bar byed pa dang / mthong ba dang mi mthun pa dang /
translated: 1) the removal of all obscurations, 2) the non-removal of the obscurations, 3) the removal of the obscurations, 4) the non-illumination of the immeasurable, 5) the illumination of the immeasurable, 6) the non-conformity with the vision,

original: mthong ba dang mthun pas so //
analyzed: mthong ba dang mthun pas so //
translated: and 7) the conformity with the vision.

original: dul ba nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dul ba nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Gentleness is threefold:

original: rtse 'jil ba dang / rnam par gnon pa dang / bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms pa las so //
analyzed: rtse 'jil ba dang / rnam par gnon pa dang / bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms pa las so //
translated: 1) the subduing of the body, 2) the subduing of speech, and 3) the subduing of the mind.

original: zhi ba nyid kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zhi ba nyid kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Tranquility is threefold:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i kun du 'khrug pa med pa dang / mtshan ma'i kun du 'khrug pa med pa dang / rang gi ngang gis nang du mngon par dga' ba las so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i kun du 'khrug pa med pa dang / mtshan ma'i kun du 'khrug pa med pa dang / rang gi ngang gis nang du mngon par dga' ba las so //
translated: 1) the absence of the disturbance of conceptualization, 2) the absence of the disturbance of signs, and 3) the natural delight in the inner.

original: legs par sdom pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: legs par sdom pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Proper restraint is threefold:

original: lus legs par sdom pa dang / ngag legs par sdom pa dang / yid legs par sdom pa las so //
analyzed: lus legs par sdom pa dang / ngag legs par sdom pa dang / yid legs par sdom pa las so //
translated: 1) the proper restraint of the body, 2) the proper restraint of speech, and 3) the proper restraint of the mind.

original: bram ze'i tshul yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i tshul yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The brahmin way is also threefold:

original: zhugs pa bram ze'i tshul dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa bram ze'i tshul dang / mthar thug pa bram ze'i tshul lo//
analyzed: zhugs pa bram ze'i tshul dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa bram ze'i tshul dang / mthar thug pa bram ze'i tshul lo//
translated: the brahmin way of the candidate, the brahmin way of the one who abides in the result, and the brahmin way of the ultimate.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The way of the ascetic is also threefold:

original: zhugs pa dge sbyong gi tshul dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa dge sbyong gi tshul dang / mthar thug pa dge sbyong gi tshul lo //
analyzed: zhugs pa dge sbyong gi tshul dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa dge sbyong gi tshul dang / mthar thug pa dge sbyong gi tshul lo //
translated: the way of the ascetic of the candidate, the way of the ascetic of the one who abides in the result, and the way of the ascetic of the ultimate.

original: bram ze yang rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩming bram ze dang / rigs bram ze dang / sgrub pa bram ze'o //
analyzed: bram ze yang rnam pa gsum ste / ming bram ze dang / rigs bram ze dang / sgrub pa bram ze'o //
translated: A brahmin is also threefold:

original: tshul @262a * //
analyzed: tshul @262a * //
translated: the brahmin by name, the brahmin by caste, and the brahmin by practice.

original: khrims nyams pa ni rgyu bzhis 'gyur te /
analyzed: khrims nyams pa ni rgyu bzhis 'gyur te /
translated: Morality is lost through four causes:

original: nyams pa de yang tshul khrims la brten nas /
analyzed: nyams pa de yang tshul khrims la brten nas /
translated: That loss is also based on morality.

original: dge ba skyed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de mi skyed pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba skyed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de mi skyed pa ste /
translated: It is the non-arising of what would have arisen if morality had not been lost.

original: ltung ba lhag ma ma lus par 'byin pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa mi 'chags pa dang / ltung ba byung ba brjed pa dang / ltung ba med pa la ltung bar mngon par zhen la ltung ba la ltung ba med par mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: ltung ba lhag ma ma lus par 'byin pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa mi 'chags pa dang / ltung ba byung ba brjed pa dang / ltung ba med pa la ltung bar mngon par zhen la ltung ba la ltung ba med par mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: and the rest of the downfalls are not confessed, and those with remainder are not confessed, and the downfalls that have been committed are forgotten, and one is attached to what is not a downfall as a downfall, and one is attached to a downfall as not a downfall.

original: de las bzlog pa'i rgyu bzhis ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i rgyu bzhis ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of these four causes should be understood as the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba ni rgyu gnyis kyis rnam par dag pa dang / phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba ni rgyu gnyis kyis rnam par dag pa dang / phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The undertaking of morality should be understood as pure and perfect through two causes:

original: grogs rnam par dag pa dang / ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: grogs rnam par dag pa dang / ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pas so //
translated: purity of associates and purity of essence.

original: grogs rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: grogs rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is purity of associates?

original: lta ba rnam par dag pa dang / 'tshog rnam par dag pa dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba rnam par dag pa dang / 'tshog rnam par dag pa dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Purity of view, purity of livelihood, and purity of behavior.

original: ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is purity of essence?

original: gus par rjes su slob pa dang / mtha' dag la rjes su slob pa'o //üîΩrnam grangs gzhan yang tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba ni /
analyzed: gus par rjes su slob pa dang / mtha' dag la rjes su slob pa'o // rnam grangs gzhan yang tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba ni /
translated: 1. following with respect, 2. following in its entirety.üîΩThere is another explanation:

original: rgyu gsum gyis rnam par dag pa dang / phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis rnam par dag pa dang / phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The taking up of morality is to be known as pure and perfect through three causes:

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa dang / sgrub pa rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa dang / sgrub pa rnam par dag pas so //
translated: 1. purity of intention, 2. purity of livelihood, and 3. purity of application.

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is purity of intention?

original: thar pa'i phyir tshangs par spyad pa spyod par byed kyi /
analyzed: thar pa'i phyir tshangs par spyad pa spyod par byed kyi /
translated: One practices chastity for the sake of liberation

original: mtho ris kyi phyir yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi phyir yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: and not for the sake of heaven.

original: 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is purity of livelihood?

original: tshul dang mthun par yongs su tshol bar byed de /üîΩji ltar yongs su btsal bar bya ba dang / gang nas yongs su btsal bar bya ba de ltar de nas yongs su btsal te /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun par yongs su tshol bar byed de / ji ltar yongs su btsal bar bya ba dang / gang nas yongs su btsal bar bya ba de ltar de nas yongs su btsal te /
translated: One seeks in a manner that is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: 'tsho bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One lives by what one has sought in the right manner and from the right place.

original: de la ji ltar yongs su btsal bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar yongs su btsal bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should they be sought?

original: tshul 'chos pas yongs su tshol bar mi byed pa dang / kha gsag gis mi byed pa dang / gzhogs slong gis mi byed pa dang / thob kyis 'jal gyis mi byed pa dang / rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pas yongs su tshol bar mi byed pa de ltar yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pas yongs su tshol bar mi byed pa dang / kha gsag gis mi byed pa dang / gzhogs slong gis mi byed pa dang / thob kyis 'jal gyis mi byed pa dang / rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pas yongs su tshol bar mi byed pa de ltar yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: They should be sought without hypocrisy, without flattery, without deception, without presumption, and without desiring gain through gain.

original: gang nas yongs su btsal bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang nas yongs su btsal bar bya zhe na /
translated: From where should they be sought?

original: spyod yul ma yin pa lnga ma gtogs pa nas yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin pa lnga ma gtogs pa nas yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: They should be sought except from the five who are unfit vessels.

original: sgrub pa rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /üîΩltung ba'i 'bras @262b bu mi 'dod pa la mngon par yid ches pas rgyu gang yang rung gnas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa rnam par dag pa gang zhe na / ltung ba'i 'bras @262b bu mi 'dod pa la mngon par yid ches pas rgyu gang yang rung gnas kyang rung ste /
translated: What is pure practice?

original: bsams bzhin du ltung ba mi 'byin pa dang / byung na yang gzhan las phyin chad sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang / chos bzhin du phyir byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du ltung ba mi 'byin pa dang / byung na yang gzhan las phyin chad sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang / chos bzhin du phyir byed pa'o //
translated: It is the non-transgression of the precepts, the confession of transgressions, the non-desire for the results of transgression, the non-transgression of the precepts even at the cost of one‚Äôs life, and the non-transgression of the precepts even for the sake of great gain.

original: dge slong dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdam pa nyid la brtson pas dran pa'i skyon rnam pa bzhi dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdam pa nyid la brtson pas dran pa'i skyon rnam pa bzhi dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: The monk should be diligent in guarding the doors of the senses, and should understand the four faults of mindfulness and the four kinds of improper attention.

original: dran pa'i skyon rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa'i skyon rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four faults of mindfulness?

original: dran pa med pa dang / dran pa mthu chung ba dang / brjed ngas pa dang / dran pa 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa med pa dang / dran pa mthu chung ba dang / brjed ngas pa dang / dran pa 'khrul pa'o //
translated: They are: (1) the absence of mindfulness, (2) weak mindfulness, (3) forgetfulness, and (4) confused mindfulness.

original: de la dran pa med pa ni dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdam pa nyid las brtsams nas chos ma mnyan pa dang / ma bzung ba dang / ma brtags pa'o //üîΩde la dran pa mthu chung ba ni thos pa dang / bzung ba dang / brtags su zin kyang /
analyzed: de la dran pa med pa ni dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdam pa nyid las brtsams nas chos ma mnyan pa dang / ma bzung ba dang / ma brtags pa'o // de la dran pa mthu chung ba ni thos pa dang / bzung ba dang / brtags su zin kyang /
translated: The absence of mindfulness is the failure to listen to, retain, and examine the teachings, beginning with the guarding of the doors of the senses.

original: rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas kun du ma brten cing /
analyzed: rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas kun du ma brten cing /
translated: Weak mindfulness is the failure to apply oneself constantly and respectfully to what one has heard, retained, and examined.

original: goms par ma byas /
analyzed: goms par ma byas /
translated: One does not cultivate it,

original: lan mang du ma byas pa'o //
