analyzed: lan mang du ma byas pa'o //
translated: nor does one practice it frequently.

original: de la brjed ngas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la brjed ngas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Forgetfulness is the failure to remember the teaching.üîΩConfused mindfulness is the failure to understand the teaching as it really is.

original: kun du brten cing goms par byas /üîΩlan mang du byas kyang /
analyzed: kun du brten cing goms par byas / lan mang du byas kyang /
translated: and one cultivates them and repeats them.üîΩBut even though one does this,

original: brgya la brgya lam na shes bzhin med par spyod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brgya la brgya lam na shes bzhin med par spyod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: one may still act without vigilance.

original: de la dran pa 'khrul pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa 'khrul pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among these, the confusion of mindfulness is as follows:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa la kun nas nyon mongs par 'du shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa la kun nas nyon mongs par 'du shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: One perceives what is not defiled as defiled, and one perceives what is defiled as not defiled.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of improper mental attention?

original: nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'dzem pa nyams pa dang / ltung ba dang 'khrul pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'dzem pa nyams pa dang / ltung ba dang 'khrul pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'o //
translated: They are: the sign of the origination of the defilements; the association with the origination of the defilements; the loss of shame; and the instigation of downfalls and errors.

original: de la nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among these, the sign of the origination of the defilements is as follows:

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'i gzhi de las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'i gzhi de las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the fact that, on the basis of the apprehension of signs and the apprehension of secondary elaborations, the mind is defiled by evil, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid dang / kun du spyod pa las ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid dang / kun du spyod pa las ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The defilement that is associated with the arising of the mental afflictions is the fact that those evil, nonvirtuous dharmas are put into action.

original: de la 'dzem pa nyams pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'dzem pa nyams pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The defilement that is the loss of shame is as follows:

original: bzlog par bya bas zlog par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog par bya bas zlog par mi byed pa ste /
translated: One does not turn away from what should be turned away from.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid kun du spyod pas mi bzlogs  pa'o//
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag nyid kun du spyod pas mi bzlogs  pa'o//
translated: One does not turn away from those evil, nonvirtuous dharmas by putting them into practice.

original: @263a * // de la ltung ba dang 'khrul pa kun nas slong bar byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @263a * // de la ltung ba dang 'khrul pa kun nas slong bar byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The defilement that is the cause of the arising of downfalls and errors is as follows:

original: 'dzem pa med pa'i gzhi'i rgyus ltung ba 'byin par byed pa dang bslab pa 'dul bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzem pa med pa'i gzhi'i rgyus ltung ba 'byin par byed pa dang bslab pa 'dul bar sems pa'o //
translated: One commits downfalls and one‚Äôs mind is not set on training because of the cause that is the basis of shamelessness.

original: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid la brtson pa'i zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid ni gnas brgyad spangs pas phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid la brtson pa'i zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid ni gnas brgyad spangs pas phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of moderation in food is the abandonment of eight faults:

original: brgyad gang zhe na /üîΩzas la lhag par chags pa dang / lus la lhag par chags pa dang / srog gi dbang po 'gag pa dang / bkres shing nyam chung ba dang / lus lci ba dang / nad med pa ma yin pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa dang /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na / zas la lhag par chags pa dang / lus la lhag par chags pa dang / srog gi dbang po 'gag pa dang / bkres shing nyam chung ba dang / lus lci ba dang / nad med pa ma yin pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa dang /
translated: What are the eight?

original: bya ba mang po la rnam par g-yeng ba nyid do //
analyzed: bya ba mang po la rnam par g-yeng ba nyid do //
translated: Excessive attachment to food, excessive attachment to the body, cessation of the life faculty, hunger and weakness, heaviness of the body, ill health, impure livelihood, and distraction by many activities.

original: mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa ni mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa yang gnas brgyad spangs pas phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa ni mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa yang gnas brgyad spangs pas phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of striving in practice at the right time is the abandonment of eight faults:

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: spyod lam gyis lus ngal ba nyid dang / gnyid dang glos 'bebs pa dang nyal ba'i bde ba'i ro myang pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa la mi brtson pa dang /
analyzed: spyod lam gyis lus ngal ba nyid dang / gnyid dang glos 'bebs pa dang nyal ba'i bde ba'i ro myang pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa la mi brtson pa dang /
translated: and not striving to cultivate the antidotes to affliction.üîΩThe opposite of laziness is called ‚Äúdiligence.‚ÄùüîΩThe causes of diligence are the opposite of the causes of laziness.üîΩThe results of diligence are the opposite of the results of laziness.üîΩThe benefits of diligence are the opposite of the faults of laziness.üîΩThe classification of diligence is fourfold:üîΩdiligence in guarding the doors of the senses,üîΩdiligence in acting vigilantly,üîΩdiligence in not sleeping at the wrong time,

original: dus ma yin par mi nyal ba dang / don med par mi nyal ba dang / dus ma yin par nyal ba dang / don med par nyal ba'o //üîΩmngon par 'byung ba'i sa ni mngon par 'byung ba rnam pa drug gi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: dus ma yin par mi nyal ba dang / don med par mi nyal ba dang / dus ma yin par nyal ba dang / don med par nyal ba'o // mngon par 'byung ba'i sa ni mngon par 'byung ba rnam pa drug gi dbang du byas nas /
translated: and diligence in not sleeping pointlessly.

original: rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The stage of renunciation is to be understood as being presented from the perspective of the six types of renunciation.

original: mi mthun pa las mngon par 'byung ba dang / med pa las mngon par 'byung ba dang / khyim nas mngon par 'byung ba dang / ma rdzogs pa las mngon par 'byung ba dang / sa 'og ma pa las mngon par 'byung ba dang / 'jig tshogs las mngon par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa las mngon par 'byung ba dang / med pa las mngon par 'byung ba dang / khyim nas mngon par 'byung ba dang / ma rdzogs pa las mngon par 'byung ba dang / sa 'og ma pa las mngon par 'byung ba dang / 'jig tshogs las mngon par 'byung ba'o //
translated: 1. departure from what is not favorable, 2. departure from what is not existent, 3. departure from home, 4. departure from what is incomplete, 5. departure from the lower stages, and 6. departure from the perishable groups of elements.

original: de la lus kyi mi mthun pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi mi mthun pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The unfavorable to the body should be understood as fivefold:

original: 'gro ba dang mi mthun pa dang / skye ba dang mi mthun pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang mi mthun pa dang / sgrib pa med pa dang mi mthun pa dang / 'dod pa dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang mi mthun pa dang / skye ba dang mi mthun pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang mi mthun pa dang / sgrib pa med pa dang mi mthun pa dang / 'dod pa dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: unfavorable to going, unfavorable to birth, unfavorable to the undertaking of striving, unfavorable to the absence of obscurations, and unfavorable to desire.

original: rkyen med pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rkyen med pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The absence of conditions is fourfold:

original: bshes gnyen med pa dang / mnyan pa med pa dang / lung dang / rtogs pa nub pa'i phyir nub pas med pa dang / sbyin bdag dang / mal cha dang stan med pa'o //
analyzed: bshes gnyen med pa dang / mnyan pa med pa dang / lung dang / rtogs pa nub pa'i phyir nub pas med pa dang / sbyin bdag dang / mal cha dang stan med pa'o //
translated: absence of a spiritual teacher, absence of a listener, absence of the scriptures and the realizations, and absence of a patron, bedding, and seat.

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa ni @263b stobs bzhis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa ni @263b stobs bzhis rig par bya ste /
translated: Aspiration for virtuous qualities should be understood through four powers:

original: rkyen gyi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs dang / shes pa'i stobs dang / sgrub pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: rkyen gyi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs dang / shes pa'i stobs dang / sgrub pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: the power of conditions, the power of causes, the power of knowledge, and the power of practice.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba ni phun sum tshogs pa bzhis phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba ni phun sum tshogs pa bzhis phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: Ordination in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya should be understood as perfect through four perfections:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing yongs su nyon mongs pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir rtags phun sum tshogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i bsgrub pa rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir las phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing yongs su nyon mongs pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir rtags phun sum tshogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i bsgrub pa rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir las phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: the perfection of signs, because it is free from afflictions and incompatible with afflictions; the perfection of action, because it accomplishes what is taught by the Buddha; the perfection of intention;

original: 'grogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'grogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: and the perfection of companionship.

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang rgyu lngas phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang rgyu lngas phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The vow of morality should be understood as perfect through five causes:

original: log par mi ltung ba dang / nges par 'byin pa dang / mi khro ba dang / skyon med pa dang / chog mi shes pas so //üîΩgnyen po rnam pa gnyis la brten nas /
analyzed: log par mi ltung ba dang / nges par 'byin pa dang / mi khro ba dang / skyon med pa dang / chog mi shes pas so // gnyen po rnam pa gnyis la brten nas /
translated: It is the absence of false views, the absence of false practices, the absence of false deliverance, the absence of anger, the absence of defects, and the absence of complacency.

original: dbang po sdom pa rnam pa bzhi 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa rnam pa bzhi 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The fourfold restraint of the faculties is to be understood as being based on two kinds of counteragents.

original: gnyen po rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two kinds of counteragents?

original: so sor rtogs pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: so sor rtogs pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs so //
translated: The power of discernment and the power of cultivation.

original: dbang po sdom pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fourfold restraint of the faculties?

original: yul sdom pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa sdom pa dang / kun nas dkris pa sdom pa dang / bag la nyal sdom pa'o //
analyzed: yul sdom pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa sdom pa dang / kun nas dkris pa sdom pa dang / bag la nyal sdom pa'o //
translated: The restraint of the sense faculties, the restraint of afflicted conduct, the restraint of the absorptions, and the restraint of the code of discipline.

original: de la yul sdom pa ni nang du yang dag 'jog la brtson par dran pas yid kun du bsrungs ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la yul sdom pa ni nang du yang dag 'jog la brtson par dran pas yid kun du bsrungs ba nyid yin te /
translated: The restraint of the sense faculties is the guarding of the mind through mindfulness in order to prevent the faculties from flowing out towards the sense-objects.

original: yul rnams la mi 'phro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rnams la mi 'phro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the non-diffusion of the sense faculties towards the sense-objects.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa sdom pa ni rgyu bar gyur pa gnas skabs mnyam par spyod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa sdom pa ni rgyu bar gyur pa gnas skabs mnyam par spyod pa nyid yin te /
translated: The restraint of afflicted conduct is the evenness of behavior in all situations.

original: yul rnam la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yul rnam la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is the complete abandonment of covetousness and mental dissatisfaction with regard to the objects of the senses.

original: ; de nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba ni /
analyzed: ; de nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba ni /
translated: The analysis of this is as follows:

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa nas /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa nas /
translated: not grasping at signs,üîΩup to not allowing sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas to flow in the mindstream,

original: de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par mi 'gyur ba'i bar dang / mtshan mar bzung ba la rjes su rtogs pas /
analyzed: de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par mi 'gyur ba'i bar dang / mtshan mar bzung ba la rjes su rtogs pas /
translated: and by realizing the grasping at signs,

original: de'i tshe mngon rtags su 'dzin pa de dag bsdam pa'i phyir sgrub par byed ces bya ba yin no ;üîΩ/ kun nas dkris pa sdom pa ni bsgom pa'i stobs kyis mig gi dbang po srung bar byed ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon rtags su 'dzin pa de dag bsdam pa'i phyir sgrub par byed ces bya ba yin no ; / kun nas dkris pa sdom pa ni bsgom pa'i stobs kyis mig gi dbang po srung bar byed ces bya ba yin no //
translated: at that time, in order to restrain those graspings at signs, one practices.üîΩRestraining the fetters is protecting the eye faculty through the power of meditation.

original: bag la nyal sdom pa ni mig gi dbang pos sdom pa sgrub par byed ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bag la nyal sdom pa ni mig gi dbang pos sdom pa sgrub par byed ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Restraining the latent propensities is practicing the restraint of the eye faculty.

original: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid kyang rgyu lngas phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid kyang rgyu lngas phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The perfection of moderation in food should be understood as fivefold:

original: gnyen @264a * //
analyzed: gnyen @264a * //
translated: because of being a friend,

original: po la brten pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / rang gi las byed pa dang / gtogs pa dang / de rnam par 'byed pas so //üîΩtshor ba nyid rnams ni bkres pas kun nas bslang ba'am /
analyzed: po la brten pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / rang gi las byed pa dang / gtogs pa dang / de rnam par 'byed pas so // tshor ba nyid rnams ni bkres pas kun nas bslang ba'am /
translated: It is based on the body, it eliminates the resistances, it performs its own function, it is included among the aids to penetration, and it is the cause of the supramundane.

original: zas kyis kun nas bslang ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: zas kyis kun nas bslang ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o //
translated: The feeling is the suffering feeling that arises from hunger or from overeating.

original: 'tsho ba ni tshangs par spyod pa 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni tshangs par spyod pa 'phel ba'o //
translated: The livelihood is the increase of the holy life.

original: stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms par nus pa'o //
analyzed: stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms par nus pa'o //
translated: The power is the ability to overcome the resistances.

original: bde ba ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The happiness is the comfort of this life.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni yon yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni yon yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: The absence of remorse is the purification of gifts.

original: bde ba la reg par gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spong ba mngon du byed pa'o//
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spong ba mngon du byed pa'o//
translated: The comfort is the realization of the abandonment of the afflictions and suffering.

original: mi nyal ba ni rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba dag gis brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid kyis phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi nyal ba ni rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba dag gis brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid kyis phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The wakefulness is the perfection of the practice of effort through constant and respectful application.

original: de la gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa'i dus na de'i rjes su bsgrub pa las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa'i dus na de'i rjes su bsgrub pa las rig par bya ste /
translated: The practice of respect is to be known as the practice of following him in his walking and sitting.

original: 'dug pa'i dus na ni sgrib pa dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / bzhi pa dag la'o //
analyzed: 'dug pa'i dus na ni sgrib pa dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / bzhi pa dag la'o //
translated: In sitting, it is the first, second, and fourth obscurations.

original: 'chag pa'i dus na ni gsum pa la'o //
analyzed: 'chag pa'i dus na ni gsum pa la'o //
translated: In walking, it is the third.

original: gnyis ka'i dus na ni lnga pa la'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i dus na ni lnga pa la'o //
translated: In both, it is the fifth.

original: rtag tu byed pa'i sbyor ba ni nyin mo dang / mtshan mo thun gnyis la mi nyal ba'i phyir dang / gung thun la srog chags seng ge dang / chos mthun bas legs par nyal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyun ring ba dang / lhun stug pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / rgyun chags pa'i gnyid spang ba'i phyir rkang pa'i steng du rkang pa gzhag pa nas /
analyzed: rtag tu byed pa'i sbyor ba ni nyin mo dang / mtshan mo thun gnyis la mi nyal ba'i phyir dang / gung thun la srog chags seng ge dang / chos mthun bas legs par nyal ba'i phyir ro // yun ring ba dang / lhun stug pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / rgyun chags pa'i gnyid spang ba'i phyir rkang pa'i steng du rkang pa gzhag pa nas /
translated: The practice of constant application is because of not sleeping in the first and last periods of the night, and because of sleeping well in the middle period, like a lion who is an animal with a sense of Dharma.

original: ldang ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pa'i bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ldang ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pa'i bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: The practice of application to the object is to be known as the placing of one foot on top of the other, up to the attention to the perception of rising, in order to abandon sleep that is long, heavy, forgetful, and continuous.üîΩThe practice of application to the antidote is to be known as the attention to the perception of light, in order to abandon sleep that is not clear.

original: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid ni gnas lnga la tshod ran pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid ni gnas lnga la tshod ran pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The practice of conscientiousness is in terms of moderation with regard to five things.

original: phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The practice of mindfulness is to be understood as perfect in five ways, in terms of the five objects.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five objects?

original: 'gro ba dang / blta ba dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti bdag gir bya ba dang / yo byad la longs spyod pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / blta ba dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti bdag gir bya ba dang / yo byad la longs spyod pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'o //
translated: They are the object of going, the object of seeing, the object of accepting gifts and honors, the object of using personal belongings, and the object of applying oneself to virtue.

original: dang pos ni spyod yul ma yin par ye mi 'gro ba dang ; spyod yul du yang shin tu nam sros nas ldog par mi byed do //
analyzed: dang pos ni spyod yul ma yin par ye mi 'gro ba dang ; spyod yul du yang shin tu nam sros nas ldog par mi byed do //
translated: By the first, one does not go to places that are not suitable for wandering, and even in suitable places, one does not wander about at the wrong time of day and does not return at the right time.

original: gnyis pas ni blo sngon du ma btang ba'i lta ba la ni dbang po phyir rlon par byed la /üîΩblo sngon du btang ba'i lta ba la ni /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni blo sngon du ma btang ba'i lta ba la ni dbang po phyir rlon par byed la / blo sngon du btang ba'i lta ba la ni /
translated: By the second, one does not let the eyes wander without purpose.

original: dran pa nye bar 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar 'jog par byed de /
translated: When the eyes do have a purpose, one places mindfulness in the eyes.

original: gsum pas ni bslang ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dag la @264b lag pa dang / rkang pa ha cang brkyang pa dang / ha cang bskum par mi byed do //
analyzed: gsum pas ni bslang ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dag la @264b lag pa dang / rkang pa ha cang brkyang pa dang / ha cang bskum par mi byed do //
translated: By the third, one does not stretch out the arms or legs too far when rising up or sitting down.

original: bzhi pas ni chos gos dang / ltung bzed dang / bsod snyoms kyi longs spyod la tshong rig par byed do //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni chos gos dang / ltung bzed dang / bsod snyoms kyi longs spyod la tshong rig par byed do //
translated: The fourth is to be skilled in the enjoyment of Dharma robes, alms, and the enjoyment of alms.

original: lnga pas ni nang du yang dag 'jog la brtson pas nyin mo 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis 'gro pa dang ; 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / mi nyal ba dang / mtshan mo nyal ba la tshod shes par byed pa dang /üîΩ'brel pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa la brtson pas smra ba dang / mi smra ba la tshod shes par byed pa dang / de gnyi ga la lus las su rung bar bya ba'i phyir gnyid kyi snyom pa bsang ba la tshod shes par byed do /
analyzed: lnga pas ni nang du yang dag 'jog la brtson pas nyin mo 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis 'gro pa dang ; 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / mi nyal ba dang / mtshan mo nyal ba la tshod shes par byed pa dang / 'brel pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa la brtson pas smra ba dang / mi smra ba la tshod shes par byed pa dang / de gnyi ga la lus las su rung bar bya ba'i phyir gnyid kyi snyom pa bsang ba la tshod shes par byed do /
translated: The fifth is to be skilled in the day, in walking and sitting through the effort of correct meditative equipoise, in the night, in sleeping and in the night, in being skilled in the measure of sleep.

original: // / bam po sum cu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po sum cu pa /
translated: The sixth is to be skilled in speech and silence through the effort of determining related speech and in both of those, in being skilled in the measure of dispelling the drowsiness of lethargy in order to make the body serviceable.

original: dge slong rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa la brtson pa'i spong ba'i 'du byed ni yan lag bzhis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom pa la brtson pa'i spong ba'i 'du byed ni yan lag bzhis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The monk who is diligent in cultivating the bases of supernatural powers is included in four branches.

original: bsgom pa'i yan lag dang / khyad par rtogs pa'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rjes su bsrung ba rdzogs pa'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdud pa'i yan lag gis so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i yan lag dang / khyad par rtogs pa'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rjes su bsrung ba rdzogs pa'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdud pa'i yan lag gis so //
translated: The limbs of cultivation, the limbs of special knowledge, the limbs of guarding against the secondary defilements, and the limbs of the complete clearing of the secondary defilements.

original: de la bsgom pa'i yan lag ni 'dun pa dang rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa'i yan lag ni 'dun pa dang rtsol ba ste /
translated: The limbs of cultivation are will and effort.

original: 'di ltar 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba gnyis la brten nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba gnyis la brten nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed do //
translated: Thus, the bases of psychic power are cultivated on the basis of will and effort.

original: khyad par rtogs pa'i yan lag ni dad pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa'i yan lag ni dad pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
translated: The limbs of special knowledge are faith and tranquility.

original: 'di ltar dad pas ni khyad par rtogs nas gong ma'i rnam par thar pa la mngon par dad par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dad pas ni khyad par rtogs nas gong ma'i rnam par thar pa la mngon par dad par byed la /
translated: Thus, having attained special knowledge, one has faith in the higher liberation.

original: shin tu sbyangs pas ni lus dang sems kyi gnas ngan len shin tu sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pas ni lus dang sems kyi gnas ngan len shin tu sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Tranquility is the clearing of the bad conditioning of body and mind.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rjes su bsrung ba rtogs pa'i yan lag ni dran pa dang shes bzhin te /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rjes su bsrung ba rtogs pa'i yan lag ni dran pa dang shes bzhin te /
translated: The limbs of guarding against the secondary defilements are mindfulness and awareness.

original: 'di ltar dran pas ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ma byung ba srung bar byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dran pas ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ma byung ba srung bar byed la /
translated: Thus, mindfulness guards against the arising of the secondary mental afflictions of serenity and insight.

original: shes bzhin gyis ni byung ba rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyis ni byung ba rtogs par byed do //
translated: And introspection recognizes when they have arisen.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdud pa'i yan lag ni sems pa dang btang snyoms te /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdud pa'i yan lag ni sems pa dang btang snyoms te /
translated: The branches of collection are intention and equanimity, because they purify the secondary mental afflictions.

original: 'di ltar sems pas ni sems zhum pa phyir 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems pas ni sems zhum pa phyir 'dzin par byed la /
translated: Thus, intention prevents the mind from becoming depressed.

original: btang snyoms kyis ni rgod pa nang du sdud par byed do //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyis ni rgod pa nang du sdud par byed do //
translated: And equanimity prevents the mind from becoming excited.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa la dbang byed pa'i chos ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa la dbang byed pa'i chos ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four qualities that control the attainment of concentration:

original: rna ba gtod pa dang / legs par 'doms pa dang / sngon goms pa @265a * //
analyzed: rna ba gtod pa dang / legs par 'doms pa dang / sngon goms pa @265a * //
translated: attentiveness, proper instruction, prior habituation,

original: dang ; mang du thos pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; mang du thos pa'o //
translated: and extensive learning.

original: de la rna ba gtod pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rna ba gtod pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Attentiveness is as follows:

original: 'dun pa skyes shing dad pa skyes nas dam pa'i chos nyan par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa skyes shing dad pa skyes nas dam pa'i chos nyan par byed pa ste /
translated: When one has generated aspiration and faith, one listens to the true Dharma.

original: des rgyu de dang rkyen des sems rtse gcig pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rgyu de dang rkyen des sems rtse gcig pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through that cause and that condition, one attains one-pointedness of mind.

original: de la legs par 'doms pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la legs par 'doms pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The right instruction is as follows:

original: go rims bzhin du 'doms pa dang / phyin ci ma log par 'doms pa la brten nas /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'doms pa dang / phyin ci ma log par 'doms pa la brten nas /
translated: Based on the right instruction and the unerring instruction,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams te gnas shing brtson pas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams te gnas shing brtson pas /
translated: one should apply oneself to the practice of diligence and abide in it.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la rgyun du chud pa dang / rtag 'grus kyis sgom par sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la rgyun du chud pa dang / rtag 'grus kyis sgom par sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson par gnas pa ste /
translated: Through diligence, one should constantly practice the factors of perfect awakening and apply oneself to the practice of constant diligence.

original: des rgyu de dang rkyen des kyang sems rtse gcig pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rgyu de dang rkyen des kyang sems rtse gcig pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that cause and that condition, one will attain one-pointedness of mind.

original: de la sngon goms pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sngon goms pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the previous habituation:

original: bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag la dus nye ba dang / khad nye bar snyoms par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag la dus nye ba dang / khad nye bar snyoms par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: One has entered into meditative concentration and meditative absorption in a timely and proximate manner.

original: des rgyu de dang rkyen des kyang sems rtse gcig pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rgyu de dang rkyen des kyang sems rtse gcig pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that cause and that condition, one will attain one-pointedness of mind.

original: de la mang du thos pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mang du thos pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the extensive learning:

original: thos pa mang ba dang / thos pa 'dzin pa dang / thos pa bsags pa yin zhing /
analyzed: thos pa mang ba dang / thos pa 'dzin pa dang / thos pa bsags pa yin zhing /
translated: He has much learning, he retains what he has learned, and he has accumulated what he has learned.

original: de gcig pu dben par song nas chos de dag la sems par byed /
analyzed: de gcig pu dben par song nas chos de dag la sems par byed /
translated: When he goes to a solitary place and reflects on those teachings,

original: 'jal bar byed nye bar rtogs par byed pa de des rgyu de dang rkyen des kyang sems rtse gcig pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jal bar byed nye bar rtogs par byed pa de des rgyu de dang rkyen des kyang sems rtse gcig pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will attain one-pointedness of mind through that cause and that condition.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba la brtson pas chos bdun rig par bya ste /üîΩnang gi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'i rgyu dang / phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'i rgyu dang / nang gi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa dang / phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa dang / nang gi ting nge 'dzin rgyu dang bcas pa nyams pa'i gnyen po dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba la brtson pas chos bdun rig par bya ste / nang gi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'i rgyu dang / phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'i rgyu dang / nang gi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa dang / phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa dang / nang gi ting nge 'dzin rgyu dang bcas pa nyams pa'i gnyen po dang /
translated: One who is diligent in attaining concentration should know seven things:üîΩthe cause of the degeneration of inner concentration, the cause of the degeneration of outer concentration, the degeneration of inner concentration, the degeneration of outer concentration, the remedy for the degeneration of inner concentration together with its cause,

original: phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin rgyu dang bcas pa nyams pa'i gnyen po dang / de gnyi ga'i gnyen po'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin rgyu dang bcas pa nyams pa'i gnyen po dang / de gnyi ga'i gnyen po'i gzhi'o //
translated: the remedy for the degeneration of outer concentration together with its cause, and the basis of the remedy for both of those.

original: de la nang gi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'i rgyu ni le lo'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'i rgyu ni le lo'o //
translated: The cause of the degeneration of internal meditative concentration is laziness.

original: de la phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'i rgyu ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'i rgyu ni rgod pa'o //
translated: The cause of the degeneration of external meditative concentration is agitation.

original: de la nang gi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid do //
analyzed: de la nang gi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid do //
translated: The degeneration of internal meditative concentration is due to lethargy and sleep.

original: de la phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la rjes su rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la rjes su rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: The degeneration of external meditative concentration is due to the distraction of the five external sense pleasures.

original: de la nang gi ting nge 'dzin rgyu dang bcas pa nyams pa'i gnyen po ni so sor rtog pa'i mtshan ma legs par gzung ba @265b nyid do ;
analyzed: de la nang gi ting nge 'dzin rgyu dang bcas pa nyams pa'i gnyen po ni so sor rtog pa'i mtshan ma legs par gzung ba @265b nyid do ;
translated: The antidote to the degeneration of internal meditative concentration together with its cause is the apprehension of the sign of discernment.

original: / de la phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin rgyu dang bcas pa nyams pa'i gnyen po ni lus 'di nyid la mi sdug par so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: / de la phyi rol gyi ting nge 'dzin rgyu dang bcas pa nyams pa'i gnyen po ni lus 'di nyid la mi sdug par so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the degeneration of external meditative concentration together with its cause is the discernment of the impurity of this very body.

original: de la gnyi ga'i gnyen po gzhi ni snang ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: de la gnyi ga'i gnyen po gzhi ni snang ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: The basis of the antidote to both is the perception of light.

original: ji ltar na lus la kun 'byung ba'i chos can du rjes su lta zhing nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus la kun 'byung ba'i chos can du rjes su lta zhing nas she na /
translated: How does one observe the body as a thing that arises?

original: da ltar gyi lus ni 'das pa'i dus nas zas las kun du 'byung ba nyid du yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi lus ni 'das pa'i dus nas zas las kun du 'byung ba nyid du yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
translated: He sees that the present body is produced from food in the past.

original: ji ltar lus la 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus la 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
translated: How does he see the body as subject to destruction?

original: da ltar gyi lus ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'chi ba'i chos nyid yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi lus ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'chi ba'i chos nyid yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
translated: He sees that the present body is subject to death in the future.

original: ji ltar lus la kun 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su zhing nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus la kun 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su zhing nas she na /
translated: How does he see the body as subject to arising and destruction?

original: lus zas kyi rkyen las byung ba ni da ltar gyi dus su gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dang / nyams pa dang / yang 'byung ba nyid du yang dag par blta ba'o //
analyzed: lus zas kyi rkyen las byung ba ni da ltar gyi dus su gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dang / nyams pa dang / yang 'byung ba nyid du yang dag par blta ba'o //
translated: He sees that the present body, which is conditioned by food, abides, is destroyed, perishes, and arises again.

original: lus yod par de'i dran pa shin tu nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus yod par de'i dran pa shin tu nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He is mindful of the body as it really is.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi lus la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi lus la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: He is mindful of the transcendent body as it really is.

original: shes pa tsam zhes bya ba ni so sor nang gi zhi gnas kyi lam gyis so //
analyzed: shes pa tsam zhes bya ba ni so sor nang gi zhi gnas kyi lam gyis so //
translated: He is mindful of the body as mere consciousness.üîΩHe is mindful of the body as a mental object.

original: mthong ba tsam zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi lam gyis so //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi lam gyis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmerely seeing‚Äù refers to the path of insight.

original: yang dran pa tsam zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa dang ; 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: yang dran pa tsam zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa dang ; 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmerely remembering‚Äù refers to the mundane and supramundane paths that are attained subsequent to that.

original: ji ltar lus la mi brten par gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus la mi brten par gnas she na /
translated: How does one abide without relying on the body?

original: snyoms par 'jug pa gang la brten nas /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa gang la brten nas /
translated: One abides in meditative concentration.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag sgom par byed pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de la ro myong bar mi byed pa nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag sgom par byed pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de la ro myong bar mi byed pa nas /
translated: One cultivates the applications of mindfulness in meditative concentration without relishing them,

original: lhag par chags shing mi gnas pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: lhag par chags shing mi gnas pa'i bar ro //
translated: up to without abiding in excessive attachment.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten la ci yang mi 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten la ci yang mi 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one not grasp anything in the world?

original: phyin ci log bzhi spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi spangs pa yin te /
translated: One abandons the four errors.

original: de dag spangs pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa gtsang ba'am /üîΩbde ba'am bdag gam /
analyzed: de dag spangs pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa gtsang ba'am / bde ba'am bdag gam /
translated: Because they are abandoned, one does not grasp the body, etc. as pure,üîΩas happiness,

original: rtag par mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: as self, or as permanent.

original: mchog tu gdags pa las brtsams nas gang zag lnga rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mchog tu gdags pa las brtsams nas gang zag lnga rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The five types of persons should be understood as being posited in terms of the designation of the highest.

original: gang zag lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five types of persons?

original: so so'i skye bo dga' ba dang bde ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / gzhi mthong ba la zhugs pa sgrib pa spangs pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / lta ba'i rnam pa la zhugs pa thar pa la mngon par dga' ba dang /üîΩlta ba'i @266a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dga' ba dang bde ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / gzhi mthong ba la zhugs pa sgrib pa spangs pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / lta ba'i rnam pa la zhugs pa thar pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / lta ba'i @266a * //
translated: The joy of ordinary people is the joy of pleasure and happiness. The joy of those who have entered the path of seeing is the joy of abandoning the obscurations. The joy of those who have entered the aspects of the view is the joy of liberation.

original: rnam pa la zhugs pa mthar thug par 'gyur ba dang / gzhi mthong ba la zhugs pa mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa la zhugs pa mthar thug par 'gyur ba dang / gzhi mthong ba la zhugs pa mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The joy of those who have entered the aspects of the view is the joy of finality. The joy of those who have entered the path of seeing is the joy of finality.

original: de la gang zag so so'i skye bo dga' ba dang / bde ba la mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang zag so so'i skye bo dga' ba dang / bde ba la mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the joy of ordinary people who delight in pleasure and happiness?

original: de ni gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as threefold:

original: 'dod pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang /
translated: 1. the joy and bliss born of desire, 2. the joy and bliss born of concentration associated with initial and sustained thought, and 3. the joy and bliss born of concentration free of initial and sustained thought.üîΩThe joy and bliss of the first absorption are born of desire because they are born of the desire for the separation of body and mind from the hindrances.üîΩThe joy and bliss of the second absorption are born of concentration associated with initial and sustained thought because they are born of the concentration associated with initial and sustained thought.üîΩThe joy and bliss of the third absorption are born of concentration free of initial and sustained thought because they are born of the concentration free of initial and sustained thought.

original: bde ba la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: The joy and bliss of the fourth absorption are born of equanimity because they are born of the equanimity of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: gang zag gzhi mthong ba la zhugs pa sgrib pa spang ba la mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag gzhi mthong ba la zhugs pa sgrib pa spang ba la mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the person who is engaged in seeing the truths and who delights in abandoning the defilements?

original: de ni gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: He is of two kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spang ba la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spang ba la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: 1. he who delights in abandoning the defilements which are the objects to be abandoned by means of vision, and 2. he who delights in abandoning the defilements which are the objects to be abandoned by means of mental cultivation.

original: de la gang zag nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba la mngon par dga' ba ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa rnams ma thob pa dang / thob pa dang / 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa thams cad ma thob pa dang /
analyzed: de la gang zag nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba la mngon par dga' ba ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa rnams ma thob pa dang / thob pa dang / 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa thams cad ma thob pa dang /
translated: The person who delights in eliminating the afflictive obstructions is one who has not attained the states of abiding in comfort in this life,

original: thob pa ste /
analyzed: thob pa ste /
translated: and one who has attained the meditative attainment of conception in all its aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows:

original: gnas pa las brtsams pa dang / shes bya yongs su brtags pa las brtsams nas so //üîΩde la gang zag snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spang ba la mngon par dga' ba ni /
analyzed: gnas pa las brtsams pa dang / shes bya yongs su brtags pa las brtsams nas so // de la gang zag snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spang ba la mngon par dga' ba ni /
translated: beginning with abiding and beginning with the thorough investigation of objects of knowledge.üîΩThe person who delights in eliminating the obstructions to meditative attainment is one who has not attained all the bases of subjugation,

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched thams cad thob pa dang ma thob pa dang / zad par gyi skye mched thams cad ma thob pa dang / thob pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched thams cad thob pa dang ma thob pa dang / zad par gyi skye mched thams cad ma thob pa dang / thob pa'o //
translated: and one who has attained all the bases of totality.

original: de la gang zag lta ba'i rnam pa la zhugs pa thar pa la mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang zag lta ba'i rnam pa la zhugs pa thar pa la mngon par dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the person who has entered the aspects of views and delights in liberation?

original: 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can bdag med do //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can bdag med do //
translated: It is the tƒ´rthikas who are outside this teaching.

original: bdag gi med do //
analyzed: bdag gi med do //
translated: They say, ‚ÄúThere is no self.üîΩThere is no sentient being.

original: bdag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro / bdag gi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa ste /
analyzed: bdag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro / bdag gi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa ste /
translated: I will not come to be. Mine will not come to be.

original: de yang ma thob pa dang thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma thob pa dang thob pa yin no //
translated: This is the non-acquisition of the acquisition.

original: de la gang zag lta ba'i rnam pa la zhugs pa mthar thug par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang zag lta ba'i rnam pa la zhugs pa mthar thug par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the person who has entered into the view of the aspects of the truths, but has not yet completed the requisite conditions?

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ma thob pa dang thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ma thob pa dang thob pa'o //
translated: It is the person who has not acquired the perception-sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, but has acquired the perception-sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: de la gang zag gzhi mthong ba la zhugs pa mthar thug par gyur pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang zag gzhi mthong ba la zhugs pa mthar thug par gyur pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the person who has entered into the view of the basis, but has not yet completed the requisite conditions?

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug po dag ma @266b lus par spangs pa myong bar byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug po dag ma @266b lus par spangs pa myong bar byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the person who has not completely abandoned the six sense-sources of contact, but who has acquired the perception-sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: mchog tu gdags pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: mchog tu gdags pa las brtsams nas /
translated: Starting from the designation of the highest,

original: gang zag lnga po de dag rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag lnga po de dag rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: these five persons are established.

original: dge bsnyen gyi yon tan ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi yon tan ni gsum ste /
translated: The qualities of the lay disciple are threefold:

original: dag pa dang / byed pa dang / bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: dag pa dang / byed pa dang / bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: purity, action and realization.

original: de la dag pa ni bsam pa dag pa dang / tshul dag pa dang / rtogs pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la dag pa ni bsam pa dag pa dang / tshul dag pa dang / rtogs pa dag pa'o //
translated: Purity is threefold: purity of thought, purity of conduct and purity of view.

original: de la bsam pa dag pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa la the tshom med pa dang / ngo mtshar dang bkra shis dang ldan pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam pa dag pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa la the tshom med pa dang / ngo mtshar dang bkra shis dang ldan pa yin pa'o //
translated: Among these, purity of thought is the absence of doubt about the Buddha, etc., and the possession of wonder and auspiciousness.

original: de la tshul dag pa ni bslab pa dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la tshul dag pa ni bslab pa dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Among these, purity of conduct is the completion of the trainings.

original: de la rtogs pa dag pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtogs pa dag pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among these, purity of realization is the realization of mundane and supramundane purity.

original: de la byed pa ni dkon mchog gsum gyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byed pa ni dkon mchog gsum gyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among these, purity of action is the performance of the actions of the Three Jewels.

original: de la bsgrub pa ni chos mthun pa ba dang / chos mthun pa ba ma yin pa rnams la shes pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bsgrub pa ni chos mthun pa ba dang / chos mthun pa ba ma yin pa rnams la shes pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among these, purity of accomplishment is the accomplishment of knowledge for those who are suitable and unsuitable recipients of the teaching.

original: de la chos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la chos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Among these, the teaching is threefold:

original: mnyan pa'i chos dang / bsgrub pa'i chos dang mthar thug pa'i chos so //
analyzed: mnyan pa'i chos dang / bsgrub pa'i chos dang mthar thug pa'i chos so //
translated: the teaching to be heard, the teaching to be accomplished, and the ultimate teaching.

original: phyi rol pa rnams kyi bstan pa ni phyin ci log pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa rnams kyi bstan pa ni phyin ci log pa yin te /
translated: The teaching of the non-Buddhists is erroneous,

original: smon nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: smon nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: because they abide in the pure conduct that is vowed.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par mthong ba ma yin pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i rims nad dang bcas pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir gtan du nye bar gtod pa ma yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i mu stegs can dang thun mong ba dang so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par mthong ba ma yin pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i rims nad dang bcas pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir gtan du nye bar gtod pa ma yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i mu stegs can dang thun mong ba dang so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ba yin no //
translated: It is not a refuge for the wise, because it is common to nonBuddhists and to ordinary worldlings.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'di ni de las bzlog pa yin pas yang dag par mthong ba nas /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'di ni de las bzlog pa yin pas yang dag par mthong ba nas /
translated: The well proclaimed Dharma is the opposite of that.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyi so sor rang gis rig pa'i bar dag yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyi so sor rang gis rig pa'i bar dag yin no //
translated: It is seen correctly, up to it is the domain of the wise, up to it is the domain of the noble, up to it is the domain of the saints, up to it is the domain of the pratyekabuddhas, up to it is the domain of the bodhisattvas, up to it is the domain of the tathagatas.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyis 'thob pa dang / gtong ba'i go rims ni sngar byas pa'i gtam gyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyis 'thob pa dang / gtong ba'i go rims ni sngar byas pa'i gtam gyis te /
translated: The order of acquisition and abandonment of the desires is in accordance with the previous discussion.

original: gang gis 'thob ce na /
analyzed: gang gis 'thob ce na /
translated: By what is one acquired?

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyis so //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyis so //
translated: By giving and morality.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: mtho ris su'o //
analyzed: mtho ris su'o //
translated: In the heavens.

original: gang gis longs spyod ce na /
analyzed: gang gis longs spyod ce na /
translated: By what is one enjoyed?

original: ro myang bas so //
analyzed: ro myang bas so //
translated: By relishing.

original: gang gis gtong zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis gtong zhe na /
translated: By what is one abandoned?

original: nyes dmigs kyis so //
analyzed: nyes dmigs kyis so //
translated: By the recognition of the faults.

original: ji ltar dngos po'i 'dod pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa gtong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po'i 'dod pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa gtong zhe na /
translated: How does one give up the desire for things and the desire for defilements?

original: mngon par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i phan yon dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyis de yongs su bstan to //üîΩdge sbyong gi tshul @267a * //
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i phan yon dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyis de yongs su bstan to // dge sbyong gi tshul @267a * //
translated: This is taught by the benefits of going forth and of solitude, and by the qualities that are favorable to purification.

original: gyi 'bras bu bzhi po dag ni yang dag phul yin te /
analyzed: gyi 'bras bu bzhi po dag ni yang dag phul yin te /
translated: The four fruits of the religious life are the best,

original: de dag las ltung ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las ltung ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no falling away from them and because they are supramundane.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis tshogs pa'i rgyu gsum gyis tshul khrims 'chal pa bskrad par bya ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis tshogs pa'i rgyu gsum gyis tshul khrims 'chal pa bskrad par bya ste /
translated: The community of practitioners should expel a person of faulty morality for three reasons:

original: gzhan rjes su bsrung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / bla ma'i snod ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dge 'dun mi brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rjes su bsrung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / bla ma'i snod ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dge 'dun mi brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of protecting others, because of being an unworthy recipient, and because of not mentioning the community.

original: rgyu bzhis tshul khrims la mngon par dga' ba skye ste /
analyzed: rgyu bzhis tshul khrims la mngon par dga' ba skye ste /
translated: One should take delight in morality for four reasons:

original: ston pa las ni mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs pa'i bslab pa bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa las ni mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs pa'i bslab pa bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Teacher is the best, because he has established the training that completely avoids the two extremes.

original: bdag nyid las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa shas mi che ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa shas mi che ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One‚Äôs own nature is the best, because one is not overwhelmed by passion and so on.

original: grogs las ni de dag des pa dang 'grogs na bde ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grogs las ni de dag des pa dang 'grogs na bde ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A companion is the best, because one is happy when one associates with the virtuous.

original: mngon par brtson pa las ni le lo med par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa las ni le lo med par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Exertion is the best, because one is not lazy.

original: tshul khrims brtag pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims brtag pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The examination of morality is fourfold:

original: 'grogs pas yod pa nyid du yid ches pa dang / phongs pa na yang bstan pas yid ches pa dang / tha snyad la skyon med pas yid ches pa dang / gtam dang 'bel ba'i gtam rnam par gtan la dbab pas ma nyams par yid ches pa ste /
analyzed: 'grogs pas yod pa nyid du yid ches pa dang / phongs pa na yang bstan pas yid ches pa dang / tha snyad la skyon med pas yid ches pa dang / gtam dang 'bel ba'i gtam rnam par gtan la dbab pas ma nyams par yid ches pa ste /
translated: One believes in the existence of morality through association, through teaching even when one is in distress, through the absence of error in conventional expressions, and through the absence of degeneration in conversation and discourse.

original: lta ba ma nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba ma nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one‚Äôs view does not degenerate.

original: mi dge ba las bzlog pa'i tshe ni tshar gcad dka'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba las bzlog pa'i tshe ni tshar gcad dka'o //
translated: When one turns away from the unwholesome, it is difficult to overcome.

original: dge ba la bzhag pa'i tshe ni myur du yongs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba la bzhag pa'i tshe ni myur du yongs su 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is placed in virtue, it quickly changes.

original: rtse gcig pa nyid la gzhag pa'i tshe ni gang du 'dod par 'gro'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig pa nyid la gzhag pa'i tshe ni gang du 'dod par 'gro'o //
translated: When it is placed in one-pointedness, it goes wherever one wishes.

original: yang mi dge ba skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba ma skyes pa bskyed pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i tshe dang / mi dge ba ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / dge ba skyes pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'i tshe dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i dge ba ma skyes pa bskyed pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: yang mi dge ba skyes pa spang ba dang / dge ba ma skyes pa bskyed pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i tshe dang / mi dge ba ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / dge ba skyes pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba'i tshe dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i dge ba ma skyes pa bskyed pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i tshe na'o //
translated: Moreover, when one is engaged in abandoning arisen non-virtue and in producing unarisen virtue, when one is engaged in not producing unarisen non-virtue and in abiding in arisen virtue, and when one is engaged in producing unarisen virtue of meditative equipoise.

original: yang tshul khrims la brtson pa rnams kyi dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa la brtson pa rnams kyi dang / bsgom pa la brtson pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: yang tshul khrims la brtson pa rnams kyi dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa la brtson pa rnams kyi dang / bsgom pa la brtson pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Moreover, it is for those who strive in ethics, for those who strive in listening and reflection, and for those who strive in meditation.

original: yang rab tu 'byung ba dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / rtag tu bsgom pa la bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rab tu 'byung ba dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / rtag tu bsgom pa la bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is an obstacle to renunciation, delight, and constant meditation.

original: dul ba ni de las zlog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dul ba ni de las zlog par byed pa ste /
translated: Subjugation is the opposite of that.

original: de'i gnas kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis for the abandonment of the defilements.

original: legs pa zhes bya ba ni dul ba'i bsngags pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: legs pa zhes bya ba ni dul ba'i bsngags pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The expression good indicates the praise of self-discipline.

original: bde ba skyed pa zhes bya ba ni @267b bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba skyed pa zhes bya ba ni @267b bshad pa yin no //
translated: The expression which produces happiness indicates the praise of the result.

original: ji ltar sems dben pa la gzhol ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems dben pa la gzhol ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is the mind directed towards solitude?

original: gnas pa la 'du 'dzi dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: gnas pa la 'du 'dzi dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: It is directed towards solitude when it is associated with the absence of distraction in regard to the state of composure.

original: ji ltar sems mngon par 'byung ba la gzhol ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems mngon par 'byung ba la gzhol ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is the mind directed towards renunciation?

original: grong du rgyu ba dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: grong du rgyu ba dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: It is directed towards renunciation when it is associated with the absence of distraction in regard to the activities of daily living.

original: ji ltar sems mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is the mind directed towards nirvƒÅ·πáa?

original: nang du yang dag 'jog la zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog la zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: It is directed towards nirvƒÅ·πáa when it is associated with the signs of serenity, etc. in regard to the state of composure that consists in the repeated practice of concentration.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang nyon mongs pa las dben pa las brtsams nas ni dben pa la gzhol ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang nyon mongs pa las dben pa las brtsams nas ni dben pa la gzhol ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is directed towards solitude when it is associated with the absence of distraction in regard to the seclusion from the defilements.

original: 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba las brtsams nas ni mngon par 'byung ba la gzhol ba yin no ;
analyzed: 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba las brtsams nas ni mngon par 'byung ba la gzhol ba yin no ;
translated: It is directed towards renunciation when it is associated with the absence of distraction in regard to the renunciation of samsara.

original: / mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa las brtsams nas ni mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba yin no //
analyzed: / mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa las brtsams nas ni mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba yin no //
translated: And beginning with entering the city of nirvana, it is directed toward nirvana.

original: tshor ba nying mtshams sbyor ba dang bcas pa thams cad 'gags pa'i phyir grib ma med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba nying mtshams sbyor ba dang bcas pa thams cad 'gags pa'i phyir grib ma med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: It is without shade and nirvana because all feelings and their causes have ceased.

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang gtan bral ba'i phyir zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang gtan bral ba'i phyir zhi ba yin no //
translated: It is peace because it is free from the three kinds of suffering.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rims nad kyi gdung ba dang gtan bral ba'i phyir bsil bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rims nad kyi gdung ba dang gtan bral ba'i phyir bsil bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is cool because it is free from the torment of the fever of the afflictions.

original: bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i phyir tshangs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i phyir tshangs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is Brahma because it is the attainment of the unsurpassed state.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i skyon ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i skyon ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three faults in listening to the holy Dharma:

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rmongs pa dang mi gus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rmongs pa dang mi gus pa'o //
translated: distraction, confusion, and lack of respect.

original: nyan pa'i snod ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: nyan pa'i snod ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of vessels for listening:

original: dman pa'i sems nyid dang / kun nas shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don gzung ba'i sems nyid dang / don legs par gzung ba'i sems nyid dang / gus pa'i sems nyid do //
analyzed: dman pa'i sems nyid dang / kun nas shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don gzung ba'i sems nyid dang / don legs par gzung ba'i sems nyid dang / gus pa'i sems nyid do //
translated: the attitude of inferiority, the attitude of complete understanding, the attitude of grasping the meaning, the attitude of grasping the meaning well, and the attitude of respect.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ston pa'i yon tan ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ston pa'i yon tan ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /
translated: These are the five qualities of the Teacher in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de dag dang ldan pa'i ston pa ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams zil gyis non pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa'i ston pa ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams zil gyis non pa yin no //
translated: The Teacher who possesses these five qualities surpasses all the ascetics and brahmins who are outside this teaching.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: tshul 'khrug pa med par kun du spyod pa dang / chos nyid legs par bcas pa dang / bslab pa legs par bcas pa dang / chos legs par bcas pa dang / bslab pa legs par bcas pa dag la the tshom skyes so cog gcod pa nyid dang /
analyzed: tshul 'khrug pa med par kun du spyod pa dang / chos nyid legs par bcas pa dang / bslab pa legs par bcas pa dang / chos legs par bcas pa dang / bslab pa legs par bcas pa dag la the tshom skyes so cog gcod pa nyid dang /
translated: He is one who practices without disturbing the rules, who has well-established the nature of things, who has well-established the training, who has well-established the Dharma, and who resolves all doubts that arise regarding the well-established training and nature of things.

original: nges par 'byin pa nyid 'doms pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa nyid 'doms pa'o //
translated: He is one who teaches the path that leads to deliverance.üîΩThis path leads to deliverance through three causes.

original: lam 'di nyid ni rgyu gsum gyis nges par 'byin pa yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam 'di nyid ni rgyu gsum gyis nges par 'byin pa yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three?

original: bdag med par lta bas @268a * //
analyzed: bdag med par lta bas @268a * //
translated: Because of the view of selflessness,

original: 'dris pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'phral du nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang / 'phral du thar pas skrag par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dris pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'phral du nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang / 'phral du thar pas skrag par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the immediate antidote to the defilements, and because it does not immediately frighten one with liberation.

original: dga' ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Joy is fourfold:

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa'i dga' ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i dga' ba dang / yid la gcags pa med pa'i dga' ba dang / spong ba bsgom pa nyid kyi dga' ba la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa'i dga' ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i dga' ba dang / yid la gcags pa med pa'i dga' ba dang / spong ba bsgom pa nyid kyi dga' ba la dga' ba'o //
translated: joy in the austerity of resources, joy in the observance of pure conduct, joy in the absence of regret, and joy in the cultivation of abandonment.

original: dga' ba dang pos ni snying las chung ba nyid kyi bde ba 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: dga' ba dang pos ni snying las chung ba nyid kyi bde ba 'dren par byed do //
translated: The first joy brings about the happiness of few desires.

original: gnyis pas ni mngon par 'byung ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni mngon par 'byung ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: The second brings about the happiness of renunciation.

original: gsum pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba'o //
translated: The third brings about the happiness of concentration.

original: bzhi pas ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba 'dren par byed do //
translated: The fourth brings about the happiness of perfect enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ni rgyu gnyis kyis legs par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ni rgyu gnyis kyis legs par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One has said that the Dharma is well-spoken for two reasons:

original: tshig 'bru legs par rnam par phye ba nyid dang / legs par rab tu rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tshig 'bru legs par rnam par phye ba nyid dang / legs par rab tu rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By the excellence of the analysis of the words and the excellence of the understanding.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis tshig 'bru'i don legs par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis tshig 'bru'i don legs par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: By two causes there is the excellence of the understanding of the meaning of the words:

original: legs par mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa nyid dang / nges par 'byin pa mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pas so //
analyzed: legs par mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa nyid dang / nges par 'byin pa mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pas so //
translated: by the excellence of the clear understanding and by the clear understanding of the deliverance.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis nges par 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis nges par 'byin pa yin te /
translated: By two causes there is the deliverance:

original: bde 'gror 'gro bas nges par 'byin pa nyid dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro bas nges par 'byin pa nyid do //
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro bas nges par 'byin pa nyid dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro bas nges par 'byin pa nyid do //
translated: by the deliverance through the attainment of a good destiny and by the deliverance through the attainment of perfect enlightenment.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba yin te /
translated: By two causes there is the attainment of perfect enlightenment:

original: som nyi med pa dang mi phyed pas so //
analyzed: som nyi med pa dang mi phyed pas so //
translated: by the absence of doubt and by the absence of division.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis mi phyed pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis mi phyed pa yin te /
translated: By two causes there is the absence of division:

original: lta ba mi phyed pa dang / 'dus pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: lta ba mi phyed pa dang / 'dus pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: by the absence of division of view and by the possession of the assembly.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis 'dus pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis 'dus pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: By two causes there is the possession of the assembly:

original: rtogs pa brtan pa dang / rton pa yod pas so //
analyzed: rtogs pa brtan pa dang / rton pa yod pas so //
translated: by the stability of the realization and by the existence of the reliance.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis rton pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis rton pa yod pa yin te /
translated: There are two reasons for having recourse to the Dharma:

original: ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa dang / rton pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin pas so //
analyzed: ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa dang / rton pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin pas so //
translated: one has recourse to the knowledge and not to the consciousness, and this recourse is the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis rton pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis rton pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: There are two reasons for having recourse to the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha:

original: som nyi thams cad gcod pa dang / log par bsgrub pa mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: som nyi thams cad gcod pa dang / log par bsgrub pa mi dmigs pas so //
translated: he cuts through all doubts and he does not take up false practices.

original: spong ba'i gags kyi chos ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i gags kyi chos ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four things which are obstacles to the abandonment:

original: skyo ba med pa dang / shes pa yongs su ma smin pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang bying ba'o //
analyzed: skyo ba med pa dang / shes pa yongs su ma smin pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang bying ba'o //
translated: discouragement, the immaturity of knowledge, distraction and slackness.

original: sdig pa byed pa dag la ni shes rab kyi @268b mig ldongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa dag la ni shes rab kyi @268b mig ldongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the eye of wisdom of those who commit evil is blinded.

original: bsod nams byed pa dag la ni dri ma can du'o //
analyzed: bsod nams byed pa dag la ni dri ma can du'o //
translated: That of those who do good is stained.

original: gzhan mu stegs can la ni rab rib can du'o //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can la ni rab rib can du'o //
translated: That of the other sectarians is dim.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos bcu gcig yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos bcu gcig yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: By cultivating the close placement of mindfulness of dharmas, one should understand the eleven afflicted dharmas.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / sdud pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / rab tu dben pa la mngon par mi dga' ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / sdud pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / rab tu dben pa la mngon par mi dga' ba dang /
translated: They are attachment, aversion, delusion, contraction, distraction, depression, agitation, the signs of secondary affliction, not delighting in solitude,

original: ro myong bar mi byed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: ro myong bar mi byed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: not experiencing taste, and manifest pride.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam ni rgyu bzhis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi grogs kyi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam ni rgyu bzhis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi grogs kyi bya ba byed de /
translated: The mundane path acts as a helper of the supramundane path through four causes.

original: sgrib pa sel ba dang / thag bsring bas rnam par gnon pa dang / skyo bas shig shig por byed pa dang / chos kyi shugs kyis mngon par rlan par byed pas so //
analyzed: sgrib pa sel ba dang / thag bsring bas rnam par gnon pa dang / skyo bas shig shig por byed pa dang / chos kyi shugs kyis mngon par rlan par byed pas so //
translated: It eliminates obscurations, it suppresses through distance, it makes one weary, and it moistens with the power of Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan ni rgyu bzhis sems can gyi don thams cad kyi spyod yul can yin par rig par bya ste /
