analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan ni rgyu bzhis sems can gyi don thams cad kyi spyod yul can yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The divine eye of the Tathagata should be known as the domain of all the aims of sentient beings through four causes.üîΩHe sees all sentient beings who are engaged in the path that is conducive to the accomplishment of all beings, he sees all sentient beings who are abiding in various many places of birth,

original: 'gro ba thams cad 'grub pa dang / mthun pa'i lam mngon par 'du byed pa la gnas pa'i sems can kun du gzigs pa dang / skye ba'i gnas sna tshogs mang po na gnas pa'i sems can kun du gzigs pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa dang bcas pa'i 'chi 'pho dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad 'grub pa dang / mthun pa'i lam mngon par 'du byed pa la gnas pa'i sems can kun du gzigs pa dang / skye ba'i gnas sna tshogs mang po na gnas pa'i sems can kun du gzigs pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa dang bcas pa'i 'chi 'pho dang /
translated: he sees all sentient beings who are endowed with death, transmigration, and birth, together with the intermediate existence,

original: skye ba dang ldan pa'i sems can kun du gzigs pa dang / bar mdo'i srid pa med pa'i 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang ldan pa'i sems can kun du gzigs pas so //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa'i sems can kun du gzigs pa dang / bar mdo'i srid pa med pa'i 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang ldan pa'i sems can kun du gzigs pas so //
translated: and he sees all sentient beings who are endowed with death, transmigration, and birth, without the intermediate existence.

original: rnal 'byor pa chos rtogs par bya ba dang / chos rab tu rtogs par bya ba la brtson pa'i chos rtogs par bya ba dang / chos rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i go rims ni bdun te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa chos rtogs par bya ba dang / chos rab tu rtogs par bya ba la brtson pa'i chos rtogs par bya ba dang / chos rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i go rims ni bdun te /
translated: The order of the Dharma to be realized and the Dharma to be fully understood by the yogi who is striving for the realization of the Dharma and the full understanding of the Dharma is sevenfold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: ston pa po la gus shing bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur byas nas rna ba gtod pa dang / rna ba gtad nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrubs nas sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i thabs yongs su gzung ba dang /üîΩthabs yongs su bzung nas brtson 'grus brtsam pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams nas nang dang phyi rol la sems mi mnyam pa skye ba'i gzhi so sor spang ba'i tshul gyis zang zing dang / chos kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag par byed @269a * //
analyzed: ston pa po la gus shing bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur byas nas rna ba gtod pa dang / rna ba gtad nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrubs nas sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i thabs yongs su gzung ba dang / thabs yongs su bzung nas brtson 'grus brtsam pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams nas nang dang phyi rol la sems mi mnyam pa skye ba'i gzhi so sor spang ba'i tshul gyis zang zing dang / chos kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag par byed @269a * //
translated: It is to respect and serve the teacher, to listen with attention after having served, to practice the teaching in accord with the teaching after having listened with attention, to take up the right means in order to stabilize the mind after having practiced the teaching in accord with the teaching,üîΩto apply diligence after having taken up the right means, to eliminate the basis for the arising of an unbalanced mind with regard to the internal and the external after having applied diligence,

original: pa dang ; sgrib pa rnam par dag nas ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myong bar mi byed cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang ; sgrib pa rnam par dag nas ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myong bar mi byed cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'o //
translated: to purify the obscurations of material things and of the teaching by the method of individually rejecting, to not experience the taste of concentration and to be without conceit after having purified the obscurations.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa dgu'i gnyen por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa dgu'i gnyen por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should cultivate the four foundations of mindfulness as antidotes to the nine types of adverse factors.

original: dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine?

original: de ni skyo ba med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / bying ba dang 'khrug pa la mi mjed pa med pa nyid dang / ngan ngon tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: de ni skyo ba med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / bying ba dang 'khrug pa la mi mjed pa med pa nyid dang / ngan ngon tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: They are: lack of disenchantment, lack of attention, the secondary mental afflictions of meditative serenity and insight, lack of equanimity toward laxity and excitement, contentment with meager spiritual realizations,

original: gdams ngag brjed pa dang / ltung ba dang / brtson pa btang ba nyid do //
analyzed: gdams ngag brjed pa dang / ltung ba dang / brtson pa btang ba nyid do //
translated: forgetting the instructions, downfalls, and lack of effort.

original: khyim med pa'i skyon ni lnga ste /
analyzed: khyim med pa'i skyon ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five faults of the homeless state:

original: mngon par mi dga' ba'i skyon dang ; rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la lhag par chags pa'i skyon dang / shes kyi khe tshol ba'i skyon dang / khyad du gsod pa'i skyon dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi skyon no //
analyzed: mngon par mi dga' ba'i skyon dang ; rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la lhag par chags pa'i skyon dang / shes kyi khe tshol ba'i skyon dang / khyad du gsod pa'i skyon dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi skyon no //
translated: the fault of lack of affection, the fault of excessive attachment to gain and honor, the fault of seeking knowledge for profit, the fault of contempt, and the fault of manifest pride.

original: khyim pa'i skyon yang lnga ste /
analyzed: khyim pa'i skyon yang lnga ste /
translated: There are also five faults of the home life:

original: lhag par chags pa'i skyon dang / bar du gcod pa'i 'dod pa bsten pa'i skyon dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i skyon dang / nyes par spyod pa la sbyor ba'i skyon dang / legs par spyod pa la mi sbyor ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: lhag par chags pa'i skyon dang / bar du gcod pa'i 'dod pa bsten pa'i skyon dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i skyon dang / nyes par spyod pa la sbyor ba'i skyon dang / legs par spyod pa la mi sbyor ba'i skyon no //
translated: The faults of attachment, the faults of relying on those who have desires that are obstacles, the faults of grasping, the faults of engaging in bad conduct, and the faults of not engaging in good conduct.

original: byis pa'i rtags ni bzhi po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: byis pa'i rtags ni bzhi po 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are four marks of a fool:

original: legs par bya ba mi byed pa dang / nyes par bya ba byed pa dang / 'dren mar byed pa dang / gcig tu legs par bya ba de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su mi shes pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang byis pa'i rtags bzhi ste /
analyzed: legs par bya ba mi byed pa dang / nyes par bya ba byed pa dang / 'dren mar byed pa dang / gcig tu legs par bya ba de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su mi shes pa'o // gzhan yang byis pa'i rtags bzhi ste /
translated: not doing what is good, doing what is bad, doing both, and not knowing exactly what is good to do.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four more marks of a fool:

original: blo gros ma nges pa dang / blo gros log par rnam par nges pa dang / sbyor ba mi rtsom pa dang / tshul 'chos pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang byis pa'i rtags bzhi ste /
analyzed: blo gros ma nges pa dang / blo gros log par rnam par nges pa dang / sbyor ba mi rtsom pa dang / tshul 'chos pa'o // gzhan yang byis pa'i rtags bzhi ste /
translated: not being certain about the intellect, being certain about a wrong intellect, not undertaking the practice, and hypocrisy.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four more marks of a fool:

original: gnas ma yin pa la dga' ba dang / gnas ma yin pa la mya ngan byed pa dang / zhugs pa la nges pa dang / dang po nas mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la dga' ba dang / gnas ma yin pa la mya ngan byed pa dang / zhugs pa la nges pa dang / dang po nas mi rtog pa'o //
translated: 1. delighting in what is not the proper place; 2. grieving over what is not the proper place; 3. certainty in what is not the proper place; 4. not reflecting from the beginning; 5. not being ashamed of what is shameful.

original: gzhan yang byis pa'i rtags lnga ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byis pa'i rtags lnga ste /
translated: There are five more marks of the fool:

original: log par mngon par rtogs pa dang / log par rtsom pa dang / de'i ngal ba phal cher 'bras bu med pa dang / des mya ngan byed pa dang / byis pa phal cher bsod nams chung zhing kha rje chung ba'o //
analyzed: log par mngon par rtogs pa dang / log par rtsom pa dang / de'i ngal ba phal cher 'bras bu med pa dang / des mya ngan byed pa dang / byis pa phal cher bsod nams chung zhing kha rje chung ba'o //
translated: 1. perverted understanding; 2. perverted undertaking; 3. his efforts are mostly fruitless; 4. he grieves over that; 5. most fools have little merit and little influence.

original: 'khor ba ni rgya mtsho dang chos mthun pa lngas rgya mtsho'i ming 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni rgya mtsho dang chos mthun pa lngas rgya mtsho'i ming 'thob ste /
translated: Samsara is called an ocean because it has five qualities in common with the ocean:

original: spyod yul tshad med par chos mthun pa dang / zab par chos mthun pa dang / gting slebs dka' bar chos mthun pa dang / btung @269b du mi rung bar chos mthun pa dang / rin po che chen po'i gnas yin par chos mthun pas so //
analyzed: spyod yul tshad med par chos mthun pa dang / zab par chos mthun pa dang / gting slebs dka' bar chos mthun pa dang / btung @269b du mi rung bar chos mthun pa dang / rin po che chen po'i gnas yin par chos mthun pas so //
translated: it is immeasurable in extent; it is deep; it is difficult to reach the bottom; it is not fit to drink; it is the abode of great jewels.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni rgyu lngas zang zing gi sbyin pa las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /üîΩzang zing gi sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa yin gyi chos kyi sbyin pa ni legs par spyod pa nges par kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni rgyu lngas zang zing gi sbyin pa las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te / zang zing gi sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa yin gyi chos kyi sbyin pa ni legs par spyod pa nges par kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The gift of Dharma is superior to the gift of material things for five reasons.üîΩThe gift of material things motivates others to engage in negative action, but the gift of Dharma definitely motivates them to engage in positive action.üîΩThe gift of material things motivates others to engage in defilements, but the gift of Dharma is the antidote to defilements.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la rgyun du kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba skyed par byed pa yin gyi chos kyi sbyin pa ni rgyun du kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la rgyun du kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba skyed par byed pa yin gyi chos kyi sbyin pa ni rgyun du kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The gift of material things produces happiness that is constantly tainted, but the gift of Dharma produces happiness that is never tainted.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa ni sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba yod kyang rung /üîΩmed kyang rung mod pa yin gyi chos kyi sbyin pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba med na dkon pa'i phyir dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa ni byin na zad pa'i chos can yin gyi /
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa ni sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba yod kyang rung / med kyang rung mod pa yin gyi chos kyi sbyin pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba med na dkon pa'i phyir dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa ni byin na zad pa'i chos can yin gyi /
translated: The generosity of material things is easy to practice,üîΩbut the generosity of Dharma is difficult to practice because the generosity of material things is easy to practice whether or not buddhas appear and the generosity of Dharma is rare when buddhas do not appear.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni byin na mi zad pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni byin na mi zad pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the generosity of material things is subject to exhaustion when given, but the generosity of Dharma is not subject to exhaustion when given.

original: sems lnga la ni dbang bsgyur bar bya'i sems de dag gi dbang du ni mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sems lnga la ni dbang bsgyur bar bya'i sems de dag gi dbang du ni mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin te /
translated: One should control the five minds and not be controlled by them.

original: nyes par spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems nyes par spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / legs par spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems legs par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa dang / 'dod pa yongs su tshol ba'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems chos ma yin pas bab col du 'dod pa yongs su tshol ba la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems nyes par spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / legs par spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems legs par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa dang / 'dod pa yongs su tshol ba'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems chos ma yin pas bab col du 'dod pa yongs su tshol ba la 'jug pa dang /
translated: One should not engage in evil conduct when one has a mind arisen from preparation for evil conduct, one should not engage in good conduct when one has a mind arisen from preparation for good conduct, one should not seek sense objects when one has a mind arisen from preparation for seeking sense objects, one should not seek the Dharma when one has a mind arisen from preparation for seeking the Dharma, and one should not seek liberation when one has a mind arisen from preparation for seeking liberation.

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems chags pa nas nyes dmigs su mi lta ba dang / nges par 'byung ba rab tu mi shes pa'i bar gyis longs spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems mngon par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems chags pa nas nyes dmigs su mi lta ba dang / nges par 'byung ba rab tu mi shes pa'i bar gyis longs spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems mngon par 'byung ba dang /
translated: The attachment of the mind that arises from the preparation of enjoying sense objects, from not seeing the disadvantages of sense objects, and from not knowing definite release, engages in enjoyment, not in renunciation or seclusion.

original: rab tu dben pa las phyir ldog cing 'dod pa rnams dang / bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa las phyir ldog cing 'dod pa rnams dang / bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The mind that arises from the preparation of renunciation and seclusion turns away from renunciation and seclusion and engages in enjoying sense objects and savoring the taste of meditative concentration.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdon ni rgyu lngas 'byung po'i gdon las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdon ni rgyu lngas 'byung po'i gdon las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
translated: The demon of afflictions is superior to the demon of the bhutas in five ways.

original: 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa ni gcig la gdon gcig gis zin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa ni gcig la gdon gcig gis zin pa yin gyi /
translated: Those seized by the demon of the bhutas are seized by one demon,

original: nyon mongs pa'i @270a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i @270a * //
translated: but those seized by the demon of afflictions are seized by many demons.

original: gdon gyis zin pa ni gcig la nyon mongs pa'i gdon du mas zin pa yin pa dang / gzhan yang 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa'i 'byung po'i gdon ni gsang sngags dag gam sman dag gam /
analyzed: gdon gyis zin pa ni gcig la nyon mongs pa'i gdon du mas zin pa yin pa dang / gzhan yang 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa'i 'byung po'i gdon ni gsang sngags dag gam sman dag gam /
translated: Moreover, the demon of an elemental spirit that seizes someone is easy to accomplish with mantras, medicine, or ritual articles.üîΩBut the demon of an affliction that seizes someone is not easy to accomplish.

original: yo byad dag gis bsgrub sla ba yin gyi nyon mongs pa'i gdon gyis zin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gdon ni bsgrub tu mi rung ba yin pa dang / gzhan yang 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa'i 'byung po'i gdon ni zin pa tsam kho nas byis pa dang khye'u dag yan chad kyis kyang rnam par shes pa sla ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yo byad dag gis bsgrub sla ba yin gyi nyon mongs pa'i gdon gyis zin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gdon ni bsgrub tu mi rung ba yin pa dang / gzhan yang 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa'i 'byung po'i gdon ni zin pa tsam kho nas byis pa dang khye'u dag yan chad kyis kyang rnam par shes pa sla ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the demon of an elemental spirit that seizes someone is easy for even a child or a youth to recognize, just by being seized.üîΩBut the demon of an affliction that seizes someone is difficult for even the wise of the world to recognize.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdon gyis zin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gdon ni 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang rnam par shes pa dka' ba yin pa dang / gzhan yang 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa'i 'byung po'i gdon ni glo bur ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdon gyis zin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gdon ni 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang rnam par shes pa dka' ba yin pa dang / gzhan yang 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa'i 'byung po'i gdon ni glo bur ba ste /
translated: Moreover, the demon of an elemental spirit that seizes someone is adventitious.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa dang / des de'i ngang tshul du mi 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa dang / des de'i ngang tshul du mi 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: It is not innate, and it does not make the mind's nature that way.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdon gyis zin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gdon ni glo bur ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdon gyis zin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gdon ni glo bur ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: The demon of the afflictions is not adventitious,

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang / das da'i ngang tshul du 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa'i 'byung po'i gdon ni de las gzhan pa'i sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang / das da'i ngang tshul du 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang 'byung po'i gdon gyis zin pa'i 'byung po'i gdon ni de las gzhan pa'i sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa yin gyi /
translated: but the demon of the spirits is not common to all sentient beings, but is only a demon of the spirits that seizes some sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdon gyis zin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gdon ni de las gzhan pa'i sems can thams cad dang thun mong yin pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdon gyis zin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gdon ni de las gzhan pa'i sems can thams cad dang thun mong yin pas so //
translated: The demon of the afflictions is common to all sentient beings, but the demon of the spirits is not common to all sentient beings.

original: dge slong tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems pa la zhugs pa bden pa dang / gnas pa las bdag nyid dmigs nas /
analyzed: dge slong tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems pa la zhugs pa bden pa dang / gnas pa las bdag nyid dmigs nas /
translated: A monk who is engaged in improper thinking, having observed himself in terms of the truths and the stages,

original: 'dogs par byed pa'i slu ba ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /üîΩmu stegs can gyi bstan pa la 'jug cing /

analyzed: mu stegs can gyi lta ba 'dzin pa dang / gal te mi 'jug na yang mu stegs can rnams dang chos mthun par gyur ba dang / zhugs na yang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i lam du zhugs par 'gyur ba dang / ma zhugs na yang rgyu gnyis kyis te /

analyzed: 'dod pa spyod pa dang / bsod nams spyod pa dang / phan tshun gnas pa'i spyod @270b pa las brtsams nas /

analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug gang zhe na /

analyzed: yul la 'dod chags pa ste /

analyzed: rnam pa drug gang zhe na /

analyzed: de ni yon tan gsum pa yin no ; / gal te kun du sbyor ba lhag ma dang bcas shing /

analyzed: ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin pa rjes su thob par gyur na /

analyzed: de ni yon tan bzhi pa yin no //

analyzed: gang zag yongs su ma smin pa rab tu byung na tshe 'di la khyim gyi gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma dag las yongs su @271b grol zhing 'di lta ste /

translated: mental dissatisfaction, and

analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang / chos la ser sna byed pa'o //
translated: miserliness with regard to the Dharma.

original: byis ba byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rang gi mtshan nyid las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pa gang yin pa ni pha dang / ma dang / bu dang / chung ma nas /

translated: The childish do not understand, in accordance with reality, the nature of the forms that arise and arise again. This is called ‚Äúignorance.‚Äù

analyzed: de dag gis kyang de la bden pa de dag gi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa las dang po kho nar ma rtogs pa rnams ni rtogs par byed la rtogs pa rnams ni mi brjod par bya ba'i phyir don gcig gis tshig 'bru
translated: They, in turn, explain the truths to him, using the methods of understanding the characteristics of the truths. They cause him to understand what he has not understood, and they do not repeat what he has understood.

original: tha dad pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya bas yongs su byang bar byed cing /
analyzed: tha dad pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya bas yongs su byang bar byed cing /
translated: Thus, they purify him by means of the different words that have the same meaning.

original: bdag med pa dang ldan pa bden pa la mngon par rtogs par byed pa don gyi tshig zab pa shis rab kyis rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang ldan pa bden pa la mngon par rtogs par byed pa don gyi tshig zab pa shis rab kyis rtogs par byas nas /
translated: They cause him to understand the profound meaning of the truths that are associated with selflessness by means of the words that have a profound meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos dang tshig stong pa nyid dang ldan pa yang ston par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos dang tshig stong pa nyid dang ldan pa yang ston par byed do //
translated: He also teaches the Dharma and the words of the Tathagata that are endowed with emptiness.

original: de thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the purity of the knowledge that arises from hearing and reflection,

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i phyir dang / rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa nas rgyas par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i bar dag bsgom par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i phyir dang / rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa nas rgyas par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i bar dag bsgom par rig par bya ste /
translated: he begins and purifies the knowledge that arises from meditation. He should be known as cultivating the four establishments of mindfulness, beginning with the internal body, up to the detailed [four establishments of mindfulness].

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob par bya zhing grub par bya ba las brtsam nas shes pa gsum po de dag yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob par bya zhing grub par bya ba las brtsam nas shes pa gsum po de dag yin te /
translated: These are the three knowledges that begin with and accomplish the attainment of the eightfold noble path.

original: de ltar na dge slong shes pa rnams kyis mi dben pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong shes pa rnams kyis mi dben pa yin no //
translated: Thus, a monk is not secluded by means of the knowledges.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / phyir zhing 'phel ba dang / yangs par bya ba'i phyir nye bar rton pa gang zhe na /üîΩzang zing gi longs spyod las brtsams nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / phyir zhing 'phel ba dang / yangs par bya ba'i phyir nye bar rton pa gang zhe na / zang zing gi longs spyod las brtsams nas /
translated: What is the basis of the wholesome roots that have arisen, in order to maintain them, to perfect the cultivation, to increase them and to expand them?üîΩIt is the acceptance of the Dharma robes and so on from faithful donors and benefactors, beginning with material gifts.

original: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag dad pa can dag las chos gos la sogs pa blang ba la tshod rig pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gi nye bar rton pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag dad pa can dag las chos gos la sogs pa blang ba la tshod rig pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gi nye bar rton pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the basis of self-mastery.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar gzhi des dge slong lus mi ngal ba dang ; sems las su rung ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhi des dge slong lus mi ngal ba dang ; sems las su rung ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because, on that basis, the monk is not physically exhausted, his mind is not agitated, and his mind is not defiled.

original: dge ba'i chos de dag las kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag las kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: And he does not lose the wholesome roots,

original: mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but increases and expands them.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir nye bar rton pa @274b gang zhen /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir nye bar rton pa @274b gang zhen /
translated: What is the reliance for the sake of producing virtuous qualities that have not yet arisen?

original: dge slong na so rgyan pa tshul khrims kyis rgyan pa /
analyzed: dge slong na so rgyan pa tshul khrims kyis rgyan pa /
translated: It is the reliance on those who are fully ordained, who are young, who are adorned with morality,

original: dga' ba thams cad kyi nang na mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba mchog yin par shes pa /
analyzed: dga' ba thams cad kyi nang na mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba mchog yin par shes pa /
translated: who know that the highest joy of all is the joy of nirvana,

original: la shin du bsgom pa /
analyzed: la shin du bsgom pa /
translated: who have cultivated it well,

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa gang dag yin pa de dag la 'dud pa dang / rim gro byed pa dang / legs par smras pa'i rjes su yi rang bas byed pa dang / g-yo mi byed pa dang klan ka tshol ba'i sems med pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de dag bskyed pa'i phyir nye bar rton pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa gang dag yin pa de dag la 'dud pa dang / rim gro byed pa dang / legs par smras pa'i rjes su yi rang bas byed pa dang / g-yo mi byed pa dang klan ka tshol ba'i sems med pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de dag bskyed pa'i phyir nye bar rton pa zhes bya'o //
translated: who are without conceit, and who are respectful, reverential, and appreciative of good advice, who are without deceit and without a mind that seeks to find fault. This is called reliance for the sake of producing virtuous qualities that have not yet arisen.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la de ltar legs par 'jug pa'i dge slong ni de dag las dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa ma skyes pa rnams myur ba kho nar bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dus dus su rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang rjesüîΩsu mthun pa thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la de ltar legs par 'jug pa'i dge slong ni de dag las dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa ma skyes pa rnams myur ba kho nar bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dus dus su rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su mthun pa thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, a monk who engages in this way with regard to these is able to quickly generate wholesome states that are conducive to enlightenment, which have not previously arisen, through the timely application of the proper instructions and timely application of the proper forms of exhortation.

original: de ltar na yan lag bzhi po de dag yod na bcu gcig tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na yan lag bzhi po de dag yod na bcu gcig tu 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, when these four limbs exist, there are eleven.

original: bcu gcig yod na yang bzhir 'gyur /
analyzed: bcu gcig yod na yang bzhir 'gyur /
translated: And when there are eleven, there are four.

original: don ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: don ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: The meaning is sevenfold:

original: rnam par dpyad par bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba dang / gsal bar bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / bzlog par bya ba dang / kun du gzung bar bya ba dang / bsdu bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad par bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba dang / gsal bar bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / bzlog par bya ba dang / kun du gzung bar bya ba dang / bsdu bar bya ba'o //
translated: that which is to be investigated, that which is to be undertaken, that which is to be clarified, that which is to be accomplished, that which is to be averted, that which is to be fully grasped, and that which is to be summarized.

original: yid bde ba ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: yid bde ba ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are seven kinds of mental satisfaction:

original: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / bsgrib pa med pa las byung ba dang 'brel pa'i gtam las byung ba dang / rang gi yon tan rjes su dran pa las byung ba dang /üîΩdman pas chog mi shes pa las byung ba'o //üîΩchos ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / bsgrib pa med pa las byung ba dang 'brel pa'i gtam las byung ba dang / rang gi yon tan rjes su dran pa las byung ba dang / dman pas chog mi shes pa las byung ba'o // chos ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five kinds of satisfaction are satisfaction with little, satisfaction with what is fitting, satisfaction with spiritual power, satisfaction with knowledge, and satisfaction with the Dharma.

original: bshad pa'i chos dang / tshul gyi chos dang / gzung ba'i chos dang / longs spyod kyi chos dang / thob pa'i chos so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos dang / tshul gyi chos dang / gzung ba'i chos dang / longs spyod kyi chos dang / thob pa'i chos so //
translated: The five kinds of Dharma are the Dharma of teaching, the Dharma of method, the Dharma of retention, the Dharma of enjoyment, and the Dharma of attainment.

original: mda' 'phang ba ni yon tan gsum gyis phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mda' 'phang ba ni yon tan gsum gyis phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The five kinds of shooting arrows are shooting arrows with three perfections:

original: gzhu'i yon tan dang / mda'i yon tan dang / 'phen pa'i yon tan gyis so //
analyzed: gzhu'i yon tan dang / mda'i yon tan dang / 'phen pa'i yon tan gyis so //
translated: the perfection of the bow, the perfection of the arrow, and the perfection of the shooter.

original: de la gzhu'i yon tan ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gzhu'i yon tan ni gnyis te /
translated: The perfection of the bow is twofold:

original: rgyu bzang po dang ldan pa dang / legs par mthar phyin par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu bzang po dang ldan pa dang / legs par mthar phyin par byas pa'o //
translated: it has a good string and it is well-finished.

original: mda'i yon tan ni gcig ste /
analyzed: mda'i yon tan ni gcig ste /
translated: The perfection of the arrow is one:

original: legs par mthar phyin par byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: legs par mthar phyin par byas pa nyid do //
translated: it is well-finished.

original: 'phen pa'i yon tan ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'phen pa'i yon tan ni gsum ste /
translated: The qualities of the thrower are three:

original: 'phong mthar phyin pa dang / 'phong la goms pa dang / 'phong slob dpon las bslab pa'o //
analyzed: 'phong mthar phyin pa dang / 'phong la goms pa dang / 'phong slob dpon las bslab pa'o //
translated: he has perfected archery, he is skilled in archery, and he is a teacher of archery.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa @275a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa @275a * //
translated: The Tathagata's teaching of the Dharma

original: ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: is threefold:

original: dus yun ring du ston pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par ston pa dang / mi zlos par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dus yun ring du ston pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par ston pa dang / mi zlos par ston pa'o //
translated: he teaches for a long time, he teaches uninterruptedly, and he teaches without repetition.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos ston pa ni tshul gsum gyis dpag tu med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos ston pa ni tshul gsum gyis dpag tu med pa yin te /
translated: The Tathagata's teaching of the Dharma is immeasurable in three ways:

original: don sna tshogs pa nyid kyi tshul dang / tshig 'bru sna tshogs pa nyid kyi tshul dang / rgol pa'i lan sna tshogs pa nyid kyi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: don sna tshogs pa nyid kyi tshul dang / tshig 'bru sna tshogs pa nyid kyi tshul dang / rgol pa'i lan sna tshogs pa nyid kyi tshul gyis so //
translated: by way of the variety of meanings, by way of the variety of expressions, and by way of the variety of replies to objections.

original: lam du zhugs pa'i gnyen po ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lam du zhugs pa'i gnyen po ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The antidote for one who has entered the path should be understood as fivefold:

original: nyi ma'i gnyen po dang / bgrod dka' ba'i gnyen po dang / chu klung gi gnyen po dang / skom pa'i gnyen po dang / lus ngal ba'i gnyen po po'o ;
analyzed: nyi ma'i gnyen po dang / bgrod dka' ba'i gnyen po dang / chu klung gi gnyen po dang / skom pa'i gnyen po dang / lus ngal ba'i gnyen po po'o ;
translated: the antidote for the sun, the antidote for difficult terrain, the antidote for rivers, the antidote for thirst, and the antidote for physical fatigue.

original: / tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis ni bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: / tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis ni bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The two types of morality are the cause for going to good rebirths.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa nyid dang / tshul khrims ma ral ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa nyid dang / tshul khrims ma ral ba nyid do //
translated: They are the morality of taking up what is right and the morality of not violating what is wrong.

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i tshe 'di'i don ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i tshe 'di'i don ni gsum ste /
translated: The three aims of this life are the aims of one who enjoys sense objects.

original: longs spyod rnams bsgrub pa dang / kun du bsrung ba dang / longs spyod de la chags pa med pa'o //üîΩtshe'i tshad ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: longs spyod rnams bsgrub pa dang / kun du bsrung ba dang / longs spyod de la chags pa med pa'o // tshe'i tshad ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: They are the aim of acquiring sense objects, the aim of protecting them, and the aim of not being attached to sense objects.

original: ring ba dang thung ba'o //üîΩgnas skabs 'gyur ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ring ba dang thung ba'o // gnas skabs 'gyur ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The two types of life span are long and short.

original: rags pa dang cha phra ba'o //
analyzed: rags pa dang cha phra ba'o //
translated: The two types of change in condition are gross and subtle.

original: shes pa'i yon tan yang gnyis te don yang dag par rtogs pa'i yon tan dang / ngo bo nyid kyi yon tan no //
analyzed: shes pa'i yon tan yang gnyis te don yang dag par rtogs pa'i yon tan dang / ngo bo nyid kyi yon tan no //
translated: The two types of knowledge are the knowledge of the object and the knowledge of the nature of the object.

original: de la don yang dag par rtogs pa'i yon tan ni myur du yang dag par rtogs pa dang / nges par yang dag par rtogs pa dang / cha phra ba yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la don yang dag par rtogs pa'i yon tan ni myur du yang dag par rtogs pa dang / nges par yang dag par rtogs pa dang / cha phra ba yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the object is threefold: rapid knowledge, certain knowledge, and subtle knowledge.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi yon tan ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang ; legs par bsgoms pa dang / rang gi spyod yul la nyams pa med pa dang / rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas khyad par du 'phags pa dang /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi yon tan ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang ; legs par bsgoms pa dang / rang gi spyod yul la nyams pa med pa dang / rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas khyad par du 'phags pa dang /
translated: and being superior through roots of virtue concordant with one's own type.

original: gzhan gyi rigs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rigs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: It is also superior through roots of virtue concordant with other types.

original: ltos pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: ltos pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the three types of dependence is cultivating the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: grogs la ltos pa dang / rnyed pa la ltos pa dang / yang 'byung ba'i srid pa gzhan la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: grogs la ltos pa dang / rnyed pa la ltos pa dang / yang 'byung ba'i srid pa gzhan la ltos pa'o //
translated: They are dependence on companions, dependence on gain, and dependence on another arising existence.

original: sbyor ba dang mngon par rtogs pa dang / rgyud las te /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang mngon par rtogs pa dang / rgyud las te /
translated: They are from application, clear realization, and lineage.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / ma rig pa'i gnyen pos sbyor ba dang / rnam par ma @275b bzhag pa dang / rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / ma rig pa'i gnyen pos sbyor ba dang / rnam par ma @275b bzhag pa dang / rnam par bzhag pa'i bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi rgyud do //
translated: the practice of the antidote to the desire realm and to ignorance, the realization of the truths that are not yet realized and the realization of the truths that are already realized, the stream of those who are free from desire and the stream of those who are not free from desire.

original: lus dang sa dang gnyen po las te /
analyzed: lus dang sa dang gnyen po las te /
translated: From the body, from the stage, and from the antidote.

original: ting nge 'dzin la mi brtson pa dang / brtson pa dang thob pa dang / ma thob pa las lus rnam par dag pa la sgrub pa dang / yid la byed pa rnam par dag pa la sgrub pa dang / de la sgrub pa'i gnyen pa las so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la mi brtson pa dang / brtson pa dang thob pa dang / ma thob pa las lus rnam par dag pa la sgrub pa dang / yid la byed pa rnam par dag pa la sgrub pa dang / de la sgrub pa'i gnyen pa las so //
translated: From the purification of the body, from the purification of mental attention, and from the purification of the practice in regard to those two, respectively.

original: mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa drug po bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa nas mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i bar du gang gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa drug po bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa nas mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i bar du gang gsungs pa de la /
translated: The six kinds of realization that were mentioned, beginning with the realization of the aspiration, culminate in the realization of the culmination.

original: bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rtags gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rtags gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sign of the realization of the aspiration?

original: smras pa ; bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni so so'i skye por gyur pa nyid nas 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smras pa ; bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni so so'i skye por gyur pa nyid nas 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: He replied: ‚ÄúOne who has realized the mind is one who, from the time of being an ordinary person, has realized that all conditioned things are impermanent, all conditioned things are suffering, all dharmas are without self, and nirvƒÅ·πáa is peace.

original: ji nas kyang de las gzhan pa'i dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am lha'am bdud dam tshangs pa'am sus kyang 'jig rten na chos dang mthun pas mi 'phrogs pa de ltar nges par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ji nas kyang de las gzhan pa'i dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am lha'am bdud dam tshangs pa'am sus kyang 'jig rten na chos dang mthun pas mi 'phrogs pa de ltar nges par gyur pa yin no //
translated: He is one who has attained certainty in such a way that no one in the world can, in accordance with the Dharma, take it away from him, whether a ≈õrama·πáa, a brƒÅhma·πáa, a god, a MƒÅra, a BrahmƒÅ, or anyone else.

original: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i brtags gang zhe na /
analyzed: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i brtags gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is realization of faith?‚Äù

original: smras pa / dad pa mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni so so'i skye bor gyur pa yang rung /üîΩso so'i skye bor gyur pa ma yin pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / dad pa mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni so so'i skye bor gyur pa yang rung /üîΩso so'i skye bor gyur pa ma yin pa yang rung ste /
translated: He replied: ‚ÄúOne who has realized faith is one who, whether an ordinary person or not,üîΩhas faith in the TathƒÅgata.

original: tshe 'di'am tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la ston pa gzhan dang legs par gsungs pa'i chos gzhan dang dge 'dun legs par zhugs pa gzhan yod do zhes tha snyad 'dogs mi srid pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'di'am tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la ston pa gzhan dang legs par gsungs pa'i chos gzhan dang dge 'dun legs par zhugs pa gzhan yod do zhes tha snyad 'dogs mi srid pa yin no //
translated: It is impossible to designate another teacher, another well-spoken doctrine, or another well-practiced community as being superior to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sangha.

original: tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa'i rtags gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa'i rtags gang zhe na /
translated: What are the signs of realization of morality?

original: smras pa / tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni bsams bzhin du dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags kyi srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la log par g-yem pa dang / shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba dang /
analyzed: smras pa / tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni bsams bzhin du dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags kyi srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la log par g-yem pa dang / shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba dang /
translated: One who has realized morality does not intentionally kill living beings, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, or lie.

original: mngon par rtogs pa de dag las du zhig sa dang sa la nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po spang ba'i gnyen po yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa de dag las du zhig sa dang sa la nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po spang ba'i gnyen po yin zhe na /
translated: From among those realizations, how many are the antidote of abandoning the small, medium, and great afflictions on each level?

original: smras pa / gcig go / lhag ma rnams ni de dang mthun pa dang de'i grogs dag yin gyi spong ba'i gnyen po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go / lhag ma rnams ni de dang mthun pa dang de'i grogs dag yin gyi spong ba'i gnyen po ni ma yin no //
translated: The remaining ones are similar to that and are its companions, but they are not antidotes that abandon.

original: mngon par rtogs pa drug dang yongs su shes pa dgu la /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa drug dang yongs su shes pa dgu la /
translated: There are six realizations and nine complete knowledges.

original: yongs su shes pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine complete knowledges?

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa dang po'o //
translated: The first complete knowledge is the abandonment of the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second complete knowledge is the abandonment of the afflictions of the form and formless realms that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third complete knowledge is the abandonment of the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i lam ma thob bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i lam ma thob bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth complete knowledge is the abandonment of the defilements to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the realm of desire, since one has not yet obtained the path of cultivation in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa lnga pa'o //üîΩgzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i lam mthong bas @278a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa lnga pa'o // gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i lam mthong bas @278a * //
translated: The fifth complete knowledge is the abandonment of the defilements of the realms of form and the formless that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth complete knowledge is the abandonment of the defilements of the realms of form and the formless that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh complete knowledge is the abandonment of the fetters associated with the lower realms.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth complete knowledge is the abandonment of attachment to the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa dgu pa'o //
translated: The ninth complete knowledge is the abandonment of attachment to the formless realm.

original: mngon par rtogs pa drug po de dag las du zhig yongs su shes pa gang gi 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa drug po de dag las du zhig yongs su shes pa gang gi 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: How many of these six realizations are results of which perfect knowledge?

original: smras pa / gcig ni yongs su shes pa dgu'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig ni yongs su shes pa dgu'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: One is the result of nine perfect knowledges.

original: lhag ma rnams ni 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: The others are not results.

original: mngon par rtogs pa de dag las spong ba gnyen po gang yin pa de ci skyes nas spong ba gnyen po yin nam /üîΩ'on te ma skyes pas yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa de dag las spong ba gnyen po gang yin pa de ci skyes nas spong ba gnyen po yin nam / 'on te ma skyes pas yin zhe na /
translated: Among these realizations, which is the antidote that abandons? Is it arisen or not arisen?

original: smras pa / ma skyes pas ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma skyes pas ma yin no //
translated: It is said, It is not not arisen.

original: skyes na yang dus phyi ma ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar nyon mongs pa spong ba dang gnyen po skye ba ni mgo mnyam du blta bar bya'o ;
analyzed: skyes na yang dus phyi ma ni ma yin te / 'di ltar nyon mongs pa spong ba dang gnyen po skye ba ni mgo mnyam du blta bar bya'o ;
translated: Even if it has arisen, it is not in the future.üîΩThus, the abandonment of the afflictions and the arising of the antidote should be viewed as simultaneous.

original: / de la gnyen po skyes pas nyon mongs pa spong ngo zhes bya ba ni nye bar gdags pa dang tha snyad gdags pa dang / brdar gdags pa las bya ba yin no //
analyzed: / de la gnyen po skyes pas nyon mongs pa spong ngo zhes bya ba ni nye bar gdags pa dang tha snyad gdags pa dang / brdar gdags pa las bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement The antidote that has arisen abandons the affliction is a conventional designation, a nominal designation, and a designation by way of metaphor.

original: mngon par rtogs pa de dag las du dag gis 'bras bu gang 'thob ce na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa de dag las du dag gis 'bras bu gang 'thob ce na /
translated: How many of these realizations result in the attainment of which fruit?

original: smras pa / gcig gis ni 'bras bu bzhi po thams cad 'thob bo //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig gis ni 'bras bu bzhi po thams cad 'thob bo //
translated: It is said: One results in the attainment of all four fruits.

original: gcig ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu thob pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshe 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gcig ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu thob pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshe 'byung ngo //
translated: One results in the attainment of the fruit of the ≈õrama·πáa.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gcig po 'thob pa'i grogs yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gcig po 'thob pa'i grogs yin te /
translated: The remaining realizations are the companions of the attainment of one fruit.

original: 'thob pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: 'thob pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: They are the precursors of attainment.

original: mngon par rtogs pa de dag las du dag gis dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed ce na ;
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa de dag las du dag gis dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed ce na ;
translated: How many of these realizations result in the transmutation of the faculties?

original: smras pa / gcig ma gtogs pa lhag ma thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig ma gtogs pa lhag ma thams cad kyis so //
translated: It is said: All except one result in the transmutation of the faculties.

original: mngon par rtogs pa de dag las du dag gis mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can dag mngon par sgrub par byed ce na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa de dag las du dag gis mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can dag mngon par sgrub par byed ce na /
translated: How many of these realizations result in the attainment of special qualities such as the superknowledges?

original: smras pa / gcig ma gtogs pa lhag ma thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig ma gtogs pa lhag ma thams cad kyis so //
translated: It is said: All except one result in the attainment of special qualities.

original: de la bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa ci'i las can du brjod par bya /
analyzed: de la bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa ci'i las can du brjod par bya /
translated: What is the function of the realization of the will?

original: de bzhin du mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i bar yang ci'i las can du brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i bar yang ci'i las can du brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: So too, one should state the function of the other realizations up to the final realization.

original: smras pa / bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa ni yang dag par rtogs pas /üîΩbsdus pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang @278b mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos skyed pa'i las can dang kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba skyed pa'i las can dang / the tshom rnam par zlog pa'i las can dang /
analyzed: smras pa / bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa ni yang dag par rtogs pas / bsdus pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang @278b mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos skyed pa'i las can dang kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba skyed pa'i las can dang / the tshom rnam par zlog pa'i las can dang /
translated: Realization of the mind is realization of the correct view.üîΩIt has the function of generating pure phenomena that are virtuous factors conducive to purification, the function of generating uncontaminated joy and supreme joy, the function of reversing doubt,

original: bsgom pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i las can dang / de las gzhan pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dag skyed pa'i las can dang ; bde 'gror 'gro ba'i las can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i las can dang / de las gzhan pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dag skyed pa'i las can dang ; bde 'gror 'gro ba'i las can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: the function of engaging in meditation, the function of generating other realizations and the function of proceeding to happy rebirths.

original: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa ni dkon mchog rnams la bsam pa dag pa nas mos pa mi g-yo ba skyed pa'i las can dang / yang dag par rtogs pas rnam par byang bar byed pa'i las can dang / de dag las la la bde 'gror 'gro bar byed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa ni dkon mchog rnams la bsam pa dag pa nas mos pa mi g-yo ba skyed pa'i las can dang / yang dag par rtogs pas rnam par byang bar byed pa'i las can dang / de dag las la la bde 'gror 'gro bar byed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: Faith is the realization of the Three Jewels, and its function is to generate unshakable conviction.

original: tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa ni ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal las rnam par thar bar byed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa ni ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal las rnam par thar bar byed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: Morality is the realization of the purification of the three karmas, and its function is to lead to good destinies.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyis 'bras bu thams cad 'thob pa dang yon tan thams cad mngon par bsgrub pas rnam par byang bar byed pa'i las can dang / de las gzhan pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dag skyed pa'i las can dang bde 'gror rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ches 'od gsal ba mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyis 'bras bu thams cad 'thob pa dang yon tan thams cad mngon par bsgrub pas rnam par byang bar byed pa'i las can dang / de las gzhan pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dag skyed pa'i las can dang bde 'gror rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ches 'od gsal ba mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: The function of the knowledge of the realization of the truths is to purify by attaining all the fruits and by accomplishing all the good qualities through the religious life; it has the function of producing the other realizations; and it has the function of producing the very bright result of rebirth in the happy realms.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa dag la dris pa'i lan gdab pa la mkhas pa'i las can dang / mngon par shes pa myur ba nyid kyi las can dang /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i bden pa dag la dris pa'i lan gdab pa la mkhas pa'i las can dang / mngon par shes pa myur ba nyid kyi las can dang /
translated: The function of the knowledge of the realization of the truths that arises from the end of realization is to be skilled in answering questions about the truths that are being realized; it has the function of quick superknowledge;

original: de'i gong ma'i mngon par rtogs pa dag skyed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: de'i gong ma'i mngon par rtogs pa dag skyed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: and it has the function of producing the higher realizations.

original: mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni tshe 'di la mchog tu bde bar gnas pa skyed pa'i las can dang / sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par thar par byed pa'i las can dang / lus tha ma 'dzin pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni tshe 'di la mchog tu bde bar gnas pa skyed pa'i las can dang / sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par thar par byed pa'i las can dang / lus tha ma 'dzin pa'i las can yin no //
translated: The final clear realization has the function of generating supreme bliss in this life, the function of liberating from all suffering, and the function of holding the final body.

original: bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa la rnam pa du yod /
analyzed: bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa la rnam pa du yod /
translated: How many types of clear realization of the will are there?

original: de bzhin du mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i bar la yang rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i bar la yang rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: Similarly, how many types of clear realization are there up to the final clear realization?

original: smras pa / bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa du ma yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa du ma yod de /
translated: It is said: There are many types of clear realization of the will.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mdo'i sde la sems pa dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du @279a * //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sems pa dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du @279a * //
translated: Contemplating the sutra collection, the melody collection, the explanatory collection, the collected sayings, the discipline, the marvelous life stories, the former birth stories, the extensive teachings, the established instructions, and the extensive discourses.

original: bstan pa'i sde nas shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde'i bar la sems pa dang / sdug bsngal la sems pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam la sems pa dang /
analyzed: bstan pa'i sde nas shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde'i bar la sems pa dang / sdug bsngal la sems pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam la sems pa dang /
translated: It is to contemplate the categories of the teachings, from the category of the extensive teachings up to the category of the teachings that are definitive statements. It is to contemplate suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

original: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings la sems pa dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa la sems pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la sems pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sems pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings la sems pa dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa la sems pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la sems pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sems pa dang /
translated: It is to contemplate suchness, the limit of reality, and the expanse of reality. It is to contemplate the aggregates, the elements, the sense sources, and so on. It is to contemplate the vehicle of the hearers, the vehicle of the solitary buddhas,

original: theg pa chen po la sems pa dang / de ltar de lta bu dang / mthun pa la sems pa dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la sems pa dang / de ltar de lta bu dang / mthun pa la sems pa dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the Great Vehicle. It is to contemplate in such and similar ways. It should be known that there are infinite such contemplations.

original: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa ni 'das pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang de dag gi chos dang de dag gi dge 'dun yang dag par rjes su dran pa dang / 'das pa'i ji lta ba de bzhin du 'ongs pa dang /
analyzed: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa ni 'das pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang de dag gi chos dang de dag gi dge 'dun yang dag par rjes su dran pa dang / 'das pa'i ji lta ba de bzhin du 'ongs pa dang /
translated: Realization of faith is to perfectly recall the past perfect buddhas, their dharma and their sangha and to do the same for the future and the present.üîΩ

original: da ltar byung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dang de las gzhan pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag gi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / de dag gi chos dang de dag gi dge 'dun yang dag par rjes su dran pa'i dad pa mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dang de las gzhan pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag gi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / de dag gi chos dang de dag gi dge 'dun yang dag par rjes su dran pa'i dad pa mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: Realization of faith is the recollection of the perfect buddhas of the past, their Dharma and their Sangha and the faith that realizes that just as it was in the past, so it is in the present.

original: / tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu spang ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / de bzhin du sems kyi rgyud kyi rab tu dbye ba rgyun du zhugs pa'i sems kyi rgyud nas /
analyzed: / tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu spang ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / de bzhin du sems kyi rgyud kyi rab tu dbye ba rgyun du zhugs pa'i sems kyi rgyud nas /
translated: Realization of ethics is the classification of abandoning the ten nonvirtuous actions by nature and the classification of the mental continuum from the mental continuum of a stream enterer.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar gyi sems kyi rgyud dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyi rab tu dbye bas rnam pa du ma yod do //üîΩmngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam gyi yan lag byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos kyi rab tu dbye bas rnam pa du ma yod do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar gyi sems kyi rgyud dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyi rab tu dbye bas rnam pa du ma yod do // mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam gyi yan lag byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos kyi rab tu dbye bas rnam pa du ma yod do //
translated: The continuum of mind of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, the continuum of mind of the pratyekabuddha, the continuum of mind of the bodhisattva, and the continuum of mind of the tathƒÅgata are differentiated in many ways.üîΩThe knowledge of clear realization of the truths is differentiated in many ways by the divisions of the applications of mindfulness, right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, factors of awakening, and path factors that are factors conducive to awakening.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the knowledge of clear realization of the truths is differentiated in many ways by the divisions of the applications of mindfulness, right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, factors of awakening, and path factors that are factors conducive to awakening,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / @279b mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / @279b mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The cognition that arises from the culmination of clear realization is the clear realization of the truths. The ultimate clear realization should be understood in the same way.

original: mngon par rtogs pa de dag ming gang dang mngon par brjod pa gang gis rnam par 'jog pa de'i ngo bo nyid yin par brjod par bya'am /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa de dag ming gang dang mngon par brjod pa gang gis rnam par 'jog pa de'i ngo bo nyid yin par brjod par bya'am /
translated: Should the names and expressions by which those clear realizations are established be said to be their reality?

original: 'on te de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Or should they not be said to be their reality?

original: smras pa / tha snyad las ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / tha snyad las ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is said: From the conventional, they should be said to be their reality.

original: don dam par ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: From the ultimate, they should not be said to be their reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos nyid kyis chos thams cad kyi don brjod du med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos nyid kyis chos thams cad kyi don brjod du med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this way, all phenomena are inexpressible by nature.

original: de la bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa rgyu gang las byung /
analyzed: de la bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa rgyu gang las byung /
translated: What is the cause of the clear realization of the mind?

original: 'bras bu gang yin ;
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin ;
translated: What is its result?

original: de bzhin du mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i bar yang rgyu gang las byung 'bras bu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i bar yang rgyu gang las byung 'bras bu gang yin zhe na /
translated: Similarly, what is the cause of the final clear knowledge? What is its result?

original: smras pa / bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems kyi rgyud yongs su smin pa dang ; tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems kyi rgyud yongs su smin pa dang ; tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: It is said: The clear knowledge of the will arises from the cause of the appearance of the Buddha, from the cause of relying on holy men, from the cause of listening to the holy Dharma, from the cause of the maturation of the mental stream, and from the cause of proper mental attention.

original: las gang dang ldan pa de'i 'bras bu can yin na //
analyzed: las gang dang ldan pa de'i 'bras bu can yin na //
translated: It is the result of the action of one who possesses it.

original: bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa thams cad kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa thams cad kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the clear knowledge of the will, so also all clear knowledge should be understood.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: But there is this difference:

original: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa ni de las gzhan pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: dad pa mngon par rtogs pa ni de las gzhan pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin no //
translated: The clear knowledge of faith arises from the cause of the other clear knowledges.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yang bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yang bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin la /
translated: Likewise, the realization of morality and the knowledge of realization that is the realization of the truths arises from the cause of the realization of intention.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin /
translated: It also arises from the cause of the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrative insight.

original: rang gi rigs kyi rgyu las byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi rgyu las byung ba yang yin no //
translated: It also arises from the cause of its own type.

original: de bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yang mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yang mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin no //
translated: Likewise, the knowledge that arises from the end of realization and the realization of the truths arises from the cause of the knowledge of realization that is the realization of the truths.

original: mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The ultimate realization is also like that.

original: mngon par rtogs pa drug dang / mtshan nyid so sor rig pa la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa bdun po dag ci mngon par rtogs pa drug gis yid la byed pa bdun bsdus sam /üîΩ'on te yid @280a * //üîΩla byed pa bdun gyis mngon par rtogs pa drug bsdus she na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa drug dang / mtshan nyid so sor rig pa la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa bdun po dag ci mngon par rtogs pa drug gis yid la byed pa bdun bsdus sam / 'on te yid @280a * // la byed pa bdun gyis mngon par rtogs pa drug bsdus she na /
translated: Or are the six clear realizations included in the seven attentions?

original: smras pa / mngon par rtogs pa gnyis ni yid la byed pa gang gis kyang ma bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / mngon par rtogs pa gnyis ni yid la byed pa gang gis kyang ma bsdus so //
translated: Two clear realizations are not included in any attention.

original: gcig gi dga' ba sdud pas bsdus so //üîΩgcig ni dga' ba sdud pa dang / dpyod pa'i yid la byed pas bsdus so //
analyzed: gcig gi dga' ba sdud pas bsdus so // gcig ni dga' ba sdud pa dang / dpyod pa'i yid la byed pas bsdus so //
translated: One is included in the attention that delights and gathers.üîΩOne is included in the attention that delights and gathers and the attention that analyzes.

original: gcig ni rab tu dben pa las byung ba dang / dga' ba sdud pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pas bsdus so //
analyzed: gcig ni rab tu dben pa las byung ba dang / dga' ba sdud pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pas bsdus so //
translated: One is included in the attention that arises from isolation, the attention that delights and gathers and the attention that culminates in application.

original: gcig ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bus bsdus so //
analyzed: gcig ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bus bsdus so //
translated: One is included in the result of the attention that culminates in application.

original: yid la byed pa lhag ma 'di lta ste mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa dang / mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu mthun pas bsdus pa yin pas mngon par rtogs pas ma bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa lhag ma 'di lta ste mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa dang / mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu mthun pas bsdus pa yin pas mngon par rtogs pas ma bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining mental attentions are as follows: the mental attention of discerning the characteristics, and the mental attention arisen from belief, are included in the natural outcome of clear realization, and so should be understood as not included in clear realization.
